She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move in a positive direction as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: to purchase hair care products, skin products, and bleaching creams

loans.name: Sagrada Familia Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Sagrada Familia  está en su ciclo número 5 del programa de comité, este grupo es de la ciudad de Concepción, la cual es una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aún se encuentra en crecimiento. Es una zona bien rural, por lo que las integrantes de este grupo quieren luchar por ir creciendo y dar a la zona donde viven un mejor ambiente y que vayan creciendo.
La Sra.  De Las Nieves es una de las integrantes,  ella es la presidenta de este grupo, quien motiva a sus compañeras a poder trabajar y mejorar,  tiene su pequeño negocio de ventas variadas, como también de recepción, globo loco y algunos accesorios para cumpleaños infantiles. Ella es una persona muy emprendedora, que hace todo tipo de trabajo, eso para poder ayudar a su familia y darles lo que necesitan y no tener que pasar por privaciones.
Pide este crédito para la compra de insumos varios para la venta, como aceite, jabones, leche, galletitas y demás. Esta agradecida por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
The group named "Sagrada Familia" (Sacred Family) is in its fifth loan cycle of the committee program. This group is from the city of Concepción, which is located slightly outside the district center and in the middle of a growth period. This area is mostly rural, but the members of the group want to grow and transform the area where they live into a better environment where they can keep growing.

Sra. De Las Nieves is one of the members and the president of the group. She motivates her fellow group members to work and improve. De Las Nieves has a small business where she sells assorted merchandise but she also offers reception supplies, inflatable bouncy houses, and a few accessories for children's parties. She is an enterprising individual who has done all types of work. As a result, she has been able to help her family and provide them with what they need so that they are not deprived.

De Las Nieves is requesting a loan so that she can buy various items to sell such as oil, soap, milk, cookies, and other products. She is grateful for the opportunity she has received.

loans.use: to buy oil, soap, milk, cookies, and other products to sell.

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras De La Ensenada Group

texts.es: El Sr Luis de 69 años es casado y tiene 05 hijos mayores de edad todos independientes. El es socio del grupo “TRIUNFADORAS DE LA ENSENADA”  grupo conformado por 09 integrantes. El Sr. Luis se dedica al comercio, por muchos atiende su bodega donde vende toda clase de productos comestibles son varios años de experiencia en este rubro por lo mismo su clientela es muy asidua y acuden con frecuencia a su negocio. El préstamo que ha solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de productos para su negocio. Su mayor deseo es ampliar su bodega y surtirla de variados productos para obtener mejores ingresos. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por este préstamo. El Sr. Luis  se encuentra en la foto de la izquierda está sentado y viste casaca ploma,  la foto del grupo se tomo e 2 locaciones una parte en la oficina y otra en su localidad.
texts.en:
Luis is 69 years old, married, and has 5 adult children, all of them independent. He belongs to the Triunfadoras de la Ensenada Group, which is composed of 9 members. Luis is dedicated to commerce. Many customers come to his general store where he sells all class of food products. He has various years of experience in this field and his customers are very dependable, visiting his business frequently.
The loan he is requesting will be invested in purchasing merchandise for his business.
Luis' greatest desire is to expand his general store and stock it with a variety of products in order to obtain a better income.
The group is grateful to Kiva investors for this loan. Luis may be seen in the photo seated on the left wearing a lead-colored jacket. The photo of the group was taken in 2 locations, one part in the office and the other in the members' locality.

loans.use: to buy products to sell.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances Efua did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, she sells cassavas and yams in her village called Yabiw (near Takoradi). She has been in this business for about seven years. She is married to a farmer and together they have two children. 

Efua uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. She will use the loan to increase her inventory, which will aid her in improving her overall cassava and yam sales. Efua wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to increase her inventory, which will aid her in improving her overall cassava and yam sales.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: La señora  Lucia está casada y tiene hijos dependientes,  es de familia humilde y vive en la zona sud de la ciudad de Cochabamba; se dedica a la producción de leche cruda, pero la misma bajo debido a que su ganado no está siendo muy bien alimentado, por ello solicita un crédito de Bs. 10200 para comprar alimento balanceado y soya para su ganado, junto a un grupo de personas que realizaran la compra en conjunto.
texts.en:
Sra. Lucia is married and has dependent children. Her humble family lives in an area that is south of the city of Cochabamba.

Lucia's business involves producing raw milk. However, production has been low because her cows are not well-fed. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 10,200 BOB in order to buy balanced feed and soybeans for her cows. She is part of a group in which the members will purchase supplies at the same time.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed and soybeans for her cows.

loans.name: Manuel Alfonso

texts.es:
Manuel Alfonso tiene 46 años de edad vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Mocupe, su población se dedica al comercio, ganadería y agricultura, es una comunidad tranquila a una hora con cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno y venta de animales menores que los ofrece en el mercado de la zona.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles comprar alimentos balanceados teniendo así una mejor producción para vender a sus clientes y una segunda parte para la compra de cerdos, generando ingresos adicionales para su familia.
texts.en: Manuel Alfonso, 46, lives with his wife and children in the Mocupe district. The residents of this quiet community, located an hour and forty-five minutes from the city of Chiclayo on Peru's north coast, are merchants, cattle ranchers, and farmers. Manuel raises cattle and sells small animals at the local market. He has applied for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles to buy balanced animal feed to increase output to sell to his customers and also to buy pigs to generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Aileen is 52 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Aileen has a food vending business in the Philippines. Aileen requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks like juices, snack foods and other ingredients for her business. Aileen has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future, Aileen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks like juices, snack foods and other ingredients for her business

loans.name: Asteria

texts.en:
Asteria is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Asteria is 60 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Asteria has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Asteria requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell. Asteria has been in this business for 7 years. 

Asteria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Ainagul

texts.ru: Айнагул 52 года, не замужем, одна воспитывает 1 сына. У Айнагул - высшее образование, работает налоговым инспектором в своем районе. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Айнагул занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 22 года назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Айнагул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 5 овец, а также имеет земельный надел размером 0,30 ГА, на котором выращивает клевер. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). Айнагул входит в группу "Киреше", в эту группу входят еще 2 человека. В итоге их трое. Айнагул является лидером группы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айнагул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычка для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Айнагул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку авто для сына.
texts.en: Ainagul is 52 years old,  she is not married and raises one son alone.  Ainagul has a college education, she works as a tax inspector in her area.  As a source of additional income for her family, Ainagul raises livestock and farms, having started 22 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 5,000 som KGS.  Thanks to Ainagul's hard work, today she has 1 milk cow, 5 sheep, and also has has a plot of land the size of 0.3 hectares where she grows clover.  Her monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS).  Ainagul is part of a group "Kireshe," 2 other people are part of this group.  In total, there are three of them.  Ainagul is the leader of the group.  In order to further grow her business, Ainagul turned to the Microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of a calf in order to increase her livestock count.  Ainagul plans to invest the profits from her loan to further increase her livestock count and plans to save resources to purchase a car for her son.

loans.use: to buy a calf

loans.name: Chi

texts.en:
Chi is requesting a new loan to buy better quality clothes at competitive prices from wholesalers. Chi's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her to increase the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 48 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is single and has 4 children, three of whom are in school and all of whom live at home. Since 1999, Esther has been operating a small shop where she sells biscuits, juice, soft drinks, etc. She has a lot of customers and she makes a lot of money which is helping her to look after her children. 

Esther is requesting a loan to purchase biscuits, juice, soft drinks, etc. for her business. In the future, she plans to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase biscuits, juice, soft drinks, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en: Oretha is 49 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and has four children between the ages of 14 and 27, two of whom attend school. For the past five years, Oretha has been selling frozen fish in the local market. She started with 1,000 Liberian dollars. She is requesting a loan to purchase three cartons of frozen fish. She plans to buy land and build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase three cartons of frozen fish.

loans.name: Lila Keyla

texts.es:
Lila Keyla tiene 37 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Lagunas, su población se dedica al cultivo de caña y arroz, comercio de animales menores y ganadería, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza en su propio domicilio, con los ingresos que genera apoya con los gastos familiares, su esposo se dedica a labores agrícolas.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para comprar abarrotes y colocar una bodega con lo que generara mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Lila Keyla is 37 years old and lives with her husband in the District of Lagunas. Her town is known for the cultivation of sugar cane and rice, as well as for trading small animals and cattle. This area is located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo, which is on the northern coast of Peru.

Lila Keyla sells beauty products from her home. The income she generates allows her to contribute toward the family expenses. Her husband engages in farm work.

Lila Keyla is requesting a loan of 2,000 PEN so that she can buy groceries in order to open a store. This would allow her to generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries so that she can open a store.

loans.name: Santos Nicolas

texts.es:
Santos Nicolás tiene 60 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en Santa Rosa, una zona rural de Oyotún su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

En su domicilio tiene un pequeño negocio crianza y venta de animales de corral, en los últimos meses junto a su esposa han visto la oportunidad de de llevar sus animales a los caseríos aledaños, donde los ofrecen a un buen precio.

El ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para construir un dormitorio en su vivienda y de esta manera tener un lugar seguro y agradable donde residir.
texts.en:
Santos Nicolas is 60 years old and lives with his wife in a rural area of Oyotún, which is two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru. The people who live in this area are known for working in agriculture, livestock and other businesses. 

Santos Nicolas has a small business raising and selling small farm animals. He runs his business from his home. Santos Nicolas says that for the past few months he and his wife have seen the opportunity to sell their animals in neighboring villages, where they are offered good prices.

Santos Nicolas is requesting this loan from the field partner for 1,000 PEN to build a bedroom in his house. He says that this will make his home safer and more comfortable.

loans.use: to build a bedroom in his house.

loans.name: Milton Daniel

texts.es:
Milton Daniel tiene 39 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en Nueva Arica una zona rural de la ciudad de Chiclayo, su población se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, en la costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su familia se dedican a la crianza y comercialización de animales, son muy conocidos en la zona, Milton nos explica que se dedican a esta actividad hace más de 10 años.

El ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 700 nuevos soles para comprar pavos y cerdos para posteriormente engordarlos y ofrecerlos a un mejor precio, también la compra de gallinas ponedoras porque es un negocio rentable en la zona y de esta manera tener mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Milton Daniel, 39, lives with his wife and children in Nueva Arica, a rural area of the city of Chiclayo on Peru's north coast, where the residents farm and raise livestock. He and his family raise and sell animals and are well-known in the area. Milton says this has been his trade for more than 10 years. He has applied for a loan of 1700 nuevos soles to buy turkeys and pigs to fatten and sell at a good price and to buy laying hens because that is a profitable business in the area and because he can earn more for his family.

loans.use: to buy turkeys, pigs, and laying hens.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Juana, es madre soltera, vive con su hija, tres sobrinas y sus tres pequeños nietos, junto a ellos ella disfruta ser madre, abuela y tía. Debido a la necesidad de proporcionarle alimento, vestuario y salud a su familia, empezó a vender pupusas frente a la Unidad de Salud de su localidad, es un negocio que le da los ingresos necesarios para salir adelante.
Invertirá en la compra de chicharrón, frijoles, quesillo, variedad de bebidas, para tener suficiente materia prima y trabajar sin que le falte nada para atender a sus clientes. Espera mejorar su economía, crecer en su negocio y seguir satisfaciendo a sus clientes.
Juana sueña con construir un chalet adecuado para dar una mejor imagen ante las personas que visitan la Unidad de Salud, dar a su familia mejor alimentación y ahorrar para que sus nietos tengan una educación de calidad.
texts.en:
Juana is a single mother.  She lives with her daughter, three nieces, and her three small grandchildren.  Together with them she enjoys being a mother, grandmother, and aunt.  Out of the necessity of providing food, clothing, and good health to her family, she started selling ‘pupusas’ [stuffed griddle corn cakes] in front of the health center in her area.  It is a business that gives her the needed income in order to get ahead.

She will use the loan to buy ‘chicharrón’ [fried pork rinds], beans, cheese, and a variety of drinks in order to have enough raw materials and to work with everything needed to tend to her customers.

She hopes to improve her finances, to grow in her business, and to continue satisfying her customers.  Juana dreams of building a suitable stand in order to make a better impression on the people who go to the health center, of giving her family better food, and of saving so that her grandchildren will have a quality education.

loans.use: to buy ‘chicharrón’ [fried pork rinds], beans, cheese, and a variety of drinks.

loans.name: Santos Cayetano

texts.es:
Santos, solicita de nuevo un crédito para comprar  fertilizantes, plaguicidas, abono y pagar la recolección de la cosecha, el préstamo anterior le ayudo a tener una cosecha abundante, sus ganancias fueron mayores y pudo cancelar sus deudas.
Su economía es más estable, ha mantenido su negocio más estable, su familia está disfrutando de  una mejor alimentación y se encuentran saludables,
texts.en: Santos has applied for a new loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and manure and to pay harvesters. The previous loan helped him produce a great harvest. His profit was higher, and he was able to pay off his loan. His finances and his business are stable, and his family members are eating better and are healthy.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and manure and to pay harvesters.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is married and has children. She works hard to support her family. Amalia operates a vulcanizing shop in the Philippines, which she has been doing for nine years.

Amalia is requesting a loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional tools and spare parts for her business. In the future, Amalia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase tools and spare parts for her business

loans.name: Kaneezan

texts.en: Kaneezan is a 33-year-old single lady. She has been running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan of for PKR 25,000 which she will use to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way, she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en: Bushra is a 25-year-old single lady. Four years ago, she initiated her business sewing clothes to support her family for a better future.  She stitches for the people living around her house and has retained many customers. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 30,000. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread along with packs of needles, buttons and zippers. It will allow her to stitch up more dresses on time. She expects a boost in her earnings and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread along with packs of needles, buttons and zippers.

loans.name: Shakila

texts.en:
Shakila is a 29-year-old married woman. She has been running a business selling animals in her community. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and sells them near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslims countries). She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. 

Currently, Shakila requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase two more calves. She is in her 2nd loan cycle with good repayment history.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en: Bushra is a married woman. She has successfully built her business stitching bed sheets, covers and pillows with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She is passionate about her work and client demand is strong.  But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day as her husband does not earn enough to support his family well. Bushra is the best earning resource in her household. Currently, she is in her 5th loan cycle and applied for a loan of PKR 50,000. This will help her to purchase a new sewing machine along with spools of thread and cloth in different colors. It will allow her to complete the orders of her customers on time. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine along with spools of thread and cloth in different colors.

loans.name: Kosar

texts.en:
Kosar is 46 year old and married. She is a hardworking woman who is helping her family by providing tailoring in her community, which she has been doing for eight years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operations of her business, Kosar is requesting her third loan for 40,000 PKR, which she will use to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of zippers and buttons to meet up with the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to purchase threads in different colors, packs of zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
Dina es una persona muy honesta, que de aquí a cierto tiempo se veo como toda una licenciada que ayudará a todas las personas necesitadas y en especial a mi mama que es una persona enferma y a sus abuelos que espera sigan viviendo mucho tiempo más.
Dina está estudiando la carrera de enfermería y su anhelo es poder ayudar a las personas que necesiten de ella. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas y también para poder cubrir sus gastos de manutención. Esta agradecida por esta oportunidad que recibe.
texts.en:
Dina is a very honest person. She will eventually complete her degree so that she can help everyone in need, especially her mother who is ill, as well as her grandparents, who she hopes will continue to live much longer.

Dina is studying for a degree in Nursing. Her wish is to be able to assist people who need her help. Dina is requesting this loan so that she can invest in the payment of her tuition and also her living expenses. She is grateful for the opportunity she has received.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition and living expenses.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: Gracias a su credikiva, Jaime fortalece el capital de su negocio, mejora su liquidez, y se incrementan las ventas obteniendo más utilidades. Su negocio está más organizado por el respaldo económico y tiene mayor esperanza en mejorar su vida familiar. Esto fue así porque con el crédito anterior,  lo invirtió en comprar al por mayor y de contado insumos y materias primas, para elaborar comidas en el restaurante y para su negocio de comidas rápidas, también le alcanzó este financiamiento, para comprar refrescos como gaseosas y jugos que complementaron su oferta. Él dice a sus financiadores de Kiva : Estoy muy agradecido con Kiva y con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que me ha permitido fortalecer el capital de trabajo de mi negocio. “ En la actualidad Jaime está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará en mayor volumen, de contado y a un buen precio, carnes, arroz, aceite, verduras, legumbres, condimentos, gaseosas y jugos . Con esta inversión repite su éxito, pues la realizará en la época más comercial del año, el último bimestre, donde las festividades familiares, incrementan su demanda y el lógicamente tendrá en su oferta todos los productos que su clientela requiera.
texts.en:
Thanks to his Kiva loan, Jaime is strengthening the capital of his business, improving his liquidity, and increasing the sales, thereby obtaining more profits. His business is more organized due to the economic support and he has more hope of improving his family life. 

This was that way because with the previous loan. He invested it in the purchase in bulk and cash of supplies and basic ingredients, in order to make food in the restaurant and for his fast food business. This financing also let him purchase refreshments like sodas and juices which complemented his offerings. 

He says to his Kiva lenders: "I am very thankful for Kiva and the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, which have allowed me to strengthen the working capital of my business." Currently, Jaime is applying for a Kiva loan, through which he will buy in bigger volume, in cash and at a good price, meat, rice, oil, vegetables, legumes, condiments, sodas, and juices. 

With this investment he is repeating his success, which he will make during the most commercial time of the year, the last two months, when the family holidays increase demand and he logically will have for sale all of the products that his customers require.

loans.use: to buy meat, rice, oil, vegetables, legumes, condiments, sodas, and juices

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Paulina tiene 30 años, está casada con Fortunato de 33 años y tiene una hija que vive con ella en su vivienda hecha a base de material noble junto a su esposo. Desde muy niña creció en el campo junto a sus padres y es donde aprendió a desempeñar el oficio de la agricultura que es actualmente su principal sustento económico.Con el paso de los años y al alcanzar mayoría de edad heredó unos terrenos por parte de sus padres quienes reconocieron su labor abnegada que brindó desde muy joven. Su labor la desempeña con el apoyo de su pareja con quien viene llevando a cabo su campaña productiva y contando en ocasiones con el apoyo de trabajadores para tareas complicadas o colectivas. Con el objetivo de mejorar la calidad de sus cosechas suele usar abono orgánico.Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está oportunidad desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Paulina, 30, is married to Fortunato, 33, and has a daughter who lives with her and her husband in their well-made house. She grew up in the countryside with her parents, who taught her how to farm, and this is now her main income source. When she reached adulthood, she inherited land from her parents, who recognized how hard she had worked over the years. She now farms with her husband, with whom she plants the crops. Sometimes, she hires other workers to do difficult tasks and to harvest. 

To improve her harvests, she usually buys manure. This is her fourth loan cycle with Kiva, and she is grateful for the funding she receives to keep going. She promises to make her payments on time. She has applied to Kiva for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Libia

texts.es:
Gracias por apoyar a Libia, quien en sus tres negocios le fue muy bien, pues compró materiales con los cuales elaboró sandalias y materias primas e insumos como harina de trigo y queso, con los que elaboró sus deditos fritos, e invirtió en las ofertas de productos que llegaron a buenos precios en su catálogo.
Ella dice a sus financiadores de Kiva “Que sigan llenando de alegría a las familias que más lo necesitamos” 
Como se acerca la temporada de fin de año, está planeando hacer nuevos diseños de sandalias y para ello está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, mediante el cual comprará hebillas, suelas, pegantes  cuero y accesorios, con los cuales impactar a su clientela en la época de las festividades y hacer su mejor venta, lo cual se constituye en el éxito de su credikiva.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Libia, who did very well with her three businesses. She bought materials to make sandals, and ingredients and supplies like wheat flour and cheese with which she made her fried sticks. Also, she invested in those products of her offer range which sold at good prices.

She lets the Kiva lenders know that they "continually fill the lives of the families who need it most with joy".

As the end of the year is approaching, she plans to make new designs of sandals and is therefore applying for a new kiva credit.  She will use it to buy buckles, soles, leather glue and accessories. With these she wants to make an impact on her customers in the festive season and make her best sale, which she can achieve with the Kiva credit.

loans.use: to buy buckles, soles, leather glue and accessories

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es: Manuel es un señor originario de la ciudad de Niquinomo, Masaya. De 48 años de edad, casado y padre de dos hijos ya independientes. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de juguetes. Negocio que inicio hace varios años, incentivado por sus padres quienes tenían sus propios negocios perecederos en el mercado de la ciudad, poco a poco opto por tener su propio negocio de ropa. Hoy en día cuenta con el negocio de venta de juguetes. Su meta próxima es extender su negocio y diversificarlo. Solicita el crédito para comprar: carritos, muñecas, balones etc., toda una variedad de juguetes. Con el fin de brindar una variedad de mercadería en la ciudad. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que crecerá su inventario y podrá suplir con la demanda de los clientes, y sobre todo incrementara sus ganancias. Su plan futuro es seguir creciendo y aumentando el negocio.
texts.en:
Manuel was born in Niquinomo, Masaya. He is 48, married, and the father of two grown children. He is a merchant who sells toys. He started this business some years ago, encouraged by his parents, who sold perishable goods at the city market. He gradually built his business selling clothing, though today he sells toys.

His goal is to grow and diversify his business. He has applied for a loan to buy a variety of toys like carts, dolls, and balls and offer a range of merchandise in the city. He believes the loan will be helpful because he will be able to increase inventory, meet customer demand, and, most of all, increase his earnings. He plan is to keep growing his business.

loans.use: to buy carts, dolls, balls, etc.

loans.name: Iram

texts.en:
Iram is 27 years old and married.  She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of PKR  20,000 from the Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors, along with the packs of laces, zippers, and buttons. 

It will allow her to stitch up more dresses in less time. She wants to expand her business to provide a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy more thread in different colors along with laces, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Zakria

texts.en:
Zakria is 24 years old, and he lives in Sana`a, Yemen. 

He offers phone accessories and sells mobile recharge cards to meet the demands of his clients. He has been in the business for three years. He started his business with limited capital. 

He describes his business environment as competitive, because many people do the same business. He also describes his business as more service than financial profit, so his clients are satisfied with him. 

He has applied for a loan of YER 200,000 from AMB to buy additional products such as mobile recharge cards and mobile phones for his business. In the future, he hopes to expand his business more so that enables him to increase his profit.

loans.use: to buy mobile recharge cards and mobile phones for his business.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is 42 years old, married, and has five children. She sells cloths in her community. She buys cloths of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Parveen is requesting a loan from Kashf Foundation for 20,000 PKR, which she will use to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. Parveen expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend the part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase cloths in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 26 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and has a 4-year-old child who is in school and lives at home. For the past nine years, she has been selling used clothes from a table in the market. She established the business with money that she received from her parents. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. She enjoys the profit she makes every time. Her plan is to educate her child.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Zakia

texts.en:
Zakia is 34 years old and married, the mother of three children. She has been running a business selling cloths for many years. 

She purchases a variety of cloths from the main city and then sells them to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloths in her community. 

Zakia requested a loan of PKR 35,000 from the Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different cloths for the winter season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She is in her seventh loan cycle with good repayment history. 

She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business

loans.use: to buy a stock of different cloths for the winter season.

loans.name: Nutepe Group

texts.fr:
Akouvi est une femme âgée de 31 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle fait partir du groupe "NUTEPE", groupe de femme dynamique de leur quartier. Elle a commencé le commerce des œufs et boites de conserve depuis l'année 2008 à la devanture de sa maison. Elle s'approvisionne en œuf chaque semaine dans une ferme d’élevage dans un quartier périphérique de Lomé. Akouvi contribue efficacement aux besoins de sa famille et surtout investit dans l'éducation de leurs enfants. Les 11 autres membres du groupe exercent le petit commerce dans leur quartier et au delà des activités de crédit, elles s'entraident entre  elles surtout pour se partager les expériences et meiux vivre dans leur ménage.
Ce crédit que Akouvi sollicite lui permettra d'acheter 15 plateaux d’œufs et 2 cartons de boîtes de conserve.
texts.en: Akouvi is a 31 year old woman. She is a member of the Nutepe Group, a group of dynamic women in the same district. She started selling eggs and tinned food out of her own house in 2008. She gets her supplies of eggs weekly from a farm in an outlying district of Lomé. Akouvi efficiently contributes to her family's needs, especially towards her children's educations. The 11 other group members carry out their retail business in their district and outside of the loan businesses, they collaborate with each other in order to share their experiences and improve their home lives. The loan Akouvi is requesting will allow her to to purchase 15 trays of eggs and 2 boxes of tinned food.

loans.use: to purchase 15 trays of eggs and 2 boxes of tinned food

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
Sergio tiene 49 años, está casado con Ricardina de 46 años  y vive junto a sus hijos en su vivienda hecha a base de adobe. Se caracteriza por ser un hombre muy abnegado para el trabajo agrícola. Posee un terreno de 2 hectáreas y media donde hace mas de 20 años cultiva varios de los productos mas rentables de su zona como es el cacao orgánico, barbasco; entre otros.Su labor lo desempeña con el firme apoyo de su esposa y con trabajadores que suele contratar para tiempos puntuales como el retiro de maleza y cosecha de sus productos. 
Desde que se inició en este oficio siempre tuvo el deseo de contar con un vehículo propio para facilitar el transporte de sus productos hasta los centros de acopio y es por ello que gracias a los ahorros que fue acumulando logró cumplir su objetivo adquiriendo un pequeño camión que actualmente también le ayuda a obtener ingresos adicionales transportando los productos de otras parcelas recibiendo buenas ganancias por sus servicios. Es el primer préstamo que solicita a Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Desea en esta oportunidad contar con 3,000 nuevo soles para la compra de un pequeño terreno donde planea expandir sus plantaciones y obtener mejores ingresos a futuro.
texts.en:
Sergio is 49 years old and is married to 46-year-old Ricardina.  They live with their children in their adobe house.  Sergio is very self-sacrificing in his agricultural work.  He has a 2.5 hectare plot of land and it is there that, for over 20 years, he has grown various profitable products, which are common in the area, including organic cocoa, barbasco, and more.  Sergio receives the firm support of his wife and of workers, whom he usually hires for busy periods such as the weeding period and when harvesting the products.

Since starting this work, Sergio has always wanted to have his own vehicle to make transporting products to store easier.  Thanks to his savings, which  slowly grew, Sergio was able to achieve his objective and by a small lorry which also helps him to earn an income helping farmers on other land to transport their goods.  Sergio makes a good profit with this service.  This is the first Kiva loan that Sergio has applied for and he is very grateful for this financial support that he is receiving to help him get ahead.  He promises to make his repayments on time.

On this occasion, Sergio is applying for 3000 Nuevo Soles in order to buy a small plat of land where he plans to expand his crops and, in the future, earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy a small plot of farming land.

loans.name: Marleny Antonia

texts.es:
Marleny, es una mujer que lucha por lo mejor de sí a su familia, es madre soltera, vive junto a sus hijos, ella es la que tiene la responsabilidad de que no falte nada en su hogar. Se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y a cultivar maíz y frijoles. Trabaja de forma independiente y su horario es variado, lo practica desde hace 15 años
Con la inversión comprara cerdos y concentrado para alimentarlos, le ayudara a fortalecer el negocio, tener mejores utilidades, cancelar la deuda.
Sueña con tener los recursos para darles educación universitaria a sus hijos, tener un negocio estable y  más rentable.
texts.en:
Marleny is a single mother who fights to give her family the best. She lives with her children, and she says that she is responsible for ensuring that they have everything they need. Marleny raises pigs, and she farms corn and beans. For 15 years she has been working independently, with hours that vary.

Marleny is requesting this loan to buy pigs and nutritionally balanced feed for them. She says that the loan will help her to strengthen her business, improve her earnings and pay off her debt. Marleny says that she dreams of having the means to pay for a university education for her children, as well having a stable and more profitable business.

loans.use: to buy pigs and nutritionally balanced feed.

loans.name: Dúo Grande Solo Dios Group

texts.es: Dúo Grande solo Dios. este Dúo esta conformado por la señora Susana de 47 años de edad, ella se ha dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tejidos tipicos desde hace varios años, en el primer credito ella fue muy puntual en sus pagos ya que es la forma de como dovolverles la ayuda que le brindaron en su negocio, esperando que nuevamente le puedan ayudar, el credito lo esta solicitando para la compra de mas materia prima para la elaboracion de tejidos ya que se aserca la epoca de fin de año y es cuando mas demanda tiene de sus clientes, esperando contar con ustedes nuevamente Dios los bendiga.
texts.en:
The "Grande solo Dios" due

One member of this duo is 47-year-old Susana.  She has been making a living producing and selling typical woollen products for some years.  Susana was punctual with the repayments on her first loan as this was how she could return the help given to her business.  Susana hopes that you can help her again.  She is applying for a loan in order to buy basic supplies for producing and preparing typical woollen products as the holiday season is approaching and it is in this period that she has the highest number of customers.  She hopes to able to count on you again.   God bless.

loans.use: to buy basic supplies for producing and preparing typical woollen products.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos es un joven soltero, de 19 años de edad, quien vive junto a sus padres, en el Departamento de Sololá.
 Actualmente se dedica a la agricultura cultivando papa, zanahoria y coliflor a unos metros de su vivienda. Comenta que por falta de recursos económicos se vio a la necesidad de retirarse de sus estudios. Por lo que ahora cuenta con este trabajo que le ha ayuda aportar a la economía de su familia.
El está solicitando un préstamo de Q 2,500.00 para la compra de insumos agrícolas como; semillas de papa, abono químico y orgánico,  como también para el pago de mano de obra para cultivar.
Su sueño más grande es poder construir una casa propia en donde pueda brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos is 19 years old and single.  He lives with his parents in the Sololá department.

Carlos currently makes a living in farming, growing potatoes, carrots, and cauliflowers, just a few metres from his home.  Carlos tells us that, due to a lack of money, he needed to drop his studies.  He now has this work, which has helped him to support his family financially.

Carlos is applying for a loan of 2,500 Qetzal in order to buy farming supplies, such as potato seeds, organic and chemical fertilisers, and to pay labourers to work the land.

Carlos' biggest dream is to be able to build his own house so that he can offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds, and chemical and organic  fertilisers for his crops.

loans.name: Uygun

texts.ru: Уйгун добродушный и жизнерадостный парень в возрасте 29 лет. Он женат  и имеет ребёнка. Уйгну живёт со своей женой в небольшом доме в сельском посёлке. В свои года Уйгун полон сил и желания работать на благо своей семьи. Он  занимается животноводством. Уйгун сотрудничает с Арванд с 2012 года и является ответственным клиентом. Первый свой кредит он получил на покупку первого скота. И по сей день он занимается этим делом. На сегодня он имеет уже 20 голов скота. У него имеется  земельная площадь, где он и пасёт своих скот. Жена помогает ему в этом деле. Бизнес животноводства приносит хороший доход, поэтому Уйгун  хочет и дальше  расширять этот бизнес, увеличив поголовье своего скота. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд, чтобы получить кредит на покупку скота. Уйгун заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Uygun is a kind-natured and optimistic 29-year old man. He is married and has one child. Uygun lives with his wife in a small house in a rural area. He is full of energy and desire to work to improve his family’s situation. Uygun raises cattle. He has been collaborating with Arvand since 2012 and has shown himself to be a responsible client. He received his first loan to buy cattle for the first time, and he still continues this business. At present he owns 20 heads of cattle. He has a land plot where he puts his cattle out to feed. His wife helps him in this work. The livestock business brings in a good revenue, and so Uygun would like to continue developing it and increase his headcount. This is why he turned to Arvand for a loan to buy cattle. Uygun thanks Arvand in advance for its support.

loans.use: purchase of  livestock.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran is 53 years old and married, the mother of five children. 

Four years ago she initiated her business of selling milk to support her family at a point when her husband was the only bread earner. With the passage of time her sales increased and also her income. 

Now she has two buffaloes and two cows. This has all happened due to her courage and determination.

Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. While talking to the Kashf officer, she shared the feeling of achievement she got by sending her son to college for further studies. 

She has some savings, and she has applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo.

loans.name: Milliam

texts.en:
Milliam lives in the Nanyuki area in the central province of Kenya. She is 25 years old and married, with three children, two of whom attend the nearby school. 

She is a businesslady, too.  She runs a boutique in town that has been in operation for more than five years. She also does farming, which earns her extra income.

Her business has been growing over the years, and she has decided to seek a loan to buy bales of clothes and shoes for sale in the business.  She knew Milango through friends who invited her to join so that she can save and access credit to fund her business.

She hopes that in the next five years her business will grow, and she will be able to open more branches in other parts of the country. The challenges that she faces in the business is lack of capital and an unsuitable climate. 

The income that she raises will improve her standards of living and educate her children.

loans.use: o buy bales of clothes and shoes

loans.name: Serena

texts.en:
Serena is 42 years old and lives in Buchanan.  She is married and has two children, 2 and 12 years; they are in school and live at home. 

For the past ten years Serena has been selling fish in the market. She sells from Monday to Saturday, eight hours each day. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more fish for her business. Her plans are to educate her children and build a house for them in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: T. Girl

texts.en:
T. Girl is 22 years old and lives in Buchanan.  She is married and has a one-year-old child living with her at home. She did not go to school, but she manages her business well. She describes herself as a hard-working business woman. 

For the past two years she has been selling red oil, pepper, and rice in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil, pepper, and rice for her business. 

She hopes to expand her business and build a house.

loans.use: to buy more red oil, pepper, and rice for her business.

loans.name: Yuliza

texts.es:
Yuliza tiene 26  años, está casada con Jhoni de 38 años, Vive junto a sus 2 hijos en una vivienda hecha a base de material noble. Es propietaria de un pequeño puesto ubicado en el mercado de su localidad dedicándose a la venta de productos comestibles considerados  primera necesidad.
Se dedica a este oficio hace más de 5 años y comenta que al iniciarse fue complicado ya que anteriormente no había liderado un negocio propio. Suele recibir a diario a sus clientes quienes en su mayoría son amas de casa ofreciéndole una buena variedad de verduras, frutas, especerías y diversos abarrotes envasados.
Con el objetivo de ofrecer un menor precio por sus productos suele adquirir su mercadería no perecible al por mayor logrando así obtener descuentos considerables.Se siente muy a gusto con tu labor y puede sin inconvenientes contar con la compañía de sus hijas y en ocasiones de su madre quien la visita constantemente y apoya constantemente.Uno de sus principales objetivos a largo plazo es poder establecer un negocio similar en su vivienda para obtener mejores ingresos a futuro. Este es su tercer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Desea en esta oportunidad contar con 2,000 nuevo soles abastecer nuevamente su negocio con verduras frescas y víveres como fideos, leche enlatada y frutas al por mayor.
texts.en:
Yuliza is 26 years old and is married to Jhoni, who is 38 years old.  They live with their 2 children in a house made of quality material.  She is the owner of a small stall located in her town's market.  There, she sells basic groceries.  She has been working in this business for over 5 years.  She says that at the beginning, it was complicated because she had never run her own business before.  She receives customers daily, who are usually housewives.  She offers them a good variety of vegetables, fruits, spices and various packaged goods.  

In an effort to offer her customers lower prices for her products, she usually purchases her non-perishable merchandise in bulk.  This allows her to get considerable discounts.  She is very happy with her work, and can usually count on the company of her daughters and on occasion her mother who visits her often and always supports her.  One of her longterm goals is to open a similar business in her home in order to generate greater revenues.  

This is her third loan with Kiva, and she is very grateful for the financial support that she has received to continue to move forward.  She is committed to making the payments on time.  She hopes to use these 2,000 nuevos soles to stock her business with fresh vegetables and groceries such as noodles, canned milk and fruit in bulk.

loans.use: purchase  food products such as noodles, canned milk and fruit in bulk.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth works hard to support her family.  She is married, and she has a electronic mobile load retailing business in the Philippines.

Elizabeth has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional amounts of electronic mobile load to sell.

Elizabeth has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more amounts of electronic mobile load to sell

loans.name: Soriaya

texts.en:
Soriaya is 56 years old and married.  She started her own business selling cloths when her husband got severely ill.

She buys cloths of different designs from the market at lower rates and then sells them in her community. She counts a good client list; most of her clients are her neighbors. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation.  Currently she has requested a loan of PKS 20,000. She intends to use this loan amount to buy an ample variety of cloths for the winter season. 

She is in her fifth loan cycle with a good credit history.  She expects to boost her earnings through her larger sales.

loans.use: to buy an ample variety of cloths to sell for the winter season.

loans.name: William Adolfo

texts.es: William de 32 años de edad  es un hombre caracterizado por su emprendedurismo ya que aprovecha cualquier oportunidad que el mercado le da para poner sus negocios. Desde hace 3 años logró establecer una pequeña tienda en su lugar de residencia la cual es su principal fuente de ingresos. William habita junto a su compañera de vida y su pequeño hijo de 6 años de edad. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado construir su vivienda y la cual es su principal patrimonio. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la introducción del agua potable y la energía eléctrica puesto que no cuenta con los servicios que tanta falta le hacen.
texts.en:
William is 32 years old. He is described as someone who is known for his entrepreneurial spirit, because he takes advantage of every opportunity he sees to start a business. Three years ago, William managed to set up a small store in his home, which is now his main source of income. William lives with his life partner and his boy, age six. Through much effort, William managed to build his own home, which he says is his only asset.

William is requesting this loan from the field partner to improve his living conditions. He will use it to install electric service and drinking water, which he currently does not have and needs very badly.

loans.use: to install electric service and drinking water.

loans.name: Martha Lidia

texts.es: Martha es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable. A sus 56 años de edad trabaja como empleada doméstica en casa particular. Con lo que percibe de su trabajo logra llevar el sustento diario a su hogar. Habita en condiciones habitacionales muy sencillas junto a su grupo familiar. El techo de su vivienda es a base de lámina la cual se encuentra deteriorada y no da el soporte necesario. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y madera para reparar el techo y dar mayor seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Martha is a hardworking and responsible woman.  At 56 years old, she works as a maid in a private residence.  With what she earns from her job, she is able to bring home enough for their daily sustenance.  She lives with her family in very simple housing conditions.  

The roof of her home is made of metal sheets, which is now deteriorated and does not give the necessary support.  She is seeking this loan from FUSAI in order to invest in the purchase of galvanized sheets and wood to repair the roof and provide her family with more security.

loans.use: purchase galvanized sheets and wood to repair her roof and provide better security for her family.

loans.name: Salvador Gavino

texts.es: Salvador 62 años de edad habita en condiciones muy humildes junto a su grupo familiar. Es un hombre trabajador y responsable. Desde hace 10 años Salvador se dedica a la venta de leche en las diferentes zonas de su localidad. Gracias a su carisma y buenos precios en sus productos ha logrado ganarse la confianza de muchos clientes que cada día lo prefieren más. Desea construir un cuarto en su vivienda para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y madera para la construcción del cuarto ya que no cuenta con el capital pero si tiene la capacidad de pago que el crédito implica.
texts.en:
Salvador, 62 years old, lives in very humbles conditions with her family.  He is a hardworking and responsible man.  For the past 10 years, Salvador has worked selling milk in different areas of his community.  Thanks to his charisma and good prices, he has been able to gain the trust of many customers who like him more each day.  

He wishes to build a room in his home, which is why he is seeking this credit from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of galvanized metal sheets and wood to build the room because he currently does not have the funds but does have the ability to make the payments on the loan.

loans.use: purchase galvanized metal sheets and wood to build a room.

loans.name: Brittney

texts.en:
Elite Waste & Construction Services LLC is an expansion of a family tradition. As she saw and learned the ways of the disposal industry through her father’s business, Brittney decided to branch out from her father’s line of work into her own, adding services for construction projects, and in the future, possibly the real estate industry.

Providing waste and debris containers at residential and commercial sites, and portable toilets to mobile job sites, Elite Waste & Construction Services LLC has been in business three years with Brittany as the sole employee, though she plans to hire more employees as her company grows.

To help expand the business, Brittany searched for funds to purchase a work vehicle. She therefore ventured to TruFund, a nonprofit organization which referred her to Accion Texas Inc. Once she applied and was approved for the loan, Brittany was able to purchase a work truck to provide faster and additional services to existing clients. She also plans to advertise her business on the side of the truck to attract potential clients. 

“Without the loan, I would not have the funds to obtain the vehicle in order to service my clients,” Brittany says. “I would also lose the potential to have additional advertising.”

Brittany also advertises her business on Facebook; check it out here: www.facebook.com\EliteWaste

loans.use: to purchase a work truck to provide faster and additional services to existing clients.

loans.name: Mahwish

texts.en:
Mahwish is 25 years old and married.  She deals in the business of selling milk and makes enough to contribute to the family income. 

She has three buffaloes and two cows in milk, and she sells their milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk.  She is happily doing it together to support her family.

For the improvement of her business, she contacted the Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKS 25,000 to buy another buffalo. It will help her to meet the increasing demand of her customers without fail. 

She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo.

loans.name: Aissatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe  est créé le 25 Août 2011 jour de son inauguration. Il est composé de ces deux femmes qui sont issues du même village, elles sont très solidaires et s’entre aident dans leurs activités. Ces deux bénéficiaires sont d’un dynamisme remarque et jouent des rôles de leaders auprès de leurs camarades.

Madame Aissatou (à droite avec la main levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 40 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants (03 garçons et 02 filles). Elle s’active dans la collecte et la revente de produits agricoles arachide, mil et divers autres produits suivant les saisons.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter au moins une tonne et demi  d’arachide à  150 000 FCFA  et du maïs pour une quantité importante en vu de la revente dans un futur proche.

Les bénéfices lui permettront  de participer pleinement à la satisfaction des besoins de sa famille sur le plan sanitaire et éducatif.
texts.en:
This group was created on August 24, 2011 the same day it was inaugurated. It comprises two women who are from the same village. They assist one another with a high degree of solidarity in their work. These two recipients have remarkable energy and play the role of leaders among their friends and associates. 

Ms. Aissatou (at the right with her hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 40 years old, married, and the mother of five (three boys and two girls). She is active in stocking and reselling peanuts, millet, and various other produce according to the season.

With her new loan, she intends to purchase at least a 1½ tonnes of peanuts at 150,000 francs CFA and some corn in significant quantities with the aim of reselling them in the near future.  

The profits will enable her to participate fully in meeting family needs in terms of healthcare and education.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts and corn to sell

loans.name: Vainqueur De Garde Saline Group

texts.fr:
Fracoeur est  le coordinateurde son groupe Vainqueur de Garde Saline.  Il  n´est pas marie et il a  2 enfants. Il habite dans la region nord  d`Haïti ou de électricité est rare et de l'éau portable est très limité. Avant de ce commercer ce commerce il était professeur

Fracoeur va investir votre prêt dans l'achat de divers produits divers tels que des chaussures, des produits cosmétiques, des vêtements, etc. Il dirige son commerce de produit divers  pendants les 10 derniers années. Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à grandir son commerce.

Des autres membres de Vainqueur de Garde Saline ont besoin d’un  emprunt pour le commerce que ventes produits cosmétiques, boissons gazeuses, boisson,  etc. Il  dit son but principal c’est d’avoir un plus grande commerce qui lui facilitera  à  un plus grand commerce avec prêts de Esperanza.
texts.en:
Francoeur is the leader of the group "Vainqueur de de Garde Saline." He is not married and has 2 children. He lives in a northern region of Haiti where electricity is rare and drinking water is limited. Before he began his business, he was a professor.

Francoeur is going to invest his loan in buying a variety of products such as shoes, cosmetic products, clothing, etc. He has been running his business of diverse products for the past 10 years. He hopes that his loan will help him expand his business.

The other members of Vainqueur de Garde Saline need a loan for their retail businesses selling cosmetics, soft drinks, drinks, etc. He says that main goal is to have a larger business through loans from Esperanza.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products such as shoes, cosmetic products, clothing, etc. for resale

loans.name: Jezi Konnen 1, 3 & 4 Group

texts.fr:
Marieclaude est la coordonatrice de son groupe Jezi Konnen 1, 3 & 4. Elle habite dans la région de CAP-H d’Haïti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Elle a dirigé son commerce de vente divers les 10 dernières années. Elle est marie et elle a 2 enfants. 

Marieclaude voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans achete produits divers, que des vêtements, des cosmétiques, des chaussures. Des autres membres des Jezi Konnen ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre des produits alimentaires, charbon et des produits cosmétiques. 

Marieclause dit que son rêve est d’agrandir son commerce pour qu’il devenir un grand commerçant.
texts.en:
Marieclaude is the coordinator for her group, Jezi Konnen 1, 3 & 4. She lives in the region of CAP-H in Haiti where electricity is rare and water is limited. For the past 10 years, she has run a business selling miscellaneous items. She is married and has two children. 

Marieclaude would like to use this loan to invest in buying miscellaneous items such as clothing, cosmetics, and shoes. The other members of Jezi Konnen need a loan for businesses like food, coal, and cosmetics sales.

Marieclaude says that her dream is to grow her business so that she can become an important merchant.

loans.use: to buy clothing, cosmetics, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es: Avaro de 45 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su grupo familiar conformado por su compañera de vida y sus hijos. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de ropa  en el mercado de su localidad. Ofrece variedad de prendas de vestir tales como: faldas, blusas, vestidos, etc. de esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento diario a su casa. Su deseo es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda ya que el techo se encuentra dañado y cuando llueve se mojan sus pocas pertenencias. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y madera para hacer la reparación lo antes posible y dar a su familia mejor condición habitacional.
texts.en:
Alvaro is 45 years old and lives in his own home with her family which is made up of her wife and their children.  For the past 10 years, he has worked selling clothing in the local market.  He offers a variety of garments such as: skirts, blouses, dresses, etc.  He earns his living this way and brings home the daily sustenance.  

His biggest dream is to improve the conditions of his house because the roof is damaged and when it rains, their few belongings get wet.  

He is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of galvanized metal sheets and wood to make the repairs as soon as possible and give his family better housing conditions.

loans.use: purchase sheets of galvanized metal and wood to repair the roof of his house.

loans.name: Davronjon

texts.ru: Даврончону 33 года. Он разведен и у него с бывшей женой имеются двое детей, которых он очень любит. В настоящее время Даврончон живет у родителей в Б.Гафуровском районе города Худжанд. Его отец работает учителем в школе, а мать является продавшицей на рынке. Сам Даврончон последние 6 лет работал таксистом. Сейчас он собирается начать новый бизнес в сфере производства. У него среднее техническое образование. Он по специальности сварщик. Даврончон планирует заняться производством железных дверей. Он арендовал помещение для своей мастерской и еще у него осталось сбережение в размере 400 долларов. Даврончон просит кредит, чтобы купить сварочный аппарат и необходимое сырье. Закупив аппарат и сырье он собирается начать выпускать железные двери.
texts.en: Davronjon is 33. He is divorced, and he and his ex-wife have two children whom he loves very much. Currently Davronjon lives with parents in the B. Gafurov district of the city of Khujand. His father is a teacher at the school, and his mother is a saleswoman at the market. Davronjon has worked as a taxi driver for the last six years. Now he's going to start a new manufacturing business. He has a secondary technical education. He is a welder by profession. Davronjon plans to start producing iron doors. He rented a room for his studio and has $400 of his savings left. Davronjon is asking for a loan to buy a welding machine and raw materials. Once he buys the machine and raw material he is going to start making iron doors.

loans.use: purchase a welding machine and materials to make iron doors

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.en:
Ramiro dreams of becoming a professional. He is currently attending the Universidad Adventista de Bolivia, working towards his degree in business. He plans on graduating in July 2014, but without a loan from Vittana, he fears that he will need to defer his graduation. 

Ramiro plans on using the loan to pay his graduation fee. This fee is often more expensive than the semester's tuition and is a frequent impediment for graduating students in Potosi. With a career in business, he expects to earn $13 a day, a substantial increase from before. 

Unfortunately, Ramiro's parents never had the opportunity to complete their high school education. Without the opportunity for a higher degree, his parents never had the chance to move up. Growing up, finances have always been tight. With six older siblings, Ramiro is unsure how he will be able to afford his graduation fees on his own without the assistance of a Vittana loan.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees.

loans.name: Marizabeth

texts.en:
Marizabeth dreams of becoming a teacher. To achieve her goal, Marizabeth has enrolled in the Universidad Pública de El Alto but without a loan from Vittana, she thinks that she may need to take time off to work and save until she can return to school. 

Marizabeth plans on using the loan to cover the cost of her graduation fees. Often there are fees for earning your title in education before graduating. 

Marizabeth currently works 30 hours a week. One of her biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. With a career in education, she expects to earn $17 a day. Marizabeth's parents were never able to complete their primary education. For her family of four, finances have always been tight. With five other siblings, Marizabeth is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana loan. 

Marizabeth is married with her own children. With a professional degree and a career in education, she hopes to be able to provide her family with a better life. She hopes to be able to contribute towards her family's income in the near future.

loans.use: to pay for graduation.

loans.name: Kadyrbai

texts.ru: Кадырбаю 36 лет, женат, вместе с супругой воспитывают 3 детей. У Кадырбая - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Кадырбай занимается животноводством, стартовав 18 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Кадырбая, в его хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова с теленком, и 3 козы, а также имеет земельный надел размером 2,53 ГА, на котором выращивает ячмень и кукурузу. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). Кадырбай входит в группу "Алмалы", в эту группу входят еще 2 человека. Кадырбай является лидером группы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кадырбай обратился в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 75,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Кадырбай планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку семейного автомобиля.
texts.en: Kadyrbai is 36 years old, married, and is raising three children with his wife. Kadyrbai has a secondary education. Animal husbandry is the family's main source of income. Kadyrbai started this business 18 years ago by buying cattle with 5,000 KGS. Thanks to Kadyrbai's hard work his farm boasts one dairy cow, a calf, three goats, and a plot of land measuring 2.53 hectares where he grows barley and corn. He earns a monthly income of 15,000 KGS. Kadyrbai is a member of the group "Almali". This group includes two other people. Kadyrbai is the leader of the group. In order to further develop his farm, Kadyrbai has asked the microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 75,000 KGS to buy sheep for breeding. Kadyrbai plans to use profits he makes from the loan to further increase his herd and to save enough money to buy a family car.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Diarry's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe  est créé le 25 Août 2011 jour de son inauguration. Il est composé de  femmes qui toutes issues du même village, elles sont très solidaires entre elles et s’entre aident dans leurs activités. Actuellement à son cinquième cycle la majorité des membres ont vu leurs activités prospérées et ont  senti une amélioration de leur condition d’existence.

Madame Diarry (assise à l’extrême droite avec la main droite levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 30 ans, elle est mariée et  mère de 05 enfants (02 filles et 03 garçons). Elle est vendeuse de denrées alimentaires et tient une boutique où elle vend du riz, de l’huile de palm et  raffiné, sucre et autres produit de consommation courante qu’elle achète au marché régional auprès de grossiste et demi grossiste pour la revente au détail au village.

 Son nouveau prêt lui permettra  d’acheter au moins trois cartons de dosette ¼ de litre d’huile raffiné, deux sacs de sucre cristallisé et divers produits de consommation courante.

Avec les bénéfices elle compte augmenter son épargne d’une part et d’autre part aider son mari dans les charges familiales.
texts.en:
This group was created on August 24, 2011 the same day it was inaugurated. It is composed of women all from the same village. They assist one another with a high degree of solidarity in their work. Currently on their fifth loan cycle, most members have seen their business prosper and felt an improvement in their living situations. 

Ms. Diarry (sitting at the far right with her right hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 30 years old, married, and the mother of five (three boys and two girls). She sells grocery items and has a store, where she sells rice, palm oil and refined oil, sugar, and other typical consumer items she purchases at the regional market from wholesalers and middlemen, so as to resell them in the village. 

Her new loan will enable her to purchase at least three boxes of pouches, a ¼ liter of refined oil, two bags of granulated sugar, and various other typical consumer items. 

With the profits, she plans on increasing her savings, as well as helping out her husband in covering family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase pouches, oil, sugar, and other typical consumer items to sell

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Becoming an accountant is Antonia's dream. She is currently attending Tecnologico Tarija, working towards her degree in accounting. She shares that her alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until she could return. Antonia shares that it is important to her to graduate on time so she can enter into the job market as soon as possible. 

Antonia plans on spending the money towards purchasing her textbooks. As an added expense, textbooks are often not bought to save money. With them, Antonia hopes to be able to better understand her subjects. With a career in accounting, she expects to earn $20 a day, a substantial increase from before. 

Unfortunately, Antonia's parents never had the opportunity to complete their high school education. Without the opportunity for a higher degree, her parents never had the chance to move up. Growing up, their finances have always been tight.

loans.use: to pay for books and school supplies.

loans.name: Santiago Group

texts.es: Doña Felipa tiene 46 años de edad está casada con el señor Andrés desde hace 15 años juntos han formado una familia con 9 hijos de los cuales aun tres son dependientes que van a la escuela. Esta vez está solicitando un crédito para comprar tela, aujas, hilos y encajes. Doña Felipa se dedica a la elaboración de trajes típicos desde hace seis años, Doña Felipa comento “Cuando me case mi suegra me enseño a coser y a cortar estos trajes típicos” solo hace los trajes por pedido, las señoras de la comunidad aun utilizan estos trajes típicos o también sale a otras comunidades a ofrecerlos. Solo tiene una maquina manual, elige un día al mes para hacer un viaje a la cuidad de México para adquirir tela, encajes, hilos etc. El traje típico Mazahua está compuesto por su saco, babero, nahuas, faja y sus accesorios son el collar y su aretes. La meta de Doña Felipa es seguir apoyando con los estudios de sus hijos y logren estudiar su educación preparatoria y la universidad, los niños de la comunidad solo pueden llegar a estudiar su educación secundaria porque no hay una preparatoria oficial en la comunidad.  Don Andrés y Doña Elena también recibirán su crédito para invertirlo en la cría de sus borregos, junto con Felipa conforman en grupo “Santiago” decidieron por este nombre porque así se llama el santo patrono de la comunidad le tiene mucha fe. Ellos están muy agradecidos y contentos con VisionFund y KIVA porque gracias al crédito podrán invertir en sus negocios.
texts.en:
Felipa is 46 years old and has been married to Andrés for 15 years. They have a family of nine children together, three of whom are still minors and go to school. On this occasion, she is requesting a loan to buy cloth, needles, thread and lace. Felipa has worked making traditional clothing for six years. She says "when I got married, I taught myself how to sew and cut traditional clothing". She only makes the clothes to order, for the ladies in the community who still wear these traditional clothes, and she also travels to other communities to offer her wares. Felipa only has a manual machine. Once a month, she travels to Mexico city to buy cloth, thread, lace, and other items. 

The traditional clothes worn by the Mazahua group are a dress, bib, nahuas, and skirt with a necklace and earrings. Felipa's goal is to continue supporting her children in their studies so that they finish high school and university. The children of the community are only able to study to a certain level because there is no official high school in the community. 

Andrés and Elena also need the loan to invest in raising their sheep. They are members of the “Santiago” group. The name was chosen because Santiago is the patron saint of the community, which places its trust in him. They are very grateful and happy with Vision Fund and KIVA because thanks to the loan they will be able to invest in their businesses.

loans.use: to buy cloth, thread, and needle

loans.name: Verano Group

texts.es:
El Grupo "Verano" se encuntra ubicado en una comunidad llena de tradiciones se caracteriza por las personas artesanas las cuales se dedican a la elaboracion de bordados tradicionales como gabanes, chales, chalecos, mochilas etc. EL Grupo "Verano" esta conformado por personas muy responsables se conocen desde hace varios años han crecido en la misma comunidad. El nombre del grupo lo eligieron ellos mismos porque querian tener un nombre de alguna estacion del año. Los integrantes del grupo estan muy contentos y agradecidos con la institucion porque gracias al credito van a poder invertir en sus actividades economicas como Doña Victorina y Doña Silvia invertirán en pollos, Doña Claudia invertira en borregos, Abimael inverira en su taxi, Francisco invertira en su paleteria y nieves.
Don Cirilo tiene 49 años de edad está casado con la señora Teodora desde hace 25 años, juntos formaron una familia con siete hijos de los cuales tres de ellos aun dependen de dicha pareja dos de sus hijos están estudiando. El está solicitando el crédito para comparar borregos y guajolotes para criarlos y engordarlos para después venderlos esta actividad la ha llevado a cabo durante diez años, por el momento no tiene borregos tampoco guajolotes porque afortunadamente vendió todos en el mes de julio que es cuando se celebran las clausuras en las escuelas, es por eso que necesita de mas crédito para comprar mas animalitos y continuar con la actividad, Don Cirilo comento “Antes tenía la idea de poner una panadería pero por falta de dinero nunca pude lograrlos porque la leña es muy cara” Para Don Cirilo criar animalitos no es ningún trabajo además porque no presenta ninguna dificultad para obtener ganancias por medios de ellos. El sueño de Don Cirilo es poder darle estudios a sus hijos y puedan mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
