The group "Verano" ("summer") is located in a community full of traditions characterized by the artisans who work making traditional embroideries like jackets, shawls, vests, backpacks, etc. The Verano group is made of very responsible people who have known each other for years, and grew up in the same community. 

They chose the name of the group because they wanted to have a name of a season of the year. The members of the group are very content and thankful to institution because thanks to the loan they will be able to invest in their economic activities, for example Victorina and Silvia will invest in chickens, Claudia will invest in sheep, Abimael will invest in his taxi, and Francisco will invest in his ice cream parlor and ice creams. 

Cirilo is 49 years old and has been married to Teodora for 25 years. Together they form a family with seven children, three of whom still depend on them. Two of their children are in school. He is requesting this loan to buy sheep and turkeys to raise them and fatten them to sell them afterward. He has done this activity for ten years. At the moment he does not have sheep or turkeys because fortunately he sold all of them in the month of July which is when closing sessions are celebrated in schools. It is due to that reason that he needs a loan to buy more animals and continue with the activity. Cirilo comments, "Before I had the idea of starting a bakery, but due to the lack of money I never could achieve it because firewood is very expensive." For Cirilo, raising animals is not much work, since it does not present any difficulty to obtain profits through it. Cirilo's dream is to be able to give an education to his children and they can improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sheep and turkeys

location.town: Santa Ana Nichi, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Renovación Group

texts.es: El Grupo "Renovación" se encuentra ubicado en una comunidad hermosa y muy grande se caracteriza por tener vecinos muy responsables y respetuosos es una comunidad con grandes festividades como el dia 2 de Febrero es cuando celebran a su patrona del pueblo La Virgen de la Candelaria. El grupo está integrado por cinco mujeres y dos hombres ellos mismos eligieron el nombre del grupo y surgió porque anteriormente pertenecían a otro grupo que llevaba por nombre Granada pero para ellos separarse fue como iniciar nuevamente por eso le pusieron así “Renovación”. Doña Carmen es la representante del grupo tiene 47 años de edad está casada con el señor Zenaido desde hace ya 26 años juntos formaron una familia con cinco hijos de los cuales dos de ellos ya tiene 2 dependientes los cuales se encuentran estudiando, la señora Carmen se dedica a la cría y engorda de cerdos desde hace ya 24 años casi al mismo tiempo cuando se caso con su con Don Zenaido, Ella decidió iniciar la actividad porque quería ayudar con los gastos del hogar mientras Don Zenaido trabajaba Doña Carmen criaba y engordaba los cerdos y así pesaban menos los gastos del hogar, Los gastos aumentaron cuando sus hijos decidieron estudiar por esa misma razón no ha dejado su actividad económica, Esta vez esta solicitando un crédito a Vision Fund y KIVA ***para adquirir alimento para sus cerdos que tiene en su casa***. Doña Carmen comento “Durante cuatro meses los engordo para después venderlos no podemos tenerlos más tiempo porque comen mucho y el alimento es muy caro” Hace tiempo la dificultad de Doña Carmen era cuando sus cerdos se enfermaban y llegaban a morir para la familia eran perdidas de ganancias e inversión pero en la actualidad esta situación no pasa más porque Don Zenaido aprendía a vacunarlos, desparasitarlos, etc. para evitar tener esas pérdidas tan grandes, La única meta de Carmen es lograr seguir apoyando en los estudios de sus hijos uno de ellos está por terminar su carrera para ser un gran veterinario “No me gustaría que la carrera de mi hijo se quedara a la mitad por falta de dinero” Así como Doña Carmen en grupo está muy agradecido y contento  con KIVA y VisionFund por el crédito otorgado porque tendrán la oportunidad de invertir en su actividades económicas. ***Doña Gregoria, Sergio y Clara invertirán en sus cerdos, Albina en sus pollos, Doña Rafaela invertirá en artículos de fantasía y Don Ángel invertirá en borregos.***
texts.en:
The "Renovación" group is located in a beautiful and very large community which is characterized by its highly responsible and respectful inhabitants. It is a community which celebrates huge festivals such as 2 February, when the town's patron saint, the Virgin of the Candelaria, is celebrated. The group is made up of five women and two men, who chose the name of the group themselves, because they had previously belonged to another group named Granada, but when it separated they had to start again, which is why they named themselves “Renovación”, meaning renovation in Spanish. 

Carmen is the group's representative. She is 47 and is married to Zenaido. They have been together for 26 years and have a family together with five children, two of whom already have their own children who study. Carmen has made a living raising and fattening pigs for 24 years, almost the same amount of time that she's been married to Zenaido. She decided to start this business because she wanted to help out with household expenses. While Zenaido worked, Carmen raised and fattened pigs, which made it easier for them to pay the household expenses. These increased when their children decided to study, which is why she continues to work in this. 

On this occasion, she is requesting a loan from Vision Fund and Kiva to buy feed for her pigs. Carmen explains that "I fatten them for four months, and then sell them. We can't keep them any longer because they eat a lot and the feed is very expensive". A while ago, Carmen's pigs used to get ill and die, which was a problem for her because they represented a loss of earnings and investments for the for the family. However, the situation has now been resolved, because Zenaido learned how to vaccinate them, deworm them, etc. to avoid such large losses.

Carmen's only goal is to continue supporting her children's studies. One is them is about to finish his degree to become a successful vet. She says “I'd hate for my son to have to abandon his degree halfway through because of a lack of money". Like Carmen, the group is very grateful to and happy with Kiva and Vision Fund for the loan granted, because it will give them the opportunity to invest in their businesses. Gregoria, Sergio and Clara will invest in their pigs, Albina in her chickens, Rafaela in costume jewellery and Ángelin sheep.

loans.use: to buy food for their pigs.

location.town: Dolores Hidalgo, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Sophie

texts.en:
After working in a variety of industries, UK-native Sophie moved to NYC with the hopes of following her dream of having her own TV commercial production company.

With 10 years in operation, Sophie's NYC-based TV commercial production company has proven to be a great success. The low-cost and high-quality service has awarded Sophie and her five employees the pleasure and privilege of working with a list of outstanding clients. 

Now, Sophie needs your help. With this loan, she would like to take on more projects, collaborate with more clients, produce more great work, and expand nationwide. Will you help her accomplish her dream?

loans.use: To pay for equipment and marketing efforts necessary for new projects and for nationwide expansion.

loans.name: Else

texts.en:
Else is 27 years old and married. She has four children. With three of her children still in school, Else works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years, selling a variety of items such as canned goods, cooking oil, noodles, soft drinks, hair conditioner, and diapers.

Else requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy more items to sell in her general store.

In the future, Else would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda, who is married, works hard to support her family. She owns an ice cream vending business in the Philippines. Erlinda has been in this business for 5 years now. She is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her business. Erlinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her ice cream vending business.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea has always dreamt of becoming an accountant. To achieve her goal, Andrea has enrolled in the Universidad San Fransisco Xavier. Andrea plans on using her loan to buy her school books. Up until now, she has been managing to get by without them, but it has become a challenge. With books and school supplies, she feels she will be able to get better grades. 

In addition to her responsibilities at school, Andrea currently works 30 hours a week and earns $19 a day. With a degree in public accounting and finance, she expects to earn $25 a day. With one younger sister, Andrea hopes to be a role model for her younger siblings by being the first in her family to graduate from university.

loans.use: to pay for textbooks and school supplies.

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es:
Karla Patricia es una joven con muchos sueños y muchos deseos de salir adelante, superarse en la vida al lado de sus familiares y demás la cual tiene una edad de 30 años, es casada con un grado de escolaridad primaria incompleto cursado hasta el tercer grado. Ella es madre de un hijo el cual estudia en la escuela de la comunidad y vive con ellos. Ella se dedica a la siembra, cultivo y venta de café desde hace más de 8 años siendo sus padres quienes le enseñaran a trabajar, mismos que le heredaron la tierra que hoy día trabaja siendo sus clientes los vecinos de las zonas aledañas, intermediarios entre otros en donde ella vive. A su lugar de trabajo se desplaza en vestía, o caminando aproximadamente a una hora con cuarenta minutos de donde ella vive siendo ella y su esposo los únicos involucrados en el desarrollo de esta actividad.
Ella sueña con ser la mayor productora de la zona manteniendo sus cultivos al 100% haciendo de su propiedad un atractivo para sus clientes como también poder aperturar una carretera que ayude a tener un acceso más fácil que el cruce de terreno áspero. Por lo que hoy en día ella ha solicitado financiamiento para invertir en la compra de fertilizantes, abono, foliares, etc. para preparar su producto de una mejor y más segura forma para la próxima cosecha.
texts.en:
Karla Patricia is a young woman with many dreams who is eager to overcome and get ahead in life alongside her family members. She is 30 years old and is married. She attended primary school until the third grade. She is the mother of a son who studies in the community school and lives with his parents. She has been engaged in the planting, growing, and selling of coffee for over 8 years as her parents taught her to work the land she inherited from them. Today, she works serving her clients, residents of surrounding areas, and brokers, among others where she lives. To get the land where she works, she moves on a working animal or walks approximately an hour and forty minutes from where she lives. She and her husband are the only ones involved in the development of this activity.
She dreams of being the largest producer of this crop in the area while retaining 100% ownership. She wants to be attractive to customers as well as to open up a road to help her have easier access to her land by crossing the rough terrain. Today she has applied for funding to invest in the purchase of fertilizers, manure, insecticides, and other products to prepare her crop for the next harvest in an improved and safer way.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs to apply to protect her coffee crops.

loans.name: Gulsana

texts.ru: Гульсане 32 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Гульсаны - высшее образование, работает ведущим специалистом социального развития. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Гульсана занимается животноводством, стартовав 10 лет назад, с покупки скота на 15,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гульсаны, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 кобыла, 3 теленка, а также имеет земельный надел размером 0,30 ГА, на котором выращивает перец, картофель и клевер. Ежемесячный доход составляет 6,000 сом (KGS). Гульсана входит в группу "Киреше, в эту группу входят еще 2 человека. Гульсана является третьим членом группы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гульсана обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 55,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Гульсана планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Gulsana is 32 years old, married, and raising four children with her husband. Gulsana has a higher education. She works as a lead social development specialist. To make extra money for her family, Gulsana also works in animal husbandry. She started ten years ago, buying cattle with 15,000 KGS. Thanks to Gulsana's hard work, her farm currently boasts one milk cow, one mare, three calves, and a plot of land measuring 0.30 hectares where she grows peppers, potatoes, and clover. Her monthly income is 6,000 KGS. Gulsana is a member of the group Kireshe. This group includes two other people. Gulsana is the third member of the group. To further develop her farm, Gulsana asked the microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 55,000 KGS to buy a cow for breeding. Gulsana plans to invest profits she makes from the loan into further expanding her livestock.

loans.use: buy a cow

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani, age 39, is a married woman and the mother of five children. She has been running a business selling milk, for many years. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo, to support her family. Prior to that time, her husband was the only bread earner for their family. With the passage of time, her sales increased, and also her income. Now she has two buffaloes and one cow. This has all happened due to her courage and determination.

Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters, as well as financial matters. She has some savings, and she has applied for a loan of PKR 25,000. She will use it to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income, as she expands her business.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo for dairy use

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 47-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. She has been running a business selling milk for many years, with the support of her husband. She has one buffalo, whose milk she sells to local people in her area. She also sells butter and cheese to generate extra profit.

Parveen has become famous for providing good quality milk, and she makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her second loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 35,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo. It will help her to increase her sales and profits.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 34-year-old married father of three children. He is a Palestinian refugee, who has been working in the vehicle repair business since 22 years ago. He was only 12 years old when he started working, just like most of the Palestinian refugees living in Lebanon, who start working early in order to support their families.  In 2003, he established his own business to improve his living.

Khaled specializes in painting cars and in bodywork. He is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy an air compressor, a paint gun and a sanding machine.  Through this loan, he will be capable of developing his business and increasing his income.

He hopes to expand his workplace so as to accept more work.

loans.use: to buy an air compressor, a paint gun and a sanding machine.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is 41 years of age and a married person .She is raising three kids with her husband. Sabina is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her family in Bilasuvar region. .When she was 30, she started to learn to work in agriculture. Her parents were the ones who taught her to grow fruits and vegetables, since it was their only source of income. 

She has been growing vegetables and fruits for more than 10 years now. She sells her crops in the central bazaar to make a profit in order to support her family. Sabina’s  income from her business is 150 AZN. In order to improve the living conditions of her family, she plans to expand her business. This requires a lot of dedication and effort. She believes in the near future her sons will help her to expand the business. Since the vegetable and fruit business is profitable and an enjoyable business, she wants the business to continue and prosper.

Sabina needs a 2000 AZN loan to buy fertilizers, seeds and fruit trees. Her biggest wish is to offer her children an education so that they can have good careers and help their family. This is her third loan and she has a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds and fruit trees

loans.name: Helmi

texts.en:
Helmi is a 49-year-old married father of three children. He has been selling shoes in his own shop since 1998. Helmi has a very good reputation in his region as a hard worker and a trustworthy person. 

Helmi is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to pay for his child's university fees. 

He has had four loan cycles with Al Majmoua and he invested his previous cycle in paying for his child's university fees.

Helmi is very impressed with the results he obtained with his loans especially that he is capable of achieving one of his biggest personal goals which is to provide the best education for his children.

He hopes to continue improving his business to provide his family with financial support.

loans.use: to pay his child's university fees

loans.name: Heydi Aracely

texts.es: Doña Heydi de 26 años Es una señorita que desde pequeña ha trabajado para sostenimiento de su hogar; porque su madre murió cuando tenía 15 años, quedando ella como responsable de sus hermanos de la alimentación y los gastos del hogar; ahora tiene 26 años es la más pequeña de 4 hermanos y cuenta con su propio negocio tiene una tienda de productos varios de consumo diario, necesita comprar más productos para tener bien surtida su tienda. Actualmente está estudiando en la universidad quiere prepararse para ser una profesional y administrar bien su negocio, su sueño es construir su casa con las ganancias y seguir apoyando a sus hermanos porque aún no están casados. Está feliz Dios la ha bendecido porque cada día son más los clientes que la visitan.
texts.en:
26-year old Señorita Heydi has worked to support her family ever since she was young because her mother died when she was 15 years old. Heydi took over responsibility for raising her brothers and sisters and paying for household expenses. She is now 26 and the youngest of four siblings. She has her own business, a store where she sells daily necessities.

Now Heydi needs to buy more stock for her store. She is currently studying at university as she wants to get professional qualifications and be able to administer her store properly. Her dream is to build a house of her own with the profits and continue supporting her siblings as they are still not married. She feels blessed as each day more customers visit her store.

loans.use: Buy daily necessities to sell in her store

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en:
Abigail is a junior high school graduate, and she is involved in selling smoked and salted fish at Abaka Nkwanta market in Twifo Praso. She is married to a farmer, and has four children. She has been involved in this small trading for almost five years. 

Abigail plans on using her loan to purchase additional amounts of smoked fish due to increased customer demand, thus helping her sell more. Abigail aspires to use her profits to take care of her children’s education and also to plough money back into her business (invest). 

She hopes that this strategy will allow her to expand her present customer base.

loans.use: to purchase additional amounts of smoked fish.

loans.name: Halima

texts.ru: Халима живет на юге Таджикистана в отдаленном регионе. Она родилась в 1968 года. Халима 9 лет назад начала свой бизнес животноводством. Она 9 лет назад была в тяжелой финансовой ситуации и нуждалась поддержке. Благодаря, поддержке своего мужа, она смогла организовать свой бизнес. Вначале ей было очень трудно. Постепенно, год за годом она развевала свой бизнес. Данное время она введет своё дело успешно. Халима откармливает крупно – рогатого скота. Она откармливает 6 голов скота и откармливает этот скот дома. Халима хочет увеличить оборотный капитал. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 долларов США для покупки 5 голов крупно – рогатого скота. Она ждет вашу доброту. Этот займ поможет ей развевать бизнес и получать больше дохода.
texts.en: Halima lives in a remote region in the south of Tajikistan. She was born in 1968. Nine years ago, Halima started a cattle breeding business. Nine years ago she was in a difficult financial position and needed assistance. Thanks to her husband's support, she was able to build her business. In the beginning it was very difficult. Gradually, year after year, she improved her business. Now, her business is successful. Halima fattens cattle. She fattens six head of cattle at home. Halima wants to increase her working capital. She is asking for a loan of $3,000 to buy five more head of cattle. She's awaiting your kindness. This loan will help her to improve the business and generate more revenue.

loans.use: buy cattle and increase working capital

loans.name: Theara

texts.en:
Theara is a resident of Prasat Bakong district, a rural part of Siem Reap province. She has dedicated her lifetime to her farming business, primarily growing rice and beans on a few plots of farmland. She is married to a local man who works in the same career. Together, they have been blessed with five children of various ages. From her current business, Theara is able to make an income of $5 per day on average. 

At this time, Theara needs to hire laborers to help her harvest her bean crops, but she has insufficient capital to pay for labor costs. That’s why she is asking for a loan in the sum of 600 US dollars from HKL, a longstanding Kiva partner. This loan will enable her to harvest and sell her bean crops in the market on time. She hopes to sells them at a good price, so she can repay the loan to the institute, using another portion of her income to provide for the family’s needs.

loans.use: to hire laborers to help her harvest her bean crops.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is a 44 year-old married woman with three children. Two of her children are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 
 
Elenita has a dressmaking business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. Elenita requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through the NWTF to buy more materials like fabric, threads, buttons, etc. for her business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Elenita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials like fabric, threads, buttons, etc. for her business

loans.name: Irebero Cb Group

texts.en:
Esther is 38 years old. She is married with three children aged between two and six. She is a group leader of Irebero meaning “The Example” in English. They have been working together as a group for the past five years.  With the loan, she wants to buy more foodstuffs for sale.  She is planning to reinvest in the business by again buying more foodstuffs for sale.

All the group members are dedicated to upgrading their businesses. In the group photo, Esther raised her right hand to identify her from other group members.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: Yassin

texts.en: Yassin appreciates Yehu Microfinance Trust and Kiva for their support with the previous loan, which enabled him to buy charcoal for resale. He is now requesting another loan of 20,000 KES to purchase more stock of charcoal for resale. This will supplement his income and support his family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Ackie

texts.en:
Ackie is 48 years old and married. She is a high school graduate. She has three children between the ages of 17 and 32. Only two are in school and living at home. Ackie lives in the Airport area, one of the best-known places in Mirgibi County.

For the past five years, Ackie has been selling charcoal and foods, like palm oil, rice, beans, okra, and peppers. She sells them at the local market. She uses a taxi most of the time, to bring her goods to the market. She really faces a problem during the rainy season, because she does not have a good selling spot in the local market. Ackie is requesting a loan to increase her sales, by buying more goods to sell, of the kind already listed. Her dream is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to increase her sales by buying more charcoal and foods to sell, like rice, beans, okra, and peppers

loans.name: Bancy

texts.en:
Bancy is 40 years old and she lives in the Nanyuki area in Central province. She is a single mother of two. One of the children attends school and the eldest is finished with school. 

Bancy runs a boutique business that she has operated for the last ten years. This business has been feeding her and the children. She now seeks a loan to buy handbags, shoes and clothing materials. She also bakes cakes for weddings and she gets extra income from it. 

She learned about Milango through friends who invited her to join so that she could access credit to fund her business. The challenges that she faces in the business are lack of capital to expand and competition from other traders. The income that she will earn in the business will improve her living standards and also enable her child to get a better education.

loans.use: to buy handbags, shoes and clothing materials.

loans.name: Annastacia

texts.en:
Annastacia is a married woman, and she has been blessed with children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are for food.

For the past one year, she has operated a retail stall business, selling household consumables like wheat flour, rice and cooking oil. She cites seasonality as her major challenge in the business. 

Annastacia is requesting  KES 20,000 to boost her kiosk by purchasing wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking oil. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Tareem Group

texts.en:
Tareem is a group which consists of four ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. Shifa, 26 years old, is the group leader. She has been selling cosmetics and perfumes for few months to help her family. She is a very hardworking person who very much wants to get ahead. She comments that she always strives to the maximum to be able to help her family. 

Tareem is asking for a loan of 30,000 YER to buy perfumes and cosmetics to stock up and be able to meet customer demand since she has many pending orders that she’d like to be able to fill.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and cosmetics to stock up her business inventory

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro es cliente de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia:

Alejandro , tiene 46 años, esta casado y tiene dos hijos. Se dedica al comercio desde hace 12 años, inició vendiendo antojitos mexicanos pero se le hizo muy desgastante y decidió cambiar el giro a tacos, tortas y refrescos.

Actualmente vende tacos de suadero, longaniza, chuleta, carne enchilada, campechanos, tortas y refrescos de lunes a domingo de 6:30 PM a 1:30 AM.  Este préstamo lo pidio porque necesita hacer unos estudios médicos para su esposa y está presentando algunos problemas y posiblemente le tengan que hacer una cirugía. Ella es muy importante para Alejandro, por lo que esto es su prioridad. 

Gracias a su negocio ha logrado mejorar su economía, pagar deudas previas que tenía y poderles ofrecer educación a mis hijos.
texts.en:
Alejandro is a Kubo Financiero client and this is his story:

Alejandro is 46 years old, married, and has two children. He made a living in trade for 12 years. He started selling traditional Mexican snacks but it was very tiring so he decided to change it up and sell tacos, tortas [Mexican sandwiches], and sodas. 

He sells beef shank, sausage, pork chop, chilied beef, and mixed tacos, as well as tortas and sodas Monday through Sunday from 6:30 pm to 1:30 am. He is requesting this loan because a little while ago, his wife had some tests done and they have revealed some problems. They might have to perform a curettage on her. She is very important to him, which is why this is a priority. 

Thanks to his business, he has been able to improve his finances, pay previous debts that he has, and give his children an education."

loans.use: to pay for medical tests for his wife.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en: Carolina dreams of becoming a scientist. Carolina was accepted into the Universidad San Francisco Xavier and now, with the chance to achieve her dream, is concerned about affording her school costs. She shares that her alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until she could return. Carolina shares that it is important to her to graduate on time so she can enter into the job market as soon as possible. With this loan, Carolina plans to buy her school books. Up until now, she has been managing to get by without them but it has become a challenge. With books and school supplies, she feels she will be able to get better grades. In addition to her responsibilities at school, Carolina currently works 20 hours a week and earns $2 a day as a nanny. With a degree in laboratory sciences, she expects to earn $17 a day. Unfortunately, Carolina's parents never had the opportunity to complete their high school education. Without the opportunity for a higher degree, her parents never had the chance to move up. Growing up, finances have always been tight. As the youngest of four, with one older sibling attending college already, Carolina is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan.

loans.use: to pay for books and school supplies

loans.name: Lady Sussi

texts.en: Lady dreams of becoming an accountant but without a degree, knows it may never be possible. Lady was accepted into the Universidad Juan Misael Saracho and now, with the chance to achieve her dream, is concerned about affording her school costs. With this loan, Lady plans to purchase her much needed textbooks and school supplies. With the proper books, Lady feels she will be able to study more effectively and earn better grades. In addition to her responsibilities at school, Lady currently works 30 hours a week. With a degree in public accounting & finance, she expects to earn $30 a day. Unfortunately, Lady's parents never had the opportunity to complete their high school education and without the opportunity for a higher degree, her parents never had the chance to move up. Growing up, the family's finances were always tight. With seven older siblings, Lady is unsure how she will be able to afford her tuition fees on her own without the assistance of a Vittana loan. Lady's father's salary from his job as a merchant is the family's primary source of income. Lady hopes to be able to contribute towards her family's income in the near future.

loans.use: to pay for textbooks

loans.name: Sherozjon

texts.ru: Шерозчон жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый мужчина в возрасте 30 лет. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Шерозчон со своей женой живут душа в душу, и стараются воспитывать своих детей хорошими людьми. Шерозчон и его жена очень рады растить своих детей. Для того, чтобы иметь доход на проживание Шерозчон занимается своим бизнесом. Вот уже на протяжении пяти лет он занимается купля продажей фруктов и овощей. Раньше он занимался деканством и потом решил реализовывать свой урожай. Он перевозит на собственной грузовой машине урожай, который получил от своего дехканства в город на рынок для продажи. А также покупает на рынке другого вида овощи и фрукты и продаёт их в своём селе. Этот бизнес приносит ему постоянный хороший доход. И сейчас Шерозчон хочет расширить свой бизнес, обустроить возле своего дома небольшой прилавок, где его жена будет продавать разнообразные овощи и фрукты. Поэтому он хочет взять кредит для закупа большого ассортимента овощей и фруктов. Для получения кредита Шерозчон обратился в Арванд и надеется на положительный результат.
texts.en: Sherozjon is a cheerful and hard-working man, thirty years old. He is married and has three children. Sherozjon and his wife live in perfect harmony, and they try to bring up their children to be good people. Sherozjon and his wife are very happy to be raising their children. In order to make a living, Sherozjon works in business. Over the last five years he has been buying and selling fruit and vegetables. Previously, he worked on a collective farm, and then he  decided to work selling their crops. He loads up the collective farm's crop on his personal truck and hauls it to the city the market to sell. He also buys other fruits and vegetables from the market and resells them in his village. This business brings him a good, steady income. Now Sherozjon wants to expand his business, he wants to build a small stall near his home where his wife can sell a variety of vegetables and fruits. He wants to take out a loan to buy a large variety of vegetables and fruits. Sherozjon approached Arvand for a loan, and he is hoping for a positive outcome.

loans.use: purchase fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Akhtar

texts.en:
Akhtar is a 55-year-old married woman who has been running a business selling milk with her husband for many years. She has four buffaloes that produce milk. She sells this milk to the people of her locality. She looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them, while her husband sells it to different places on a daily basis. 

She has three children and needs to earn much more profits to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and health care. In order to make more profits, she requested a loan of 25,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo. It will help her to increase both her sales and profits. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo for her business selling milk.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is 36 years old, a vigorous married woman. She has had a business of doing hand-embroidery for the past seven years. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong. Her husband is employed as a sales person in a grocery store, but he does not earn enough to support his family well. Parveen’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household. 

Parveen is a mother of six children. She wants to grow her business. She requested a loan of Rs 25,000 to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand. 

She shared her dream of running a training center for the girls of her village and is also interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam es una microempresaria clienta de Kubo Financiera y esta su historia:

Miriam tiene 34 años, es soltera y desde hace 15 años se dedica al comercio; vendiendo ropa interior para dama. Anteriormente le ayudaba a su mamá a vender en su negocio y desde hace 15 años decidió poner su negocio propio.

En su negocio vende lencería y ropa interior para dama. Este préstamo le permitirá comprar más mercancía, como corsetería y lencería y así obtener mayores ganancias. 

Miriam se considera una persona responsable, le gusta cumplir sus obligaciones y estar al corriente en sus pagos. Gracias al tiempo y esfuerzo invertido en su negocio ha logrado gozar de una estabilidad económica y salir de vacaciones ocasionalmente.
texts.en:
Miriam is a small business client of Kubo Financiera and this is her story:

She is 34 years old and single. For the past 15 years she has made a living as a merchant, selling ladies underwear. Previously she helped her mother with her lingerie business and then 15 years ago she decided to start her own business.

This loan will enable Miriam to purchase more merchandise, such as corsets and lingerie and thus earn more profits.

Miriam is considered to be a responsible person. She enjoys meeting her obligations and is up to date on her re-payments. Thanks to the time and effort invested in her business, she has succeeded in enjoying economic stability and in going on vacations occasionally. .

loans.use: to purchase lingerie and corsets to stock her business.

loans.name: Angelo

texts.en:
Working in the security industry, Angelo had a desire to pursue other ventures. A couple of months ago, Angelo started his own contracting business with his brother and brother-in-law. This three-man team will be in charge of refurbishing vacant property so that it can be resold on the residential market.
 
Angelo’s team has received more contract offers than they can presently handle with their company size. So, they will use this loan to help with working capital, allowing them to obtain the necessary licenses and insurance they need to expand their business.

loans.use: To purchase insurance and licensing

loans.name: Yamil

texts.en:
Yamil is 34 years old.  He is married and is raising two children with his wife.  Yamil is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar region.  Yamil raises fruits and vegetables in his garden and has been doing this for the last four years.  He is a very experienced farmer and has a deep knowledge of the land and how to work it. 

Yamil typically grows seasonal fruits and vegetables and sells them for a profitable price in the central bazaar.  Fresh fruits and vegetables are very popular and in high demand because people like to eat them every day and consider them very healthy. His monthly income from this business is 120 AZN.  This is only one source of income for his family.

At present, he would like to invest more capital in his business and purchase seeds and fertilizers.  For this purpose, he has applied for a loan of 2,000 AZN.  He hopes this loan will improve life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Рустам заботливый отец 6 детей. Он хороший семьянин и воспитывает своих детей прекрасно. Рустам является основным кормильцем семьи, так как его жена домохозяйка и не имеет источника дохода. Рустам более 10 лет занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур как кукурузы, морковь, помидор и т.п. Рустам продает свой урожай на местном рынке. Его старшие дочери помогают ему введению бизнеса. Рустам нуждается финансовой поддержки. Его дочь выходит замуж. Рустам должен провести ее свадебное торжество, но не имеет денег. Он недавно сделал осенний посев. Рустам запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 сомони для проведения свадебного торжества своей дочери. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Rustam is the caring father of six children. He's a good family man and is raising his children well. Rustam is the main breadwinner of the family--his wife is a housewife and does not make money. For more than ten years, Rustam has been farming crops like corn, carrots, tomatoes, etc. Rustam sells his harvest at the local market. His older daughter helps him run the business. Rustam is in need of financial support. His daughter is getting married. Rustam has to hold her wedding reception, but has no money. He recently finished the autumn sowing. Rustam is asking for a loan of 2500 KGS to pay for his daughter's wedding celebration. He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: pay for his daughter's wedding.

loans.name: Xayyal

texts.en:
Xayyal is a young married man who is 25 years old.  He has one daughter.  Xayyal is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar region.  He manages the planting and harvesting of fruits and vegetables on his own land.  Xayyal has been involved in farming for five years.  He is the only breadwinner of the family and, to meet his family's everyday needs, he works every day.  His wife assists him greatly in his horticultural activities. 

To be able to continue his agribusiness in a sustainable way, Xayyal needs a loan of   2,000 AZN in order to purchase seeds and fertilizer.  He and his family are very thankful to all the lenders for helping them sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and  fertilizer.

loans.name: Rit

texts.en:
Rit, 38, is from a rural village of Kampong Thom province. She is a hard-working woman who devotes her energy and time to a farming business. She learned to work the land from her parents when she was a young girl. Farming is a traditional business of her family, having been passed down for generations. During the rainy reason, which lasts from May to October, Rit spends all day long in her paddy fields to ensure a good growth of her rice crop. Normally, her harvest is collected in the middle of November or a bit later. Thanks to her efforts, her current business enables her to earn a suitable income to provide for the basic needs of her family members.

At this time, Rit needs to hire laborers to help her harvest her two-hectare fields but she has insufficient capital to cover the costs. That’s why she is asking for a loan of KHR 500,000 to pay for labor costs. This will be her third loan from HKL Institute. Rit hopes that she will have an abundant harvest, which she will sell to the local markets for a good price.

loans.use: to hire laborers to help with harvesting her two-hectare fields.

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
Raed is a 28-year-old single man who has worked as a barber for two years. He works hard to make his living. He is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to make necessary maintenance repairs to his house before the winter season. He will also use part of the loan to buy a certain quantity of diesel to warm up during the winter season.
Raed hopes that through his future loans, he will be capable of establishing his own barber shop which will improve his living.

loans.use: To make necessary maintenance repairs to his house before the winter season

loans.name: Songheng

texts.en: Songheng is 48 years and lives in Stueng Saen district, Kampong Thom province. His wife is a homemaker and a mother of four children. Songheng is in two business ventures: farming rice and sourcing-and-purchasing hair to sell. His earnings allow him to provide meals and educate his children at school. His challenge in his second business is that he doesn’t own a motorcycle, so he cannot visit the far areas of the province. To solve this problem, Songheng would like to acquire a loan in the sum of 1,500 US dollars to buy a motorcycle to support him in his current business. Through this purchase, he hopes that he will be able to improve his household income so he can provide his family members with their basic needs. Thanks to all lenders around the world who have contributed the funds into a program like Kiva, which enables low-income people to improve their business as well as living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to support him in his current business.

loans.name: Yeun

texts.en:
Yeun is 52 years old,  and a widowed mother of six children. She currently lives with her two single children in her own home in Bakan District, Pursat Province, while the other children have their independent lives. To earn a living, Yeun plants and harvests rice to sell in the local markets or to local traders. Farming is the sole source of income for her family. She has been in this occupation for more than 30 years.

Since she doesn’t have a safe latrine for use at home, she is unable to help her family members improve their sanitation and personal hygiene. In this regard, she has requested a loan of 1,000 US dollars to build a household latrine and buy its necessaries. 

Thanks to the water loan program offered by HKL with a special interest rate, she is encouraged to focus on healthy living conditions, safeguard the health of her family and protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a household latrine and buy its necessaries.

loans.name: Caridad Group

texts.es:
Caridad es el nombre de un grupo integrado por 11 mujeres emprendedoras, este grupo está ubicado en la comunidad de la victoria donde la principal fuente de empleo es el campo en la siembra y cultivo de caña de azúcar y la fabrica vidriera.
Luz María tiene la edad de 52 años, estudio la secundaria y esta casada con el señor Raúl que es cañero. La pareja tuvo dos hijos, un hombre que ya es dependiente y una hija de 22 años de nombre Amairan que estudia la carrera y aún está a cargo de la pareja. Sin embargo, Luz María también se encarga de proveer a su nieta Catarina, de 15 años que asiste a la secundaria. Catarina quedó a cargo de la pareja desde pequeño. 

Luz María comenta que siempre tuvo la inquietud de iniciar a trabajar para ganar su propio dinero pero fue hace 5 años cuando inicio a vender zapatos ya que su hija iniciaba la carrera y tenía que salir a estudiar fuera no les alcanzaba para cubrirlos gastos, ella poco a poco fue ganado popularidad con su venta  de zapatos y actualmente ya tiene mucho clientes, ella realiza sus ventas casa por casa va mostrando a sus clientes sus catálogos y levantando pedidos los cuales surte posteriormente y entrega. Un crédito de VisionFund le ayudará comprar variedad de zapatos para continuar con sus ventas y sus ganancias las empleara en seguir pagando los estudios de su hija y su nieta. 
Los demás integrantes de grupo son:
Alejandra venta de calzado,
Cristina cría de cerdos,
Amalia venta de comida,
Karla venta de quesos,
Maria Victoria venta de carne, 
Susana refaccionaria,
Maura venta de comida y postres
Edith venta de ropa
Mariana cria de cerdos.
Isabel venta de refrescos.
texts.en:
This group’s name is Caridad and is composed of eleven enterprising women. The group is from Victoria, a community where the main sources of employment are the sugar cane fields and a glass factory.

Luz María is 52 years old. She finished high school and is married to Raúl, who works in the cane fields. The couple have two kids, one man that is still dependent on them and a 22-year-old daughter, Amairan, who studies at the university, and is also still dependent on her parents. However, Luz Maria also takes care of one of her grandchildren, Catarina, who is 15 and goes to high school. She has been with the couple since she was little.

Luz says that she always wanted to work and make her own money, but five years ago she started selling shoes, since her daughter started studying away from home and they could not cover the expenses. Little by little, she started becoming well-known with her shoes business and has now many customers. She sells door-to-door, showing her customers her catalogs and taking orders that she delivers after some time. With a loan from VisionFund, she will be able to buy different shoes and continue selling. She will use the profits to continue paying for her daughter’s and granddaughter’s studies.

The remaining members are:
Alejandra, who sells shoes; Cristina, who raises pigs; Amalia, who sells food; Karla, who sells cheese; Maria Victoria, who sells meat; Susana, who sells spare parts; Maura, who sells food and desserts; Edith, who sells clothes; Mariana, who sells pigs; and Isabel, who sells beverages.

loans.use: to buy different types of shoes.

loans.name: Dancan

texts.en:
Dancan is 50 years old, and is from Nakuru. He is married to Jane, who is a business woman, and they are blessed with four children aged 27, 25, 18 and 15 years old.

He has a business selling scrap metal, which he has been running for the last 19 years. He has applied for his second loan of KES 40,000 from KADET LTD, which will be used to buy more stock of scrap metal. 

Dancan's monthly income right now is KES 35,000, and he intends to use profits from his expanded business to educate his children and to pay back his loan to KADET LTD.

His hopes and dreams for his future business and family are to excel and to always be far above the poverty line.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of scrap metal.

loans.name: Jose Noe

texts.es:
José, solicita capital para invertir en la siembra de yuca y maíz, con la inversión comprara fertilizantes, herbicidas, abono, semilla y para el alquiles de la tierra, espera sacar una cosecha muy abundante.
Con el préstamo anterior el cultivo y obtuvo mejores ganancias, mayor producción, cancelo la deuda y mejor sus condiciones de vida junto a su familia tienen mejor alimentación, todos se encuentran saludables.
texts.en:
José is applying for a loan to invest in his yuca and maize crops. He will use this loan to buy fertilizer, herbicide, manure, and seeds, as well as to pay the rent on his land. He hopes to have an abundant harvest.

With his previous loan, he earned a higher income and improved his production. He paid off his debt and improved his quality of life. He and his family have better nutrition and they are all healthy.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, manure, and seeds.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a married woman, age 27. She lives at a house that neither has electricity not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She operates a fruit and vegetable stall selling at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of competition and seasonality in her business. 

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of fruit, such as oranges and bananas, and green vegetables for resale. She dreams of expanding and establishing a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits such as oranges and bananas, and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience is a divorced woman and has been blessed with one child. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumables like wheat flour, rice and cooking oil. She cites seasonality as her major challenge in the business. 

She is requesting a loan of KES 30,000 to boost her business by purchasing bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Oscar Rodrigo

texts.en:
Oscar dreams of becoming an international trade manager. Oscar is currently attending the Universidad Tecnologia Boliviana, working towards his degree in international trade management. He expects to graduate in June, 2016 but without a loan is unsure how he will be able to continue affording his education. He shares that his alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until he could return. 

Oscar shares that it is important to him to graduate on time so he can enter into the job market as soon as possible. With this loan, Oscar plans buying his school books. Up until now he has been managing to get by without them but it has become a challenge. With books and school supplies he feels he will be able to get better grades. In addition to his responsibilities at school, Oscar currently works 40 hours a week as a cashier in a shop and earns $9 a day. With a career in international trade management, he expects to earn $34 a day, a substantial increase from before. With four siblings Oscar is unsure how he will be able to finance his education on his own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan.

loans.use: to pay for books and school supplies

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena wants to be an accountant. Elena is currently attending the Instituto Tecnológico Caranavi, working towards her degree but without a loan from Vittana she thinks that she may need to take time off to work and save until she can return to school. With a loan, Elena plans on covering the cost of her graduation fees. Often there are fees for earning your title in accounting before graduating. Elena currently works 30 hours a week and earns $9 a day but making time to work and go to school has been one of her biggest challenges. With a degree in accounting she expects to earn $14 a day. 

Elena's parents were never able to complete their primary education. With one younger brother, Elena hopes to be a role model for her younger sibling by being the first in her family to graduate from university. Elena's father's income from his job as a farmer is the family's primary source of income, and Elena hopes to be able to contribute towards her family's income in the near future.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en: Rolando dreams of becoming a musician. Rolando is currently attending the Universidad Autonoma Tomas Frias, working towards his degree in music. He plans to graduate in December 2014, but without a loan from Vittana, he thinks that he may need to take time off to work and save until he can return to school. With this loan, Rolando plans to pay for his tuition. In addition to his responsibilities at school, Rolando currently works 20 hours a week and earns $13 a day but with a degree in music he expects to earn $20 a day. Unfortunately, Rolando's parents never had the opportunity to complete their high school education. Without the opportunity for a higher degree, his parents never had the chance to move up. Growing up, finances have always been tight. With three older siblings attending college already, Rolando is unsure how he will be able to finance his education on his own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan. Rolando's father works in construction and his salary is the family's primary source of income. For a family of nine, finances have always been tight.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Ruth Esther

texts.en: Ruth dreams of becoming a lawyer. Ruth was accepted into the Universidad Juan Misael Saracho and now, with the chance to achieve her dream, is concerned about affording her school expenses. She plans to graduate in December 2015, but without a loan from Vittana, she thinks that she may need to take time off to work and save until she can return to school. With this loan, Ruth plans to purchase her much-needed textbooks and school supplies. With the proper books, Ruth feels she will be able to study more effectively and earn better grades. With a career in law, she expects to earn $10 a day, a substantial increase from before. With one older sibling, Ruth is unsure how she will be able to afford her school textbooks on her own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan.

loans.use: to pay for textbooks

loans.name: Mauricio Gustavo

texts.en:
Mauricio dreams of becoming a business administrator but without a degree knows it may never be possible. Mauricio was accepted into the Universidad Autonoma Tomas Frias and now with the chance to achieve his dream is concerned about affording his final graduation fee. He plans on graduating in December, 2014 but without a loan from Vittana he thinks that he may need to take time off to work and save until he can return to school. 

With this loan, Mauricio plans on paying his graduation fee. This fee is often more expensive than the semester's tuition and is a frequent impediment for graduating students in Potosi. In addition to his responsibilities at school, Mauricio currently works 30 hours a week. With a degree in business administration he expects to earn $25 a day. With one older sibling attending college already, Mauricio is unsure how he will be able to finance his education on his own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Doña  Marcela es una señora de 41  años de edad, actualmente está casada y vive en el Departamento de Sololá. Ella tiene cuatro  hijas de 12, 15,11 y 8 años, la mayor ayuda a su madre en el negocio y las otras tres aun están estudiando.
Ella actualmente tiene una tienda de abarrotes en el lugar de su vivienda, la cual es una fuente de ingresos económicos para su familia. Cuenta que inicio esta actividad hace diez  años, viendo la necesidad de su familia y la de sus vecinos de tener una tienda de abarrotes en la comunidad para facilitar el acceso a productos de primera necesidad para toda la gente de su comunidad.
Ella  ha visto que las ventas se han mantenido durante estos años y ahora por la temporada del año la demanda en algunos productos aumentan, es por eso ella que desea invertir en su negocio solicitando un préstamo de Q 7,000.00 para comprar más  productos de consumo diario y ampliar su tienda de abarrotes, de este modo ella puede brindarles un  mejor servicio a sus clientes y obtener mejores ganancias para mantener a su familia.
Su sueño es abrir otro negocio para generar más ganancias y de esta manera seguir ayudando a sus hijos a que puedan terminar sus estudios y tener mejores oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Marcela is 41 years old, married, and lives in the department of Solalá. She has four daughters aged 12, 15, 11 and 8. The eldest helps her mother with her business and the others are still at school.

Currently Marcela has a grocery store in her home; with the income from the store she supports the family. She started the business ten years ago when she saw her own family's need and that of her neighbours for a nearby grocery where they could buy daily necessities.

She has maintained steady sales through the years, and now at this time of year the demand for certain products increases. For this reason she wishes to borrow Q7,000.00 to buy more daily basics as stock for the store. She will have more products to offer her customers and will earn more money for her family.

Marcela's dream is to open another business and earn more money so she can continue helping her children complete their education and have more opportunities in life.

loans.use: Buy more stock for her grocery store

loans.name: Aipara

texts.ru: Айпаре 52 года, вдова, одна растит троих детей. Айпара в поисках доходов для своей семьи начала небольшой бизнес по пошиву национальной одежды, стартовав с суммы 20,000 сом (KGS). Бизнес очень хороший, а самое главное Айпара с удовольствием занимается своей работой-шитьем, которое приносит ей ежемесячный доход в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS). Также Айпара дополнительно занимается животноводством и полеводством в хозяйстве у нее имеется: 1 дойная корова с теленком и 5 овец, а также имеет небольшой земельный надел, на котором выращивает картофель, помидоры и кукурузу. В целях дальнейшего развития животноводства, Айпара обратилась в Микрофинансовый Банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом, в сумме 100,000 сом(KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Айпара планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового дома.
texts.en: Aipara is 52 years old, a widow, and is raising three children by herself. Aipara, needing an income, started a small business making traditional clothes with an investment of 20,000 KGS. Business is very good, and most importantly Aipara takes pleasure in her sewing work. This gives her a monthly income of 15,000 KGS. Also, Aipara works in animal husbandry and farming. Her farm has one dairy cow, a calf, five sheep, and a small plot of land where she grows potatoes, tomatoes and corn. In order to expand her animal husbandry business, Aipara approached the microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 KGS to buy sheep for breeding. Aipara plans to use income from the loan to expand her livestock and plans to save enough money to build a new home.

loans.use: buy sheep

loans.name: Kairylnisa

texts.ru: Кайрылнисе 60 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Кайрылнисы - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Кайрылниса занимается животноводством, стартовав 18 лет назад, с покупки скота на 8,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Кайрылнисы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 6 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). Кайрылниса входит в группу "Алмалы", в эту группу входят еще 2 человека. Кайрылниса является третьим членом группы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кайрылниса обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Кайрылниса планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Kairylnisa is 60 years old, married, and raised five children with her husband. Kairylnisa has a secondary education. The family's main source of income is animal husbandry, a business Kairylnisa began 18 years ago with the purchase of 8,000 KGS of cattle. Thanks to Kairylnisa's hard work, her farm now has  one dairy cow, and six sheep. Her monthly income is 5,000 KGS. Kairylnisa is a member of the group Almali. This group includes two other people. Kairylnisa ​​is the third member of the group. In order to further develop her farm, Kairylnisa asked the microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 25,000 KGS to buy sheep for breeding. Kairylnisa plans to invest profits from the loan into further expanding her number of livestock.

loans.use: buy sheep

loans.name: Najma

texts.en: Najma is a 42-year-old married woman. She has run a beauty parlor for a period of about 6 years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Through doing her best at providing these services she has become very famous on her street. In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more variety of cosmetics products for the parlor. However, because of having low cash in hand she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 35,000 PKR to buy large quantities of hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening. She hopes to cater to more customers time after time. She is in her second loan cycle and has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening.

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en: Uzma is a 56-year-old woman and the mother of four children. She buys cloths of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. She is requesting a 45,000 PKR loan from Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloths in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Hameedan

texts.en:
Hameedan has successfully built her business sewing gloves with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She is trying hard to meet the needs of her children including food, healthcare, clothing, and education. Over the time she has attained regular list of customers and earns good amount of income to contribute to the family income. 

To cope with the increasing demand of her customers she applied for a loan of Rs. 20,000. In this way she will be able to purchase more spools of thread and wool in different colors along with packs of needles. She is in her 7th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend it on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread and wool in different colors along with packs of needles.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en: Rani has successfully built up her general store with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many regular customers.  Previously she took a loan to purchase stock of rice and flour; currently she applied a loan of Rs. 25,000 to purchase packs of oil, grains and beverages. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to purchase packs of oil, grains and beverages.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia:

Margarita vive en unión libre desde hace 12 años y únicamente uno de sus hijos depende económicamente de ella aún. Es una mujer que siempre ha luchado para sacar adelante a sus hijos, a quienes mantuvo sola por mucho tiempo y gracias a su trabajo lo logró.

Desde hace 12 años vende en un transitado cruce productos para la salud y dietéticos, así como cócteles e fruta. Su puesto es armable y lo pone de lunes a sábado de 9 am a 10 pm, además de su puesto vende juguetes en el tianguis los domingos; ya muchas personas la conocen y son clientes frecuentes.  

Este préstamo le ayudará a comprar mercancía para la temporada navideña y estar lista para lo que le pidan sus clientes. Gracias a su trabajo Margarita ha logrado comprar muebles para su casa, un carro que lo sacó en pagos y su reto es ganarse un auto con la empresa de productos dietéticos que ofrece siendo de las mejores vendedoras.
texts.en:
Margarita is a client of Kubo Financiero and this is her story:

Margarita has lived in a common-law relationship for 12 years, and only one of her children still depends on her financially.  She is a woman who has always fought to get her children ahead.  For a long time, she supported them by herself and thanks to her hard work, she succeeded.

For twelve years she has sold health and diet products, such as fruit and fruit cocktails, at a busy intersection. Her stand is portable, and she puts it up from Monday to Saturday, 9 a.m. to 10 p.m.  Besides her stand, she also sells toys in the market on Sundays.  Many people know her already and are frequent customers.

This loan will help her to buy merchandise for the Christmas season and to be ready for what her customers ask for.  Thanks to her work, Margarita has managed to buy furniture for her house and a car that she makes payments on. Her challenge is to earn a car that the diet product company offers to the best sellers.

loans.use: to stock merchandise in preparation for the Christmas season

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
Rogelio es un cliente de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia:

Rogelio es casado, tiene tres hijos (de los cuales dependen de él 2 aún), vive en casa propia y tiene un negocio de venta de dulces y refrescos afuera de una escuela.

Aparte de vender dulces y refrescos, Rogelio ofrece a sus clientes frituras y algunos juguetes. Este préstamo lo pide para poder invertir en mercancía y así poder ofrecer más, vender más e incrementar sus ingresos. Rogelio se describe como una persona responsable y cumplida.

Sus logros es haber sacado adelante a su familia gracias a su trabajo y también ha podido apoyar a su esposa, quien también vende dulces fuera de otra escuela.
texts.en:
Rogelio is a client of Kubo Financiero and this is his story.

Rogelio is married and has three children, two of whom are still dependent on him. He owns his home and has a business selling sweets and soft drinks outside of a school.

In addition to selling sweets and soft drinks, Rogelio offers his customers fried food and some toys. He is requesting this loan to invest in merchandise so he can offer more, sell more and increase his earnings. Rogelio is described as a responsible and polite person.

His achievements include moving his family ahead thanks to his hard work. He has also been able to support his wife who also sells sweets outside of another school.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise in greater volume and increase his sales.

loans.name: Dania Suyapa

texts.es:
Dania es mujer de 35 años de edad está acompañada y tiene tres hijos el mayor cursa ciclo común y los dos últimos estudian en educación primaria. Ella Cuenta con un grado de estudio realizado secundario completo la cual se gradúo como Bachiller en Ciencias y Letras y junto a su compañero de hogar se dedica a la agricultura. Ella también es comerciante dedicándose a la venta de comida en un pequeño comedor situado en la comunidad donde ella habita el cual junto a sus cultivos de café han podido sacar adelante a sus hijos y cubrir las necesidades que diariamente se presentan. En la agricultura especialmente con el café es un producto delicado y de no tratarse a tiempo con los insumos necesario puede perderse la cosecha completa. 
Es por ello que ha solicitado financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL con el cual comprara 12 QQ de fertilizantes, 12 QQ de urea 10 QQ de formula cafetalera entre otros con los cuales mantendrá segura y sana su cosecha de café.
Sus metas a largo plazo son las de ampliar sus cultivos de café con la compra de más tierra, sembrar una variedad de café más competitiva y tecnificar sus cultivos. También ella desea acondicionar más su pequeño establecimiento ya que de esa manera ella podrá atender una mayor cantidad de clientes y esto traerá mayores ingresos para su familia y hogar. Sus sueños es mediante a los ingresos darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, mejores oportunidades de estudio de las que ella tuvo en su juventud dando la oportunidad a sus hijos de enviarlos a la universidad para que sean personas de provecho.
texts.en:
Dania, 35, is in a relationship and has three children. Her oldest child is in secondary school and the two younger children are in primary school. She finished secondary school with a diploma in Science and Humanities. 

Along with her partner, she works in agriculture. She is also a businesswoman, selling food in a small cafeteria in the community where she lives. Along with her coffee plants, this has allowed her to provide for her children and cover the household's daily expenses. 

Coffee is a particularly delicate product, and if she does not have the necessary supplies in time, she can lose the entire harvest. Therefore, she has applied for a loan from Comixmul which she will use to buy twelve quintals of fertilizer, twelve quintals of urea, and ten quintals of coffee formula, among other supplies. She will then be able to keep her coffee crops safe and healthy.

Her long-term goals are to expand her coffee crops by buying more land, to plant a more competitive variety of coffee, and to make her crops more technical. She would also like to better equip her small business so that she can serve a greater number of clients, bringing in a better income for her family and her household. Her dream is to give her family a better quality of life with her earnings and to offer her children better educational opportunities than she had in her youth. She hopes to be able to send them to university so that they can become productive citizens.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies for her coffee plants.

loans.name: 32-Las Guerrilleras Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento 32-LAS GUERRILLERAS está compuesto por ocho integrantes ocho mujeres, todos ellos se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es la señora Yesmi en la foto la de la polera rosada fuccia, tiene 24 años casada con un hijito de la edad de tres años,  ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, ella vende sus productos de manera ambulante en la feria populosa de la Cancha, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la señora Yesmi va a usar este préstamo para compra de mercadería ,  la señora Yesmi enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando  mercadería  para ir mejorando su negocio  así de esta manera genera más ingresos económicos ya que ella sola se encarga de mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
The  32-LAS GUERRILLERAS Bank has eight members, all of them women who earn their living in a variety of ways. President of the bank is Sra. Yesmi who is wearing a fuschia-coloured t-shirt in the photo. She is 24 years old and married with a 3-year old son. Yesmi earns her living selling clothing in the busy market of La Cancha.

This is Yesmi's first loan with the institution and she plans to use the money to buy merchandise. The biggest challenge she faces is competition. She will use the profits she makes to buy more goods and in this way generate more income; she has sole responsibility for supporting her family.

loans.use: Buy clothing at wholesale prices

loans.name: Benigna

texts.es: La Señora Benigna tiene 36  años y es casada con  hijos de las edades de 9 y 11 años, ella se dedica  a la venta de comida en su puesta de venta que se encuentra  que se encuentran ubicado en su mismo domicilio que es en la localidad de El Torno de la ciudad de Santa Cruz,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la Señora Benigna va a usar este préstamo para la compra de material de construcción, para la construcción de un cuarto en su casa y así tener ella más comodidad,  la Señora Benigna enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que en la zona hay muchas pensiones que se dedican a la venta de comida, ella va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando insumos para preparar sus riquísimos platillos,  se siente feliz y agradecida por esta oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Benigna, 36, is married with two children, ages 9 and 11. She makes a living selling food from a stall located in her home. She lives in the area of El Torno in the city of Santa Cruz. This is her first loan with the institution. 

She will use this loan to buy construction materials to build a room onto her house, which will make her more comfortable. Benigna faces some challenges with her business, such as competition from other food salespeople in her area. She will use her earnings to continue buying supplies to make her delicious dishes. She is happy and grateful for the opportunity she has been given.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a room onto her house.

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en:
Saleh is 32-year-old, young client from Bilasuvar. Saleh is an IDP (internally displaced person).  He moved from the City of Fuzuli, and now lives in the Bilasuvar Region with his family. 

After several attempts to find a job, he decided to start his own business. He is a  farmer, and has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last four years.  He breeds cattle, too.

He chose this business because it is profitable, and fresh crops are in high demand. Saleh sells his crops in the central bazaar. His monthly income is 100 AZN. His father actively helps him to raise the crops.

As his products are in high demand, he  wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose, he applied for 2000 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers. This is going to be his first loan.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka is a 38-year-old woman, who is married to John and is the mother of three children. She is a hair dresser and also runs a cosmetic shop in Limuru. She has been in this business for four years now and gets a monthly income of 28,000 KES.

This will be Milka's fourth loan from KADET LTD. She has repaid all her other loans successfully. She plans to use the entire loan to buy hair products for her business. In the future she wants to buy land and build rental houses, and also educate her children.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La señora Martha, no tiene hijos dependientes a su cargo, vive sola en la localidad de Esquilan y es de familia humilde,  se dedica a la producción de leche cruda pero la misma bajo debido a que su ganado no está siendo muy bien alimentado, por ello solicita un crédito de Bs. 10200 para comprar alimento balanceado y soya para su ganado lechero, con un grupo de personas que realizarán la compra en conjunto.
texts.en: Sra. Martha does not have children who are dependent on her. She lives alone in the Esquilan area and is from a family of modest means. She makes a living producing raw milk however production has decreased because her cattle are not being very well nourished. Consequently she is applying for a loan of 10,200 BOB in order to buy nutritional feed and soybeans for her milk cows together with other people who make their purchases as a group.

loans.use: to purchase nutritional feed and soybeans for her cattle.

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en: Reuben is a hardworking man who strives hard to better his living standards. The previous loan helped him to buy more water for sale. Here again he comes to you requesting for a loan of 20,000 KES to buy a stock of fresh drinking water for sale. He appreciates the support.

loans.use: to buy a stock of fresh drinking water for sale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is an industrious woman who strives hard to make ends meet.  The previous loan helped her to stock fish for resale. Here again she comes to you requesting a loan of 100,000 KES in order to purchase two sacks of dry fish for resale.

She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of dry fish for resale.

loans.name: Soule

texts.fr: Soule est un homme de 49 ans marié et père 5 enfants. il est commerçant dans un marché de la place depuis 19 ans où il vend la friperie es vêtements des jeunes, hommes et des dames (en fonction des saisons et des ballots). à cause de la petitesse de son capital, il est obligé d’aller au déballage chaque week-end pour acheter en détail les vêtements qu'il expose dans son comptoir. Cela ne rapporte pas vraiment d'où l'importance de crédit pour son activité parce qu'il lui permettra d'acheter un ballot mixte. Ce qui augmentera non seulement ses ventes mais aussi sa marge bénéficiaire. bénéfice qu'il économisera apportera pour ouvrir une boutique de vêtements.
texts.en: Soule is a 49-year-old married father of five children. He has worked as a vendor in a marketplace for 19 years, where he sells second-hand clothes for young people, men and women (according to the seasons and what clothes are available). As he has very little capital, he is forced to to go to the warehouse every weekend in order to buy specific clothes for him to sell on his stall.
