This doesn't bring in much profit for his business, and it shows why this loan is so important. It will allow him to buy mixed bundles of clothes. He will save the profits he will earn from this loan in order to open a clothes shop.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of clothes

loans.name: Albert Michel

texts.fr: Albert est un homme de 40 ans marié et père 4 enfants. il est commerçant dans un marché de la place depuis 15 ans où il vend les chaussures plastiques des jeunes, hommes et des dames (en fonction des saisons et des ballots). A cause de la petitesse de son capital, il est obligé d’aller au déballage chaque week-end pour acheter en détail les vêtements qu'il expose dans son comptoir. Cela ne rapporte pas vraiment d'où l'importance de crédit pour son activité parce qu'il lui permettra d'acheter un ballot mixte ( homme, femme et enfants). ceci augmentera non seulement son capital, ses ventes, ainsi que sa marge bénéficiaire. Bénéfice qu'il économisera  pour ouvrir une boutique.
texts.en: Albert is a 40-year-old married father of four children. He has worked as a vendor in a marketplace for 15 years, where he sells plastic shoes for young people, men and women (according to the seasons and what shoes are available). As he has very little capital, he is forced to to go to the warehouse every weekend in order to buy specific shoes for him to sell at his stall. This doesn't bring in much profit for his business, and it shows why this loan is so important. It will allow him to buy mixed bundles of shoes (for men, women and children). He will save the profits he will earn from this loan in order to open a shop.

loans.use: to purchase a bundle of shoes

loans.name: Antheline

texts.en: Antheline is a young Cameroonian, age 25. She is single and has a child 10 months old. Antheline has been in this business for over six months, which makes her a bit experienced. Her business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will help increase her monthly turnover from 450,000 to 650,000 FCFA. raising her living standard.

loans.use: to buy stock (candy, chewing gum, bread, sugar, etc.) for her grocery store

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Whereas other writing companies work within a niche, The Master Communicators Writing Services is modeled after a project management business. For instance, a client may bring company owner, Sharon, his current work and she will build her work around the customer’s needs.

“We don’t try to fit you into one of our packages,” Sharon says. “We take you in based on what you need.”

A loving grandmother of four, Sharon moved from Virginia to Houston, Texas, to be closer to her grandchildren where she saw the need to begin a writing assistance business.

“We provide writing services for small businesses, nonprofits and also aspiring authors,” she says. Through her business, Sharon offers assistance in website content, policy and procedure manual writings, proofreading, and content for email campaigns. “I felt the need to provide authors and small businesses with a voice.”

For authors, Sharon offers mentorship for content and book cover creations, help finding editors, and sometimes she works as an editor. As a writer, Sharon understands the struggle new authors face. To help them, she provides marketing and distribution tips. And, for the most part, Sharon works alone.

“I don’t have employees, but I have associates that help with authors. I have editors and graphic artists to network and guide them,” she says. These contracted workers are hired depending on the needs of the author. In a sense, Sharon is a broker between writers, small businesses and nonprofit organizations and artists, editors, publishing companies and anyone else affiliated with the writing industry.

“I’ve been writing since I was 8 years old,” she says. However, her dream was quickly shoved aside as her elders drilled in her head that “I needed a good-paying government job,” she recalls. Taking her family’s advice, Sharon enlisted in one of the last sets of the Women’s Army Corps before the government incorporated co-ed troops. Because she is a veteran, Sharon is often invited to business seminars and workshops. It was during one of these events she learned about Accion Texas, Inc.

Sharon says, “One of the things I want to say about Accion is they are a compassionate lender. I was able to go and share my vision. I didn’t meet a banker hiding behind a desk. I met a person passionate about enabling my vision.”

Her loan to obtain virtual assistance certification allows her to be an author’s assistant. In this role, she can research, help with public access or written permission, obtain cover work, and eliminate confusion.

Sharon plans to hire an employee before May 2014. Check out her show on Blog Talk Radio here: http://www.blogtalkradio.com/themastercommunicator

loans.use: to obtain virtual assistance certification and become a certified author’s assist.

loans.name: Octavio

texts.en:
“I never worked for a company, never. I don’t like having a boss or having no control,” Octavio declares. 

In the middle of his studies to become an architect, Octavio had to leave college and raise money for tuition. So he began working as an interior designer.  By the time he graduated, he didn’t have to look for work because he already had his client list. “I never had the chance to look for a job or be an employee,” he says.

Octavio studied architecture in Mexico, graduated in 2007 and began to make money through U.S. partnerships. However, his knowledge wasn’t enough to attract Brownsville clients who didn’t know him. 

Octavio says he established a name for himself in Mexico, but when he fell in love and moved to Texas to be with his wife, he had to establish a reputation in a new country. 

In his store, The Gallerie, Octavio offers home furnishings and accessories at reasonable prices. “My most expensive item is $400 and it’s a king-sized bed with a headboard,” he says.

Octavio offers a contemporary and simple style. “My target audience is people who make about $300 weekly. They may not be able to make enough to have new furniture,” he says. (Unless you visit his shop, that is.)

In his line of work, Octavio visits with the client to decide what type of furniture they will need to build a comfortable home. “I do the blueprints, construction and interior design,” he says. Since he is building a reputation for himself, Octavio decided to create a showroom to help ease customers when choosing what to purchase. “They wanted to see the product before I bought it. I created a showroom to showcase the quality of products I use,” he says. “They are then more secure about what they’re buying.”

Currently, Octavio employs one designer, but is looking to hire a delivery person in the future. “When you buy stuff from me, I give you installation and delivery free,” he says. 

Before Accion Texas Inc., Octavio went to Compass Bank for a loan, but since his credentials are new in the U.S., he couldn’t receive a traditional loan.  But the bank told him about Accion Texas Inc.  “I went and applied, and they treated me really well,” he says. “They called me a week later and said I was approved. I am happy because Accion is helping me to build my business and helping me to build my credit.”

Octavio expects to gain publicity by hiring a graphic designer to create a business logo. Octavio projects he’ll have more sales with the new inventory he purchased with the loan.  And he can now afford to hire a driver and accountant. This will ease his schedule as he visits clients and manages the store after working outside all day.

“I expect to grow with this loan and probably get another loan,” he says.  Currently, Octavio is working on his website. When completed, you will be able to find the site here: www.arqoctaviocanales.com

loans.use: to purchase more inventory.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose opened Familia Deli Grocery as a family-run bodega to serve his Perth Amboy, New Jersey community. Business was strong for him until October of 2012, when Superstorm Sandy devastated New Jersey’s bay and shore communities. Jose’s business, his family’s livelihood, got hit hard in flooding, spoiled inventory and a badly damaged storefront sign.

Fortunately, he proved to be stronger than the storm. Almost as soon as the electricity came back, Jose reopened his bodega. The Intersect Fund provided him with the money needed to buy new inventory to restock his shelves. One year later, Jose and his neighborhood are making a steady comeback.

However, Jose still needs help in order to get back to pre-Sandy levels. He will use this new loan to replace his Sandy-damaged storefront sign, so that he can move one more step past the storm.

loans.use: to replace his family-run bodega's storefront sign.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en: Sakina is a 48-year-old married woman. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of available funds she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she has requested for a loan of 20,000 PKR to Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons. It will allow her to stitch up more dresses on time to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colours along with packs of lace, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon lives in the Changamwe area.  He is 21 years old and he is a single businessman.  He sells clothes at the local market.  He has been in the business for two years and his business has been growing.

He learned about Milango through friends who advised him to join so that he could save money and access credit to fund his business.  He now seeks a loan to buy bales of secondhand clothing for resale in his business.  The major challenges that he faces in the business include high transport and fuel costs as well as competition from other businesses. 

The income that he will raise from the business will improve his standard of living and enable him to expand his business operations.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothing.

loans.name: Lia

texts.en:
Lia is 26 years old.  She is married and has two children.  She lives in Georgia’s legislative capital, Kutaisi.  Lia’s spouse works as a distributor for a private company and earns a monthly wage.  

Lia is a cosmetician and she serves women from her house.  She has many loyal clients and offers a wide variety of beauty services.  Her business is going well and it is for this reason that Lia has decided to develop it and open a cosmetology room in her city.  With the received startup loan, Lia will purchase an epilating machine and all the necessary equipment to serve her clients and satisfy their needs.  She hopes to attract more customers, as she is quite skillful in this field.  

Lia hopes for your generosity.

loans.use: to open a cosmetology room and purchase the necessary equipment.

loans.name: Al-Rahman Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Rahman, and consists of four women who live in Aden, Yemen. 

Zainb is a happy woman who treats everyone well because of her opportunities to get ahead. She, like many people, has had both good times and bad times, and has gotten ahead despite whatever stands in her way. 

She is 39, married, and has three children, most of them in school. 

She is worried about her house, so she applied for a loan  from AMB to remodel the inside of the house and thus make it more comfortable for her family. 

With great strength and dedication, she has become a better person.

loans.use: to remodel the inside of the house and thus make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.name: Vuqar

texts.en:
Vuqar is a 43-year-old married man. Together with his wife, he is raising two kids. 

Vuqar is an IDP person (internally displaced person). He moved from the city of Fuzuli, and now lives in the Bilasuvar region with his family. His primary income sources are milk and eggs, and he has been doing this work for seven years.  His parents taught him how to care for and feed cows, and before getting married, he worked with his parents in a barnyard. Now, however, he can work in livestock on his own. 

He is requesting a loan of 2000 AZN for the first time, to renovate his barn. This loan will help him a lot, because without this help, he would not manage to assist and contribute to his family. 

In the future, he hopes to improve the living conditions of his family, and is very thankful to all Kiva lenders for their support!

loans.use: to renovate the barn

loans.name: Seymur

texts.en:
Seymur is a 33-year-old man and married with two children. He is an Internally Displaced Person and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He breeds sheep and cattle, and sells milk products and meat. Seymur has more than four years of experience in this field, thanks to his father who taught him the best way to look after cattle.

Seymur usually buys lambs, raises and fattens them within three to six months, and then resells them for a more profitable price at the local livestock bazaar. He sells the milk and yogurt to his neighbors. Selling milk and meat brings in 150 AZN income per month. Milk and yogurt are very popular products in Azerbaijan, as are beef and mutton. People use meat in everyday national dishes, such as pilau and dolma, and they always use yogurt. Milk products are considered very healthy, and they are present in everyday life. 

There is only one income in Seymur's family and it is not enough to cover the basic needs of his beloved children. Seymur applied for a loan of 2,000 AZN to purchase six sheep, one cow, and fodder.

loans.use: to purchase six sheep, one cow, and fodder.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María, madre soltera, originaria de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Ella se destaca como una persona emprendedora, responsables, trabajadora, con ganas de superación personal. Con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio logro obtener en la vida tanto bienes materiales como su casita,  y sacar adelante a su hijo, y hacer que sea una  persona con valores,y  aporte a la sociedad. En la actualidad sigue luchando pero para poder sobrevivir, y porque le gusta mucho ser independiente.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de cosmético de forma ambulante como rubor, sombra, labiales, lápiz de ojos, delineador, body, cremas hidrantes, anti ojeras, antiarrugas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 8 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos a clientes fijos y eventuales. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de  productos cosmeticos, para que en un futuro no muy  lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. María agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno
texts.en:
María is a single mother from León, which is located in the western part of the country.  She stands out as a hard-working, responsible, enterprising person with a desire to develop herself.  With much effort and sacrifice she has been able to acquire material goods and her own small home, as well as provide for her son and teac him to be a person with values to contribute to society.  María continues to struggle to get ahead because she likes being independent.

Thanks to her efforts and determination to prosper, she works as a street vendor selling cosmetics such as blush, eyeshadow, lipstick, eyeliner, body creams, moisturizers, eye contour and anti-wrinkle creams.  She spends eight hours a day offering her products to fixed and eventual customers.

Her goal is to use the loan as work capital to stock her business with food products so in the near future she can earn more income.  María is grateful to Kiva lenders who help people with low incomes in poor countries such as Nicaragua to have decent work.

loans.use: buy cosmetics to sell in her business.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita mayor de edad casada, del municipio de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del pais, es propietaria de una Linea de venta de mercadería en general donde ofrece productos como: electrodomésticos, adornos, cobertores, cortinas, chinería, diferentes estilos de ropa tanto para adultos como niños, productos plásticos entre otros ella realiza sus compras en otros municipios del país, sus compras son al contado, sus ventas son al contado y al crédito de forma ambulante,tiene a dos personas que se encargan de entregar la mercadería y de recuperación, los cuales son semanal y quincenal. Margarita también cuenta con su salario que desempeña como conserje. el objetivo de este crédito es para invertir en  la compra de mercadería en general como: chinerias, cortinas, adornos navideños, diferentes estilos de ropa entre otros. Margarita agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Margarita is a married adult from the municipality of Chinandega, located in the western region of the country. She is the owner of a line of sales of merchandise in general, where she offers products like: electrical appliances, decorations, covers, curtains, china, different styles of clothing for adults and children, plastic products, among other products. 

She makes her purchases in other municipalities of the country. Her purchases are in cash, her sales are in cash, in credit when she makes sales by going out to different neighborhoods. She has two people who are in charge of delivering the merchandise and recovering the payments, which are weekly and biweekly. Margarita also has a salary that she redeems as the caretaker of the business. 

The objective of this loan is to invest in the purchase of merchandise in general like: china, curtains, Christmas decorations, different styles of clothing, among other things. Margarita is very thankful for the support that Kiva investors offers to people of minimum economic resources.

loans.use: to invest in merchandise in general to stock her inventory with covers, curtains, plastic products, clothing, china, among other products.

loans.name: Merisyl

texts.en:
This is Merisyl. She previously accessed an 14,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase additional quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings helped with her children’s education and personal, household and business expenses.
 
She would like to apply for another 19,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell provides better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help meet her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Merisyl hopes that her business will last longer and dreams to give her children a good life and education. She meets with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 27 years old and lives in Nyahururu. She is not married yet but is blessed with a child, aged five years old, who is currently attending school.

She works in a food market where she supplies onions of all types (e.g., spring onions, garlic cloves and bulb onions) to hotels and restaurant owners in her town. She has been running this business for the past seven years. To enable her to buy more stock of onions to sell to more customers, she has applied for her third loan of 30,000 KES from KADET.

Her monthly income right now is 25,000 KES and she intends to use the profits from her expanded business to educate her child and to pay back her loan from KADET.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of onions to sell to her customers

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha, age 25, is married and has two children, one of whom is going to school. 

Chantha is in the business of farming rice in Bakan district, which is recognized as a rice trading area of Pursat province. Chantha has been doing this for nearly five years, and earns a decent income to cover the costs of living. Her husband helps share the costs by working in the construction industry. Through their hardships, this couple agreed to educate their children until they earn a degree at the university because they want to see them become professional and have well-paid jobs in the future.

In order to improve the sanitation and increase their personal hygiene, Chantha would like to build a household latrine, as she hasn't had one prior to this. Due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of KHR 2,000,000 to buy construction supplies needed for constructing a latrine and paying for labor costs. 

Thanks to the water loan program offered by HKL with a special interest rate, she is encouraged to focus on healthy living conditions, safeguarding the health of her family, and protecting the environment.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies needed for constructing a latrine and paying for labor costs.

loans.name: Napamboumbou Group

texts.fr:
Mr YOUSSOUF est responsable du groupe NAPAMBOUMBOU. Marié, il est père de 06enfants. Le plus âgé a 20ans et le moins âgé a 03ans. 04 vont à l’école et il a 08personnes en charge.
Mr est cultivateur et fait aussi le maraichage (tomate) depuis 03ans. Il s’approvisionne sur le volta blanc(Nakambè). Ses clients sont  les vendeurs du marché d’AVV5.
Il veut s’acheter 04sacs d’engrais.
Avec ses bénéfices, il veut réinvestir  dans son activité. Mr ambitionne  construire une maison d’habitation.
texts.en:
Mr. Youssouf is responsible for Napamboumbou Group. He's married and the father of six children. The eldest is twenty years old, the youngest is three. Out of them, four attend school. Mr. Youssouf has eight people to support.

He's a cultivator, and for three years he's also been growing vegetables (tomatoes). He gets his supply on the shores of the White Volta (Nakambè). His customers are resellers at the AVV5 market.

He wants to buy four sacks of fertilizers, and reinvest his profits in his business. He ambitions to build a home.

loans.use: to buy 4 sacks of fertilizers

loans.name: Nagreengokodogo Group

texts.fr:
Mr ABDOULAYE est responsable du groupe NAGREENGOKODOGO. Marié, il est père de 15enfants. Le plus âgé a 33ans et le moins âgé a 07ans. 06 vont à l’école et il a 13personnes en charge.
Mr est cultivateur et fait aussi le maraichage depuis 08ans. Il s’approvisionne chez les techniciens en agriculture de sa commune. Ses clients sont les Togolais qui viennent s’approvisionner dans leur marché.
Il veut s’acheter 02kilos de grain d’oignons pour semer et 02 sacs d’engrais.
Avec ses bénéfices, il veut s’occuper de la santé de sa famille, de la scolarité de ses enfants et aussi réinvestir  le reste dans son activité. Mr ambitionne agrandir son activité, mieux s’occuper de ses enfants en assurant leur scolarité.
texts.en:
Abdoulaye is the leader of the Nagreengokodogo Group.  He is married and has 15 children, the eldest is 33 years old and the youngest is 7 years old.  Six of his children attend school and he is responsible for a total of 13 people.  

Abdoulaye is a farmer and has been growing vegetables for 8 years.  He buys his supplies from agricultural specialists in his area.  His customers are Togolese people who come to buy supplies from the market.  Abdoulaye wants to buy 2 kgs of onion seed for planting and 2 sacks of fertiliser.  He will use his earnings to pay for healthcare for his family, pay the school expenses of his children and reinvest in his business.  In the future, Abdoulaye would like to increase the size of his business to ensure his ability to provide for his children and their education.

loans.use: to buy 2 kgs onion seed for planting, and 2 sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Satte Group

texts.fr:
Mr HAMADO  est le responsable du groupe SATTE. Marié, il père de 09enfants. Le plus âgé a 21ans et le moins âgé a 05ans. 05 vont à l’école. Il a 08personnes  en charge.
Mr  est cultivateur  et éleveur depuis  plus de 10ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les  marchés  locaux. Ses clients sont les revendeurs locaux.
Il veut s’acheter  02moutons.
Mr veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour assurer la scolarité de ses enfants. Il ambitionne agrandir son activité afin de mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Hamado is the leader of the Satte Group.  He is a married man, and father to 9 children, the eldest is 21 years old and the youngest is 5 years old.  Five of his children attend school and he is financially responsible for 8 people.

Hamado has been a livestock farmer for more than 10 years.  He buys his supplies at local markets.  His customers are local people who resell the animals.  Hamado will use his loan to buy 2 sheep.  He will use his earnings to pay for the school expenses of his children.  

In the future he would like to expand his business in order to take better care of his family.

loans.use: to buy two sheep

loans.name: Kolonkom Group

texts.fr:
Mr ALIDOU représente le groupe KOLONKOM. Marié, il est père de 03enfants. Le plus âgé a 10ans et le moins âgé a 05ans. 02 vont à l’école et il a 04personnes en charge.
Il est cultivateur et fait l’élevage depuis 05ans. Il s’approvisionne  dans les marchés locaux. Ses clients sont les revendeurs.
Mr veut s’acheter 02 moutons.
Il veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Mr ambitionne devenir un grand éleveur , aider sa femme a créer un commerce et mieux s’occuper de ses enfants  .
texts.en:
Alidou is the representative for the Kolonkom Group.  He is married and has three children, the eldest is ten years old and the youngest is five years old.  Two of his children attend school and he is financially responsible for four people.  

Alidou has been a livestock farmer for five years.  He buys his supplies at local markets and sells them to customers for resale.  Alidou will use his loan to buy two sheep, and his earnings will be reinvested in his business.

In the future, Alidou would like to expand the size of his business, help his wife set up a business and take better care of his children.

loans.use: to buy 2 sheep.

loans.name: Sorgho Group

texts.fr:
Mr IDRISSA représente le groupe SORGHO. Marié, il est père de 08enfants. Le plus âgé a 14ans et le moins âgé a 01an02mois. 04 vont à l’école et il a 10personnes en charge.
Il est cultivateur et fait le maraichage en saison sèche depuis 25ans. Il s’approvisionne au marché de Nagréongo. Ses clients viennent de Ouagadougou.
Mr veut s’acheter 02sacs d’engrais.
Il veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Mr ambitionne construire une maison d’habitation et de s’acheter une moto.
texts.en:
Mr. IDRISSA is the representative of the SORGHO group. He is married with 8 children aged 14 months to 14 years old, four of whom go to school. He supports 10 people.

Idrissa is a farmer who has been practicing market gardening during the dry season for the past 25 years. He buys his supplies at the market of Nagréongo. His customers are from Ouagadougou.

Idrissa wants to buy 2 bags of fertilizers. He plans to reinvest his profits in his activity. His goals are to build a house and buy himself a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of fertilizers.

loans.name: Pengwende Group

texts.fr:
Mr  SOULEYMANE est responsable du groupe PENGWENDE. Marié, il est père de 03enfants. Le plus âgé a 10ans et le moins âgé a 06mois. 01 va à l’école. Il a 05personnes en charge.
Mr est cultivateur et fait le jardinage depuis 07ans. Il s’approvisionne dans son quartier. Ses clients sont  de la ville de Ouagadougou et de Mogtedo.
Il veut s’acheter 100metres de clôture et 04sacs d’engrais.
Mr veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Il ambitionne bien construire sa cour.
texts.en:
Mister Souleymane is the leader of the Pengwende group. Married, he is father to 3 children. The oldest is 10 years old and the youngest is 6 months old. One goes to school. He has 5 dependants.

Mister is a farmer and has been gardening for 7 years. He gets his supplies in his neighborhood. His customers are from the town of Ouagadougou and Mogtedo.

He wants to buy himself 100 meters of fence and 4 bags of fertilizer.

Mister wants to reinvest his profits in his business. His ambition is to build his courtyard well.

loans.use: to buy 100 meters of fence and 4 bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Watinoma Group

texts.fr:
Mr KADRE est responsable du groupe WATINOMA. Marié, il est père de 07enfants. Le plus âgé a 10ans et le moins âgé a 02ans. 02 vont à l’école. Il a 13personnes en charge.
Mr est cultivateur et fait l’élevage depuis 15ans. Il s’approvisionne dans son quartier. Ses clients viennent de pouitenga.
Il veut s’acheter 02boeufs.
Mr veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Il ambitionne bien construire sa cour et payer 02motos.
texts.en:
Mister Kadre is the leader of the Watinoma group. Married, he is father to 7 children. The oldest is 10 years old and the youngest is 2 years old. Two go to school. He has 13 dependents.

Mister is a farmer and has been breeding for 15 years. He gets his supplies in his neighborhood. His customers come from Pouitenga.

He wants to buy himself 2 oxen.

Mister wants to reinvest his profits in his business. His ambition is to build his courtyard well and pay for 2 motorcycles.

loans.use: to buy himself 2 oxen.

loans.name: Sal

texts.en:
Sal is a rice farmer from Kampong Thom province. He is a 39-year-old married man and loving father of three school-aged children. His mother and three other children (nephews and nieces) live with him in the same house. Since the income from farming is barely enough to cover their living costs, Sal’s wife helps him generate income by selling Khmer noodle with soup to local people in the morning time.

He is taking out this loan because he wants to buy a motorcycle for his nephew, who is currently employed in a pipe factory in Phnom Penh. This purchase will help his nephew in his transportation needs for commuting to his workplace. He is very thankful to all lenders for their generosities and goodwill towards his family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for his nephew to help him with commuting to his workplace.

loans.name: Tha

texts.en:
This is Tha. She is 44 years old and married with three children. She lives with her husband and children in their own home, located in Kampong Thom province. To secure the overall welfare of her family, Tha is in two business ventures: farming and selling vegetables in her village. She also has an additional income from her husband who works in the construction industry.

In order to help her in farming business, Tha is seeking a loan of 1,500 US Dollars to buy a plowing machine for the maintenance of the rice fields. Moreover, she can use this machine to attach to a trailer to load chopped firewood to sell. This will enable her to boost her income so she can satisfy their basic necessities.

loans.use: to buy a plowing machine for the maintenance of the rice fields.

loans.name: Savon

texts.en:
Savon is 48 years old and a hardworking woman who is dedicated to a farming business. Primarily, she is growing rice to sell at the local markets of Kandal province. She has a life partner, who helps her with her farming activities. Together, they are able to make an income of $10 per day to satisfy their daily needs. She has been in this occupation for more than 20 years.

Since she doesn’t have a safe latrine for use at home, she is unable to help her family members improve their sanitation and personal hygiene. In this particular way, she has requested a loan of 800 US Dollars to build a household latrine and buy its necessaries. 

Thanks to the water loan program offered by HKL with a special interest rate, she is encouraged to focus on healthy living conditions, safeguard the health of her family, and protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a household latrine and buy its necessaries.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 23-year-old single man who is responsible for the support of four members of his family. He has been repairing motorcycles for six years; he also provides Hookah services, and now because his family's needs are increasing, he is going to run an additional business to increase his income and develop his living.

Ali is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy a coffee espresso machine which he use as an additional income business.

Ali is also employed in a hotel, but he has to support to his family's needs, which is why he has to run several extra income jobs to cover his family's needs.

He hopes that one day he can open his own wide café, where he can expect customers to visit him and spending a lovely time.

loans.use: To buy a coffee espresso machine which will be an additional income business

loans.name: Maritza Araceli

texts.es:
Maritza es una agricultora del departamento de Ahuachapan,acompañada,tiene tres hijos entre las edades de 14 y 21 años, sus dos hijos menores estan estudiando actualmente,Maritza estudio hasta sexto grado  porque tuvo que trabajar para ayudarle a sus padres en la agricultura.
Ella cuenta con 23 años de experiencia en el cultivo de maiz, maicillo y frijol, dicho trabajo le a permitido mantener a su familia con las ganancias obtenidas por la venta de estos productos.Ella no cuenta con terreno propio para cultivar, por lo que solicita el prestamo con ACAF para pagar el alquiler del terreno que le permita seguir trabajando en el campo y a la vez poder mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos quienes desean seguir estudiando para ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Maritza is a farmer from the department of Ahuachapan. She has a partner and three children between the ages of 14 and 21. Her two dependent children are currently going to school. Maritza went to school until the sixth grade because she had to work in order to help her parents farm.

She has 23 years of experience planting corn, sorghum, and beans. This work has allowed her to take care of her family with the income she makes through the sale of these products. She does not have her own land to plant, which is why she is requesting the loan with ACAF in order to pay to rent land that will allow her to continue working in the field. It will also allow her to improve her children's quality of life. She wants them to continue studying in order to become professionals.

loans.use: to rent land and buy supplies.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 42 years old, and lives in the airport community.  She ended her education in 8th grade; she is married and has five children between the ages of 6 and 27 years old.  Three are in school and live at home. Her husband is a taxi driver. 

For the past two years, she been selling red oil and rice in the local market. She started this business with money from her husband, and learned selling from her friends. She likes her business because of the exchange of money. 

She requesting a loan to purchase red oil and rice for her business. 

Her plans are to sent her children to collage, and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase red oil and rice for her business.

loans.name: Gloria Isabel

texts.es:
La  señora Gloria es una persona responsable, emprendedora  y  trabajadora vive en una colonia  al sur de Honduras junto a sus hijas y esposo. Su negocio es la venta de golosinas desde hace 7 años. 
Doña Gloria el préstamo lo necesita para la  compra  de refrescos,  carnes,  plátanos, cebollas, papas, lechuga, queso, frijoles, arroz, etc. productos con los cuales elabora las comidas para la venta.
Doña Gloria vende en las  afueras  del mercado  de   la  zona y también tiene su negocio en el cual le ayuda de su esposo e  hijas,  Necesita el préstamo para comprar más materia prima  para surtir su negocio ya que tiene bastantes clientes y la mercadería que tiene no satisfacen las demandas.
Doña Gloria planea  aumentar sus niveles de ventas para poder ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios y tener una mejor calidad de vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Octubre  del  2013
texts.en:
Gloria is a very responsible, enterprising, and hardworking person. She lives in a neighborhood in southern Honduras together with her daughters and her husband.  For seven years her business has been selling candy.  

Gloria needs this loan to buy sodas, meat, bananas, onions, potatoes, lettuce, cheese, beans, rice, etc., which are products she uses to make prepared food to sell.  

Gloria sells on the outskirts of the local market and she also has her business, which her husband and daughters help her with.  She needs this loan to buy more raw material to stock her business as she has many customers and the merchandise she has is not enough to meet the demand.  

Gloria plans to increase her sales so she will be able to help her children with their education and have a better quality of life.  


Choluteca, Honduras – October  2013

loans.use: to buy sodas, meat, bananas, onions, potatoes, lettuce, cheese, beans, rice, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El señor Juan Carlos tiene 20 años de edad, su familia está compuesta de cinco miembros los padres y dos hermanos menores de los cuales es responsable, es de escasos recursos económicos, vive en el municipio de Mizque y  trabaja en la agricultura desde muy pequeño, desde hace 3 años produce cebolla, papa y frijol para la alimentación de su familia y el excedente lo vende en el mismo lugar a los comerciantes de la población, ahora requiere un crédito de Bs. 10000 para comprar semillas, abonos y agroquímicos, para aumentar su producción y de esta forma tener más ingresos y mejorar las condiciones de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan Carlos is 20 years old. His family is composed of five members, his parents and two younger siblings who are still dependents. He has few economic resources and lives in the town of Mizque. He has worked as a farmer since he was very young. For the past three years he has produced onions, potatoes and beans to feed his family; he sells the surplus at the same market as other merchants in the population. 

Now he needs a loan of 10,000 BOB to buy seeds, fertilizer and agrochemicals in order to increase production. In this way he will earn more income and improve the living conditions of his entire family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and agrochemicals.

loans.name: Nunufar

texts.en:
Nunufar is 50 years old and lives in the village of Goght, which is in the Kotayk region. She is married and has a son. She has never worked and since she got married very early, she and her husband became engaged in farming and agriculture. Now her son has also become a good farmer and they all work together. 

They have a very rich orchard and they sell different fruits such as apples, cherries, apricots, nuts, quince, and currants. Their farm cattle are few but they have plans to increase their animals with another cow, a bull, twenty chickens, and twenty-five rabbits. They also have a hay mowing machine and Nunufar’s son works on it gathering hay for their farm cattle. He also drives a taxi and uses that income to increase the family's income.

Nunufar is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian dram in order to buy two more cows to make their farm richer.

loans.use: to buy two more cows to make their farm richer.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane has a water supply business in the town of Kitengela. She has been in this business for 15 years and it has been profitable. She is 64 years old, widowed, and supports five people in her family. Right now her monthly income is 5,000 KES.

She plans to use this loan to buy another water tank and thereby sell water to more customers. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children. This is her third loan term and she paid all her previous loans successfully. 

In the future, Jane hopes to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy another water tank.

loans.name: Chynarkan

texts.ru: Чынаркан 41 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Чынаркан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Чынаркан занимается животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Чынаркан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 3 теленка, 22 овцы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). Чынаркан входит в группу "Тахмина", в эту группу входят еще 2 человека. В итоге их трое. Чынаркан является лидером группы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Чынаркан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Чынаркан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку семейной автомашины.
texts.en:
Chynarkan is 41 and married and raising three children. She has a high school education and works in animal husbandry as the primary source of income for her family, a business she started 20 years ago with the purchase of cattle for 10,000 KGS. Thanks to her hard work, her holdings now include three milk cows, three calves and 22 sheep, with a monthly income of 10,000 KGS. Chynarkan is the leader and one of three members of the group Takhmina.

With the goal of further developing her business, Chynarkan has turned to microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 40,000 KGS to purchase calves to increase her number of livestock. She plans to invest profits from the loan into further augmentation of her herd, and to save toward a family car.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Tajmiron

texts.en: Tajmiron is a 40-year-old housewife. Her husband Saffijuddin, age 44 years, is a farmer. They live with three children in their own Kaccha (mud and straw made) house in the small village of Baroghoria in Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri district. Tajmiron passed class VI (Grade 6) and her husband passed class VIII (Grade 8).They give an education to their three children with great difficulty. One of the children is in class IX (Grade 9), the second one is in class X (Grade 10) and the third one is in class XI (Grade 11). It is very difficult for them to meet their household expenses and their children's educational expenses. She learned about BJS and applied for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for cultivating potatoes on their own land. She is very hopeful that the cultivation will be very profitable, as there is a great demand for potatoes in the local market. So, she is very motivated to give her full effort to expand her cultivation business.  Their dream is to build a Pacca (Brick build) house in the future.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer to  cultivate potatoes

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
Musu is 45 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and has three children between the ages of 18 to 31. Only two are in school and live at home. 

For the past 5 years she has been selling fresh and dried fish in the local market. She likes her business because selling fish makes fast profit. 

Musu is requesting a loan to purchase more fresh cassava and butter nose fish for her business. She plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh cassava and butter nose fish for her business.

loans.name: Kasichana

texts.en:
Kasichana is 50 years of age and lives in the Mariakani area near Mombasa, Kenya. She is a wife and a mother who balances all that with being a business lady so that she can feed her family.

She sells meat and she has been in the business for years. The business has been growing over the years and now she seeks a loan to pay school fees and buy more meat and meat products to sell. She started the business from a small savings that she had made.

The major challenges that she faces in the business include price fluctuations and inflation. In the next five years, she hopes to open more branches of the business and increase her income.

The income that she will raise from the money after paying school fees and investing in the business, will improve her living standards.

loans.use: to pay school fees and buy more meat

loans.name: Vicenta Diamantina

texts.es:
Vicenta, madres solteras con dos hijos menores de edad, es originaria de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfruta de la compañia de sus hijos. Está en la vida ha tenido que luchar duro para brindarles estabilidad económica  a sus hijos. Lamentablemente  no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana 

Gracias a esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante, tiene por actividad económica venta de lena y frijoles cosidos . Actividad que la desempeña en su casa de habitación, El dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y compra lena para la venta y un quintal de frijoles para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Vicenta agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Vicenta is a single mother with two young children. She is originally from León, which is in the western part of the country. She is known for being hard-working, responsible, and having a desire for personal success. In her free time, she likes to spend time with her children. She has had to fight throughout her life to provide her children with economic stability. Unfortunately, she wasn't able to study for a career and was obligated to start working at a young age. Thanks to her efforts and her desire to move forward, she has a business in selling firewood and cooked beans. She completes her work from home and works for around ten hours a day. This loan is to invest in working capital and to buy firewood to sell a quintal (about 100 lb.) of beans. She hopes that this will bring her more income in the near future. Vicenta is grateful for the help from Kiva lenders who help people with few resources from poor countries such as Nicaragua. This helps them to have a dignified type of work.

loans.use: to stock her business with beans to cook and a stove

loans.name: Heisemberg Isael

texts.es: Heisemberg,  se decidió por un nuevo préstamo para comprar abono, insecticidas, semilla y plaguicidas, para el cultivo  de granos básicos (maíz y plátano), y así generar nuevos y mejores ingresos para su negocio, ya que con el crédito anterior saco una cosecha abundante y ganancias muy buenas con las que cancelo la deuda y le ha dado a su familia mejor alimentación, educación. Todos están muy saludables y siguen apoyándolo en sus labores.
texts.en: Heisemberg has decided to take out a new loan in order to buy manure, insecticides, seeds, and anti-plague treatments for growing basic grains (corn and plantains).  With this he can generate a higher income for his business.  With his previous loan, Heisemberg had a great yield and very good profits, which he used to pay off his debt and better feed and educate his family.  Heisemberg's family is in very good health and they continue to support him with his work.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides, seed and pesticides

loans.name: Roy

texts.en:
Roy is 32 years old and comes from Nyahururu. He is married to Teresia who is a businesswoman and they are blessed with two children. One of the children is three years old and the other one is eight months old.

He is in the motorcycle transport industry, a business he has been running for the last five years. Roy would like to engage in dairy farming, and to enable him do this, he has applied for his first loan of KES 50,000, which will be used to buy a dairy cow for milk production.

His monthly income right now is KES 13,000 and his intention is to use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to buy some more dairy cows for increased income and to pay back his loan to KADET LTD. He hopes to be successful as a dairy farmer and in the motorcycle transport industry.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
Evangelina, le dará mantenimiento a su molino, necesita insumos para la granja. Con el préstamo comprara fajas, discos, concentrado, pollos y vacunas. La inversión anterior le ayudo a mejorar el local del molino y a establecer una mini granja.
Su familia está percibiendo las mejoras que Evangelina tiene en su economía, pues hoy tienen mejor alimentación, salud, se mantienen muy unidos.
texts.en:
Evangelina will do maintenance to her mill. She needs supplies for the farm. With the loan, she will purchase belts, disks, concentrate, chicken and vaccines. The previous loan helped her to improve the location of the mill and establish a mini farm. 

Her family is receiving the benefits that Evangelina has had in her business. Now they have better food, health and they remain close.

loans.use: purchase belts, disks, concentrate, chicken and vaccines.

loans.name: Griselda Margarita

texts.es:
Griselda, es una madre abnegada que debido a la necesidad de apoyar con los gastos de su hogar inicio un negocio de venta de tortillas. Ella está acompañada, tiene cuatro hijos y vive junto a ellos. Desde hace cinco años empezó a vender tortillas en su comunidad, es un oficio que aprendió de su madre, trabaja todos los días.
Comprará maíz, leña y un comal, estos son los ingredientes y utensilios que utiliza para elaborar las tortillas con esto espera generar mayores ingresos, atraer a más clientes y cancelar sus cuotas.
Desea ofrecer a su familia una mejor alimentación, educación superior a sus hijos, seguir apoyando a su compañero de vida y ampliar mucho su negocio.
texts.en: Griselda is a selfless mother who started a business selling tortillas due to a need to help with the household expenses.  She is in a common-law relationship, and has four children who live with her. Five years ago she began selling tortillas in her community.  This is a job that she learned from her mother.  She works every day.  She will buy corn, firewood and a griddle, which are the ingredients and tools that she uses to make the tortillas.  With these things she hopes to earn more income, attract more clients and pay her bills.  She would like to provde better food and higher education for her childen, to continue supporting her life partner, and to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and a griddle.

loans.name: Maria Diodora

texts.es:
María, ha optado por un nuevo préstamo para comprar de pita e hilo, que es su  materia prima para seguir trabajando y cumplir con los pedidos que tiene de sus clientes, el impacto que tuvo el crédito anterior fue muy positivo ya que le ha generado ingresos que le permitieron pagar la deuda e instalar una pequeña tienda en su casa.
Su vida está cambiando poco a poco gracias al apoyo que se le ha brindado y a la buena administración.
texts.en: María has decided to apply for a new loan to buy twine and thread, which are the raw materials she needs to continue working and fulfilling her clients' orders. Her previous loan had a very positive impact. The earnings she generated allowed her to pay off her debt and install a small store in her home. Her life is changing little by little thanks to the support she has been offered and the good administration.

loans.use: to buy twine and thread.

loans.name: Jose Wilfredo

texts.es:
José, está muy contento con lo que ha crecido en su negocio, con sus nuevas ganancias, esto lo ha conseguido gracias a la buena administración del crédito que se le dio antes. En está ocasión quiere surtir mucho más su negocio con la compra de blusas, camisas, faldas, ropa interior (para ambos sexos) y sandalias con estilos variados.
Espera sacar provecho de la temporada de fin de año ya que las ventas aumentan por las diferentes festividades.
texts.en: José is very pleased with how he has managed to grow his business and with his improved earnings, which he has achieved thanks to the good use of the loan he received previously. This time, he wants to stock his store even more with blouses, shirts, skirts, underwear for both men and women, and sandals of various styles. He hopes to take advantage of the end of year season, when sales go up thanks to the many festivities.

loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, skirts, underwear, and sandals

loans.name: Claudia Yonari

texts.es:
Claudia Yonari tiene 30 años de edad, es ama de casa y madre de un hijo el cual tiene una edad de 10 años y estudia en una escuela de la comunidad, su estado civil es en unión libre. Su grado de educación es secundario cursando hasta el segundo de plan básico. Su compañero de hogar tiene trabajo permanente por lo que sus ingresos ayudan en los diferentes gastos del hogar y los fines de semana ayuda a Claudia Yonari en las diferentes actividades del campo. Desde hace tres años ella se dedica al cultivo de café siendo sus padres agricultores mismo que le heredaron la tierra que hoy en día ella en compañía de su pareja trabaja la cual está ubicada a 15 minutos a la cual se traslada en vehículo público (Moto taxi) para dar la asistencia y mantenimiento a sus cultivos. Una de las dificultades que ella identifica es la alza de los precios de los insumos que ella utiliza para asistir sus cultivos agregando a esto el acarreo de los mismos siendo este un costo difícil de minorar ya que la competencia no es un problema.
Por lo que hoy en día ella solicita financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, abono, formula cafetalera, urea, insecticida entre otros, los cuales son necesarios para la protección de sus cultivos de café de plagas de insectos que conlleven al deterioro de la planta en general.
Sus planes a futuro son los de seguir incrementando sus cultivos de café mediante la compra de más tierra fortaleciendo el patrimonio para su hijo y su familia mejorando la calidad de vida apoyando a su hijo en sus estudios y dando la oportunidad de que pueda superarse a nivel profesional.
texts.en:
Claudia Yonari, 30, is a homemaker and the mother of one son, who is 10 years old. He goes to school in the community. Her civil status is in a civil union. She completed school through the second level of secondary school. Her companion has a permanent job and his income helps with household expenses. On the weekends, he helps Claudia Yonari with the various chores in the field. For three years, she has made a living by cultivating coffee. Her parents, farmers, gave her the land she currently cultivates as an inheritance. The land is 15 minutes away by public transportation (moto taxi). She goes there to improve and maintain her crops. One of the challenges she faces is the rising price of supplies that she uses to help her crops as well as the cost of transporting them. This is a difficult cost to minimize because competition is not a problem.

Today she is requesting a loan to buy agricultural products such as fertilizer, manure, coffee-growing formula, urea, insecticide, and other supplies. These are necessary to protect her coffee crops from insect plagues that deteriorate the plants.

Her plans for the future are to keep increasing her coffee crops by buying more land. This will strengthen the the estate for her child and her family. It will also improve their quality of life and help her children with school, giving them the opportunity to succeed as professionals.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to help her coffee crops.

loans.name: Henrry Antonio

texts.es:
Henrry es originario de la  humilde comunidad de monte alegre ahí el habita con sus padres  en esta comunidad vive   desde que tenia la edad de 4 años.El comenta que se ha esforzado bastante por crecer profesionalmente a pesar de todos los sacrificios el sigue estudiando pues su deseo es ser alguien en la vida para  ayudar a sus padres  y servir en su comunidad . su trabajo es de campo de lunes a viernes trabaja con su padre  en labores agrícolas  y ganaderos y  el fin de semana  los sábados estudia por que esta terminando su licenciatura  y los días domingos se desempeña como profesor  y imparte clases a estudiantes de primer y segundo año de secundaria.
En la comunidad donde habita no cuentan con energía eléctrica lo que no le permite a el así como a su familia poder hacer  otros labores en la noches . El comenta que hacen uso de candelas o candiles por la noches para poder iluminarse.Lo que lo hace sentir triste pues considera que por las noches el podría  aprovechar el tiempo en leer , hacer su trabajos de la universidad y planear sus clases, es por eso que necesita de un préstamo para un sistema solar y llevar así energía a su vivienda, lo que vendría a cambiar su vida y el de su familia
texts.en:
Henrry is from the small community of Monte Alegre, where he lives with his parents. He has lived in this community since he was four years old. He says that he has made quite a bit of effort to grow professionally. In spite of all the sacrifices, he continues studying, as his desire is to be someone in life in order to help his parents and serve in his community. His work is in the fields from Monday to Friday; he works with his father in agriculture and raising cattle. On the weekends, he studies on Saturdays because he is finishing his university degree, and on Sundays he works as a teacher and gives classes to students in the first and second year of secondary school.

In the community where he lives, they don't have electricity, which means that he and his family cannot do other work at night. He says that they use candles at night for lighting, which makes him feel sad because he thinks that he could take advantage of time at night to read, do his work for the university and plan his classes. This is why he needs a loan for a solar system to bring electricity to his home, which would change his life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy a small solar system for his home

loans.name: Anjuma

texts.en:
Anjuma is a housewife. She is 25 years old. She lives with her husband and two children. Her husband Latabbar is 36 years old. He is a young entrepreneur in a farming family and involved in agriculture. They have their own Kaccha (straw and mud made) house in the small village of Baroghoria in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. Anjuma received an education up to class IV (Grade 4) and her husband received an education up to class VI (Grade 6). One of their children reads in class III (Grade 3).  Another one is below the school-going age.  

Anjuma works hard every day, starting in the early morning. She also helps her husband in cultivation, yet she is unable to give financial support to her family. As the earnings of her husband are not sufficient to maintain their household expenses, she has applied for a loan to purchase more cauliflower seeds and good quality manure, fertilizers, and pesticides for farming.  This will help her to improve financial condition of her family and an opportunity to provide better education to her children. Both Anjuma and her husband dream of buying a piece of land in the future with the profit they will earn from the business.

loans.use: To purchase cauliflower seeds, pesticides and fertilizer

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is a married woman who has been blessed with three children.  She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumables like wheat flour, rice and cooking oil.  She cites seasonality as the major challenge she faces in the business.  In addition, she runs a cafe to supplement her income. 

Fatma is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to boost her shop, purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tealeaves and cooking fat.  She dreams of expanding to a hotel shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, tealeaves and cooking fat.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is married and blessed with two children who both attend school.  She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

Over the years, she has operated a dried fish selling business, selling at the market to town dwellers and passersby.  She faces the main challenge of high transportation costs in her business.  She dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

With the loan of 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase prawns and dried fish for resale. She joined Yehu because of favorable lending policies.

loans.use: to purchase prawns and dried fish for resale.

loans.name: Dorah

texts.en: Dorah is widowed with four children and owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped-in water. She earns a living by selling building stones to neighbors and passersby. Her biggest challenge is the seasonality of her business. Dorah's dream is to own a rental house in the near future. With this loan, for Kshs 20,000, she wants to buy two truckloads of stones to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy two truckloads of stones to sell.

loans.name: Enma Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Enma es una señora de 43 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de Estelí. Madre soltera de 3 hijos ya independientes. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de comida, el cual con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante y mantener su negocio prospero. Inicio su negocio hace varios años. Hoy en día cuenta con mucha clientela. Su meta próxima es mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda. Solicita el crédito para saneamiento de vivienda, con el fin de asegurarse una mejor calidad de vida, con una mejor higiene. Estima que el crédito le será muy beneficioso ya que brindara a su familia una mejor condición donde vivir y con más seguridad. Su plan futuro es seguir mejorando aún más la calidad de vida de su vivienda.
texts.en: Doña Enma is a 43-year-old woman originally from the town of Estelí. She is a single mother of 3 children who are already independent. She is a certified merchant, selling food. She has painstakingly managed to move forward and keep her business thriving. She started her business several years ago. Today, she has many customers. Her next goal is to improve the infrastructure of her home. She requests a loan for housing sanitation in order to ensure of better quality of life with better hygiene. She estimates that the loan will be very beneficial as it will provide her family better and safer living conditions. Her future plan is to continue to improve the quality of life in her home further.

loans.use: to improve sanitation in her home.

loans.name: Anisa Group

texts.en:
This group is called Anisa and it consists of four women.  They have applied for a loan of 120,000 YER from AMB in order to solve their immediate financial problems. 

Anisa is the leader of this group.  A native of Hadramout, Yemen, she is a 36-year-old married woman.  She has a small house.  She has accumulated some money to renovate her house.  It is known that house renovation requires a lot of money.  She has started renovating her house but now she is short of money.  On this occasion, she needs the loan in order to buy building materials such as cement and lumber to finish remodeling her house.  

She is grateful for the loan and commits to make her installment payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement and lumber to remodel her house.

loans.name: Fortune Women's Group

texts.en: Marion is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She deals in second-hand women's clothes, selling from market to market where she finds her customers. She runs her business with limited capital of 400,000, and has applied for a loan to rent a permanent place to sell clothes from, buy more inventory and pay tuition for her children. Her major challenge is harsh climatic conditions which affect her when she moves around. She hopes this will soon be history since she will now be able to rent a permanent place to sell from. Marion is a very honest and hard working. Despite these challenges, she is determined to work tirelessly and provide a good education to her children.

loans.use: to buy goats and rent land.

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Rina lives in the small town of Madhyapara in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is a 28-year-old housewife and blessed with two children. Her husband Tahidul, 28 years old, sells betel nuts, which are used as a mouth freshener. They live in their own Kaccha (mud and straw made) house. Both Rina and her husband are illiterate and can only sign their names. None of their children goes to school. They are below the school-going age.

Rina chose BJS for this loan because she wants to purchase a cow and she hopes to earn a profit from this business since there is a great demand for dairy products in her locality and in the present market.

Rina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family. She desires to buy more cows with the profit she will earn from the business.

loans.use: To purchase a cow and start a dairy products business.

loans.name: María  Victoria

texts.es:
María, es una joven, soltera,  y se desempeña como maestra de educación primaria con 3 años de experiencia ejerciendo esta arda labor.
Actualmente  esta joven se presento a la oficina de ceprodel  para solicitar  un  financiamiento   para la construcción de una cocina, y lo utilizará en la compra de materiales de construcción tales como zinc, cemento, madera, piedrín, arena, hierro y el pago de la mano de obra.
Agradece a ceprodel y a las demás instituciones que la han apoyado ya que con este crédito seria el numero 3 y le han servido de mucho y ha podido ir mejorando su vivienda, que es la única manera que lo ha podido ir haciendo ya que los salarios de los maestros son muy bajos.
texts.en:
Maria is single and an elementary school teacher with three years of experience. She is requesting this loan from the field partner to build a kitchen in her home. She will use it to buy construction materials such as zinc, cement, wood, gravel, sand and iron bars and to pay for labor.

Maria is grateful to the field partner and the other lending institutions that have helped her very much to make improvements to her home. She says that this is her third loan, and that it is the only way she can continue making home improvements, because teachers’ salaries are very low.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as zinc, cement, wood, gravel, sand and iron bars and to pay for labor to build a kitchen in her home.

loans.name: Kevin Mauricio

texts.es: El Joven Kevin  tiene 19 años y es soltero,  estudia la carrera  licenciatura en una Universidad de La ciudad de la Paz, trabaja para pagar sus estudios su papá le ayuda en el pago de sus estudios, kevin va a usar este préstamo para  distintos gastos  que implica el estudiar como compra de una computadora, libros y material para sus estudios para terminar sus estudios que durara el tiempo 5 años. Kevin  enfrenta retos en su estudios que son no cuenta con liquidez necesaria para comprar todo el material que se le exige en la universidad,  y esto le impide realizar sus prácticas, su deseo cuando termine sus estudios es trabajar en una empresa reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional y poder ayudar a su familia ya que se sacrifican por él para mejorar su futuro.
texts.en:
This young man, Kevin, is nineteen years old.  He is single and is studying to get his degree at the University of La Paz.  He works in order to pay for his studies, and his father also helps him to cover his school costs.  

Kevin is going to use the loan to buy different things he needs for school, like a computer, books, and study materials he needs in order to finish his classes during the 5-year period.

Kevin faces challenges in his studies; he doesn't have the necessary money to buy all the materials he needs, and this prevents him from doing all his work.  His dream when he finishes his studies is to work in a business that is both nationally and internationally recognized.  He wants to be able to help his family, since they have already sacrificed a lot in order to give him a better future.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Yahuar Maqui Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “YAHUAR MAQUI”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Antonieta ella es casada y tiene 49 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo con papas, sopas y saltados de carnes, la socia trabaja desde las 10:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar sillas y mesas para su restaurant.
Las socias que estan pegadas a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de celulares, negocio de crianza de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank “YAHUAR MAQUI.” This bank is located in the district, province and department of Cuzco. 

Antonieta, a member, is 49 years old and married with 2 children. She works in her restaurant. She prepares different dishes such as chicken and potatoes, soups and chicken stir fry. She works from 10am to 5pm. She has been doing this work for 7 years and it’s going well. 

Antonieta’s dream is to expand her restaurant business. She is requesting a loan to purchase chairs and tables for her restaurant.

The member photographs that are inserted with the group photo were taken after the meeting due to work, they were granted permission. The other members work in the following businesses: sale of mobiles, animal raising, grocery store, and sale of food.

Antonieta is grateful to those who are part of her dream in this way and is committed to make her repayments within the agreed period.

loans.use: to purchase chairs and tables for her restaurant.

loans.name: Mercedez

texts.es: La señora Mercedez tiene 37 años casada con tres hijos de las edades de 9, 5  y 11 años, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa según la temporada, ella vende sus productos en distintas ferias de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la señora Mercedez va a usar este préstamo para compra de ropa según la temporada al por mayor y asi surtir su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar su mercadería, la señora Mercedez enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando  mercadería y así de esta manera genera más ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Sra. Mercedez is 37 years old, married and has three children who are 9, 5 and 11 years old. She sells seasonal clothing at different fairs in the city of Santa Cruz. This loan is her first from Emprender. Sra. Mercedez is going to use this loan to buy clothing wholesale and thus stock her business. Her reason for requesting this loan is to increase her inventory. 

Sra. Mercedez confronts challenges such as competition in her business and she will use her profits to continue purchasing merchandise so that she can generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is 57 years old and she lives in Vanadzor city, which is in the Lori region.  Her husband lives and works in the Russian Federation.  Their daughter is married and she lives with her family.  Anahit lives with her retired mother. 

She is a skilled and successful businesswoman with a rich and positive credit history as well as two perfect deals with Kiva lenders and Nor Horizon.  She used the previous loans to develop her business of selling dishware and ceramics in her own shop.  On both occasions, she used the loans to enlarge her shop’s assortment.  She sells kitchen utensils, tea serving pieces, vases, etc.  She has many loyal customers who come very far from cities in order to do their shopping from her shop. 

She is requesting a loan of 600,000 AMD in order to buy and begin the sale of souvenirs in addition to her current inventory of dishware and ceramics.

loans.use: to buy and begin selling souvenirs.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy earns a living by selling groceries in Oloitoktok town. She is 41 years old and widowed with four children. She has been in this business for three years and is proud to say it has been profitable. Lucy has requested a loan to buy more beans and maize to sell. This will allow her to meet her customers' demands as well as make more income. She will use the profits she expects to earn to buy more cereals to sell. She repaid her first loan successfully, and in the future hopes to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy more cereals to sell.

loans.name: Adline

texts.en: Adline is married and blessed with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has no electricity or piped-in water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. Adline earns a living by cooking food to sell in a local market. Most of her customers are neighbors and passersby. Her biggest challenge is left-over food. She dreams of establishing a cafe in the future. She is requesting a loan for Kshs 20,000 to buy food ingredients such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil. Adline decided to join Yehu to access financial support so that she will be able to expand her business

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia Clara junto a un grupo de personas de la misma comunidad decidieron cuidar la tierra y los animales, para obtener quesos ecológicos, con un alto contenido nutritivo en calcio, proteinas y fósforo. A la vez se contrarestará los problemas nutricionales de la leche que tienen un alto contenido en grasas saturadas, en triglicéridos y ácido graso saturado. El primer paso que dió fue no atar a las vacas, ni mantenerlas encerradas lejos de los pastisales en los que les gusta pastar, tampoco cortarles los cuernos, para que, éstas den terneras de forma natural y el alimento que proporcionen sea fresco y de gran calidad. 

Ella vive en casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Achica Baja, del Sector Viacha de la provincia Ingavi, del Departamento de La Paz, aproximadamente a dos horas de viaje desde la ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito será utilizado en la compra de un par de vacas lecheras de raza mejorada para obtener leche de mejor calidad y utilizarla como insumo principal en la producción de queso ecológico, que es su proyecto en el cual trabaja actualmente.

El sueño de Julia Clara es crecer y a mediano plazo, contar con su propia granja ecológica, la cual sea autosostenible y principalmente con BIODIGESTORES y BIOGAS, para lo cual se requiere de ganado que proporcione al menos 12 kilos de estiercol diario, que mezclados con 60 litros de agua, proporcionarán Metano por 4 horas diarias, evitando así la emanación de dióxido de carbono (CO2), para el cuidado del medio ambiente.

Es la tercera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Julia Clara is part of a group in her community that decided to take care of the land and the animals. She produces organic cheeses, which have a high nutrition content that includes calcium, protein, and phosphorus. At the same time, they lack the nutritional problems usually associated with cheese such as high levels of saturated fats, triglycerides, and saturated fatty acids. The first step that she took was not to keep the cows locked up or enclosed far away from the pastures where they like to graze. In addition, she does not cut off the horns since the calves were born that way. The food she gives them is fresh and of high quality.

Julia Clara lives in her home in the community of Achica Baja, which is in the Viacha sector of Ingavi Province in the Department of La Paz. It is approximately a two-hour trip from the city of La Paz. Her loan will be used to buy a pair of dairy cows of improved breed so that she can obtain milk of the best quality. This will be used as the main ingredient in the production of organic cheese, which is how she currently makes her living.

Julia Clara’s dream is to grow and eventually have an organic farm of her own that is self-sustaining and operates with the use of bio-digesters and biogas. This equipment requires that her cows produce at least 12 kilos of manure per day, which is mixed with 60 liters of water. The mixture provides enough methane to last for four hours each day, which prevents the emission of carbon dioxide into the environment.

This is the third time Julia Clara has requested a loan from IMPRO, but the second time through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a pair of dairy cows.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha, de 27 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su madre Victoria a quien cuida en su casa propia. Martha se dedica a la agricultura, principalmente a sembrar papa, olluco y maíz en cantidad, lo cual cuida diariamente junto  su esposo,, pues se distribuyen las acuidades en el cuidado de sus animales cuenta con vacas, cerdos, ovejas de las cuales obtiene ingresos extras. Ya que vende la leche que producen y comercializa a los cerdos y ovejas a los carniceros que llegan al anexo cada mes. A pesar de la lejanía del lugar se siente feliz, ya que estar en contacto con la naturaleza es lo que más le gusta y agrada. Por eso desea mejorar sus sembríos y seguir sembrando otras variedades de alimentos. Este el primer crédito con Kiva, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Martha, invertirá los S/.500 soles en la compra de  abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos de maíz y papa.
texts.en:
Martha, 27, is an unassuming woman living with her mother, Victoria, who she cares for at home.  Martha works in agriculture mainly growing potatoes, olluco [a tuber] and corn in quantity.  She cares for it daily with her husband and sell it in cities.
