She raises cows, pigs and sheep to earn income since she sells the milk they produce and sells the pigs and sheep to butchers that come to the annex every month.

Despite the distance, she feels happy because she’s in contact with nature which is what she likes and enjoys best.  This is why she wants to improve her crops and continue to grow other varieties of foodstuffs.

This is her first Kiva loan and she hopes the small loan will help her reach her goals.  On the other hand, she promises to make her payments.  Martha will use the 500 soles to buy organic manure to nourish her corn and potato crops.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Señor Cautivo De Ayabaca Group

texts.es: El grupo “Señor Cautivo De Ayabaca” constituida por 07 mujeres cada una de ellas con distintas actividades de comercio. Lucia es casada y tiene 03 hijos,  actualmente sigue apoyando a 02 de ellos. A sus 58 años Lucia se siente feliz pues gracias a su esfuerzo a mejorado su vivienda y también  cubrir con algunos gastos del hogar. Lucia se dedica a la venta de dulcería como mazamorra morada, arroz con leche, entre otros dulces. Los créditos anteriores fueron invertidos  en insumos. Con el crédito actual comprará  toldo, cubiertos y de esta manera brindarles una mejor atención a sus clientes. Seguir mejorando su negocio es su mayor deseo. El grupo “Señor Cautivo De Ayabaca” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por la ayuda brindada. Lucia es la primera del lado derecho,  viste chaleco verde y pantalón a cuadros.
texts.en:
Señor Cautivo de Ayabaca Group is made up of seven women, each of whom has a different commercial activity.

Lucia, 58, is married and has three children. She currently still supports two of them.  She's happy because thanks to her effort she has improved her home and covered some household expenses.  She makes a living selling sweets such as mazamorra morada [pudding made of purple corn] and arroz con leche [rice pudding].  She spent her previous loans on ingredients.

Lucia's going to buy an awning and cutlery so she can give her customers better service.  Her biggest desire is to keep on improving her business.

Señor Cautivo de Ayabaca Group thanks the Kiva lenders for their help.  Lucia's the first one on the right; she's wearing a green sweater and plaid pants.

loans.use: to buy an awning and cutlery

loans.name: Del Futuro Del Manu Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Del Futuro del Manu” y las reuniones de las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Salvación provincia de Manu departamento de Madre de Dios.

Rocio pertenece al banco comunal y ella tiene 34 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo, ella nació en la ciudad de Salvación y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella tiene varias actividades económicas en la ciudad de Salvación. Roció trabaja como empleada pública en el centro forestal de la ciudad de Salvación en el área de gerencia, ella también tiene un puesto de venta de artesanía, ella en sus horas libres se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía en su domicilio. Ya es un año que se dedica a la artesanía y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Rocio requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas secas para elaborar collares y pulseras. El sueño de Rocio es exportar sus productos. Rocio agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales. 

Este banco comunal está conformado por varias personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Los socios se dedican a la agricultura, a la ganadería, al engorde de ganado, a la venta y compra de madera, a la elaboración de artesanía, brindar hospedaje y venta de comida, venta de comestibles y venta de productos agro veterinarios. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The "Del Futuro del Manu" Communal Bank is formed by a group of friends and neighbors. The meetings of the communal bank's female members are every thirty days in the city of Salvación, province of Manu and department of Madre de Dios. 

Rocio belongs to the communal bank and is 34 years old. She forms part of a civil union from which she has one child. She was born in the city of Salvación and lives in this same city where she was born. She is involved in a variety of economic activities in the city. Rocio works as a public worker in the management department of the forestry center in Salvación. She also has an artisan stall - in her free time she makes artisan crafts from her home. 

It has now been a year since she started making artisan crafts and it is going very well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into this work. This time, Rocio needs a loan to buy dried seeds to make into necklaces and bracelets. Rocio's dream is to export her products. She appreciates and values the loan and is committed to paying each monthly installment. 

This communal bank is made up of several people who are constantly seeking opportunities to get ahead, and with their efforts, to give a better future to their children. The members make a living in agriculture, raising and fattening livestock, the resale of wood, the production of artisan crafts, the provision of accommodations, the sale of food and the sale of agro-veterinarian products. 

The members are thankful for the opportunity given and are committed to fulfilling their payments according to the terms established.

loans.use: to buy dried seeds to make into necklaces and bracelets.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Juana Pamela

texts.es: Juana de 32 años es casada y tiene 01 hija menor de edad. Actualmente cursa el 4to ciclo de la carrera de contabilidad y gestión tributaria, en una universidad de prestigio. Desde muy joven siempre se intereso por dicha carrera, pues es buena para ello, tales lo  demuestran sus notas. Los ingresos que obtiene con su negocio de venta de prendas de vestir, son de mucha ayuda para ella, ya que le permite cubrir con algunos gastos de la universidad. En esta oportunidad solicitó el crédito para el pago del siguiente ciclo de su carrera. Terminar satisfactoriamente su carrera y ser una profesional competitiva es su mayor deseo. Juana agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Juana is 32 years old, married, and has a young daughter.  She is currently in her fourth semester of a degree program in Accounting and Tax Management at a prestigious university.  Since she was a young person, she has always been interested in this type of career.  She is very good at it and has demonstrated this to be so.  She generates income from her business of selling clothes, which has been a great help since she is able to cover a few of her university expenses.  

Juana is taking this opportunity to request a loan so that she can pay for the next semester of her degree program.  Her greatest wish is to finish her degree successfully and to become a competitive professional.  She is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the assistance they have provided.

loans.use: to pay for the next semester of her degree program.

loans.name: Patao

texts.en:
Patao is a 32-year-old hardworking gentleman.  He is married to Zabel and is the father of three children between the ages of three months and 10 years.  

He is a livestock trader in the Katakala area of Narok County, Kenya.  Patao has been running the business for the past 10 years, earning a monthly income of 30,000 KES.  He has borrowed a fifth loan of 80,000 KES from KADET, which he intends to use to purchase more livestock to fatten and resell for a profit. 

The anticipated profit will be reinvested to grow his business.  His dream is to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase livestock to fatten for resale.

loans.name: Malia

texts.en:
Malia is a farmer in the town of Kangundo, where she keeps dairy cows. She also plants cash crops for sale. She is 35 years old and married. Together with her spouse they have been blessed with three children. 

She has been in the farming business for eight years now and will be using this loan to buy cattle feed for her dairy cows. She will also buy fertilizer and seeds for planting in her farm. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more farm input.

This is her third loan term and she paid her previous loans successfully. Malia's future hopes are to have more dairy cattle and to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy cattle feed, fertilizer, and seeds

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 55 years old and married. Together with his spouse, who is a farmer and also provides additional income, they have been blessed with four children. He sells cattle and chicken in the town of Emali and has been in this business for five years.

This is his fourth loan term. He plans to use this loan to buy more stock of chicken to sell. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

He paid his previous loans successfully and in the future, James hopes to give a good education to his children.

loans.use: to buy more chicken for sale

loans.name: Matiasa

texts.es: La  Sra. Matiasa, es soltera, trabaja en la agricultura hace 15 años, tiene plantaciones de yuca y cítricos, la Sra. Matiasa   necesita mucha ayuda económica para mejorar sus ingresos porque según lo que indica la Sra. Matiasa  este año su cosecha no fue tan buena como los anteriores años, necesita mucha ayuda para afrontar esta crisis insoportable, sus ingresos no son suficientes para frenar esta crisis manifiesta ella, es por esta razón que solicita crédito para  mantenimientos de sus cultivos, ampliación de sus plantaciones y así podrá rendir al máximo sus cultivos.
texts.en: Matiasa is single and has worked in agriculture fifteen years.  She grows cassava and citrus fruit.  She needs much economic assistance in order to improve her income because according to what she says her harvest this year wasn’t as good as in previous years.  She needs much help to face this unbearable crisis.  Her income is insufficient to stop this crisis and this is why she’s asking for the loan to maintain and expand her crops in order to get the maximum yields possible.

loans.use: to maintain her yuca cultivation and expand her crops

loans.name: Edison Fabian

texts.es:
Edison, es un joven emprendedor, soltero tiene 22 años vive con sus padres y los estudios realizó hasta la secundaria vive en San Rafael La Capilla perteneciente a Otavalo Provincia de Imbabura es un lugar de mucho turismo alrededor de donde él vive la mayoría de personas de esa zona se dedican a la artesanía de esteras al comercio y producción de esteras, Edison se dedica a la comercialización de esteras en la Ciudad de Napo.
Esta actividad la viene realizando desde los 15 años de edad, aprendió de sus padres que también se dedican a la comercialización de esteras, él dejó de estudiar para dedicarse a esta actividad por falta de economía dejó los estudios y ahora con este negocio ha podido aprender mucho y además puede ayudar en el hogar con los gastos de los servicios básicos. Trabaja desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde recorriendo las calles de la ciudad para hacer las ventas de feria en feria, ha sido muy difícil para él la movilización pues la mercadería la lleva siempre cargando en la espalda y ofrece esteras de diferentes medidas. La estera es elaborada con “totora” que dependiendo del tamaño se demora 2 horas en tejerlas, pero resultan ser muy atractivas para las personas que hacen turismo. Ahora Edison solicita un crédito para incremento de mercadería para esta temporada de navidad que las ventas suelen mejorar y así aumentar el negocio para solventar las necesidades del hogar y cubrir las deudas que mantiene. Edison está muy agradecido con Fundación Alternativa y Kiva por darle la oportunidad de seguir incrementando la mercadería y aumentar las ventas y así mejorar su estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Edison, 22, is a young entrepreneur living with his parents.  He completed secondary school and lives in San Rafael La Capilla that belongs to Otavalo in Imbabura Province.  This is a place with much tourism.  Most people living around him work as craftsmen making and selling reed mats.  Edison sells these mats in the city of Napo.

He’s been doing this since the age of 15 having learned from his parents who also sell mats.  He stopped going to school in order to go into this business because the lack of economic resources made staying in school impossible and now with the business he’s been able to learn much and also help at home with basic household expenses and utility costs.

He works from 5 in the morning until 6 in the evening going through the streets in the city to sell from street market to street market.  Moving about has always been difficult because he must carry his merchandise on his back; he sells mats of various sizes.

The mats are made from ‘totora’ [texture of sedge, flags, or rushes] and depending on their size can take up to two hours to weave but they are very attractive to tourists.

Now Edison is asking for a loan to increase his merchandise for the Christmas season in which sales tend to improve to increase business and meet household needs and also to pay debts he has.  Edison is very grateful to Fundación Alternativa and to Kiva for giving him the opportunity of continuing to increase his merchandise and to increase sales thus improving his life style.

loans.use: to buy reeds at wholesale.

loans.name: Leyde Diana

texts.es:
Leyde vive en la ciudad de chincha, para poder obtener ingresos y poder apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y poder sacar a su hijo adelante, trabaja como vendedora en una pequeña tienda de su ciudad, asimismo tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de productos naturales y energéticos, con lo cual tiene un dinero extra para su hogar; Leyde trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo responsable.

Leyde esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar más productos naturales para vender y de esta manera poder mejorar su calidad y vida y sacar adelante a su familia y luchar por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Leyde lives in the city of Chincha.  In order to earn income and be able to help her husband with the household expenses and improve her son's life, she works as a saleswoman at a small store in her city.  She also has a small business selling natural and energy products, which earns extra money for her household. Leyde works about 9 hours a day and believes that her work is going well because she is very kind to customers and overall she is responsible.

Leyde is grateful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to the help they have provided, she will be able to purchase more natural products to sell so that she can improve her quality of life and help her family succeed.  She wants to fight to make her dream of having her own home a reality.

loans.use: to purchase natural and energy products.

loans.name: Waldir Enrique

texts.es:
Waldir tiene 39 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de imperial y para poder llevar un pan a su hogar trabaja como ayudante de traslado de mercadería en una tienda de su ciudad, Waldir cree que el va bien en su trabajo porque es muy amable y responsable.

Waldir está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales de construcción para poder colocar un falso piso en la vivienda donde habita y seguir luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:”  Mejorar su calidad de Vida”.
texts.en:
Waldir is 39 and lives in the imperial city, Cuzco. In order to be able to make a living, he works as an assistant in a shop in the city transporting goods. Waldir believes that he is doing well in his job because he is friendly and responsible. 

Waldir is very thankful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, he can buy construction materials to build a false floor in the house where he is living and continue fighting to achieve his great dream: “to improve his quality of life”.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Azat

texts.en:
Azat lives in the village of Sarigyugh, in the Tavush region. He is married and he has a son. All of his family is engaged in farming. Azat has worked as a driver for many years, but now he is unemployed. In his farm he has a cow, a calf, and twenty chickens. Azat’s wife sells milk, cheese, and eggs right from their house to their loyal customers. Azat greatly wants to make his farm bigger and more profitable.

He asks a loan of 1,000,000 AMD in order to buy two cows as well as to buy a lot of animal fodder.

loans.use: to buy two cows as well as a lot of animal fodder in order to enlarge his farm

loans.name: Babu

texts.en: Babu lives in Mombasa, Kenya. He is 42 years old and married with three children. He has been in the charcoal sales business for a while now and the business has been growing over the years. He started his business from small savings that he had. He knew Milango through friends and now he seeks a loan to buy seven bags of charcoal and two bags of coconuts. The challenges that he faces in the business include seasonal weather, which cuts down sales, and regulations. The income that he will raise will improve his standard of living. He also plans to start a poultry business in the future.

loans.use: to buy seven bags of charcoal and two bags of coconuts

loans.name: Husna

texts.en: Husna is 36 years old and she is married with children to take care of. She lives in the Mariakani area near Mombasa in Kenya. She also does business as part of her economic activity. She runs a food cafe that has been operation for the last year. She started the food cafe business from small savings that she had. Her business has been growing ever since. She knew Milango through friends and now she seeks a loan to buy a bundle of wheat flour and maize flour for her business. She hopes that in the next five years her business will have expanded to reach other towns and that she will increase her income. The challenges that she has been facing in the business include bad debt and competition. The extra income that she will raise from the business will improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of wheat flour and maize flour

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: Doña Reyna, es soltera, busca la manera de progresar en la vida al lado de su hija con la que se acompañan ambas, la actividad de Reyna es  hacer tortillas a diario y nacatamales los fines de semana, los cuales vende en su casa de habitación, este es su medio de ingresos para el hogar. Ella solicita este crédito para ir haciendo la primer parte del muro perimetral del lado sur de su vivienda, con esta inversión Reyna garantizara su seguridad y la de su hija, así como también privacidad.
texts.en:
Reyna is single.  She is looking for a way to improve in life together with her daughter that they can share.  Reyna works making tortillas every day and nacatamales on weekends, which she sells from her home.  This is her means of supporting the household.

She is requesting this loan to build the first part of a perimeter wall on the south side of her home.  With this investment, Reyna will provide security and privacy for herself and her daughter.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement, sand, iron, and blocks.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto tiene 23 años de edad  vive en concubinato,  tiene 2 hijos a los que cuida, apoya en su educación y alimentación,  el señor Roberto tuvo una educación solo hasta el nivel primaria, esto a consecuencia de la falta de  recursos económicos de sus padres, por lo que no pudo realizar estudios superiores, desde entonces el empezó a trabajar  en las cosechas de cítricos, piña, plátano etc. donde conoció a su pareja ellos eran jóvenes, actualmente el señor Roberto  trabaja de moto taxi ,  con sus ahorros se compraron su lote urbano en la misma población  donde tienen su casita hace 4 años atrás, pero en el en trópico de Cochabamba  las construcciones no tienen mucha duración por la lluvias factores climatológicos, por lo cual el señor solicita un crédito para la refacción de su casita y así dar un techo bueno y duradero  a su familia y poder mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Roberto is 23 years old and lives with his partner. He has 2 children who he feeds and cares for, and supports in their education. Roberto only received elementary school education due to his parents' limited economic means and therefore was unable to complete higher education. After leaving school, he began working, harvesting citrus fruit, pineapple, bananas, etc. This is were he met his partner, when they were both young. 

Currently, Roberto works as a moto-taxi driver. With his savings, he has purchased an urban lot in the same area where his house is, which he bought 4 years ago. However, in the tropical climate of Cochabamba, buildings don't last long due to the rains, and so Roberto is requesting a loan to make repairs to his house, which will allow him to give his family a good quality and long-lasting home, and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to make repairs to his home.

loans.name: Edmundo

texts.es:
Edmundo es un hombre de 49 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con sus 2 hijos, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Edmundo no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Edmundo trabaja como chofer de bus, transportando personal a diversos fundos de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Edmundo se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada realizara el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea reforzar el techado de su hogar, así pues Edmundo seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propio vehículo para seguir trabajando.
texts.en: Edmund, who is 49, lives with his 2 children in the city of Ica, in Parcona district.  He is a very hardworking and enthusiastic man who puts all his effort into supporting his family.  Unfortunately, due financial hardship and the need to work, he was not able to study for a professional career.  On his own initiative, Edmundo works as a bus driver, carrying workers to the different estates in his city.  He works for about 10 hours a day and believes that he is successful because of his dedication and effort. Edmund is very grateful to Kiva lenders since, with the help they provide, he will improve his home by reinforcing the roof.  He will, therefore, continue working and striving to achieve his great ambition: to continue working with a vehicle of his own.

loans.use: to make improvements to his home

loans.name: Reyna Gladiz

texts.es: La señora Reyna tiene 44 años, es una persona trabajadora y responsable, vive en concubinato desde hace ya varios años y tienen tres hijos dos mujercitas y un varoncito a los cuales mantienen y ayudan en su educación. La señora se dedica a la  venta de comida,  a pesar de tener ahorros ella necesita dinero para la refacción de su vivienda, en la cual habita junto a su familia, ya que la vivienda se encuentra con goteras y algunos desperfectos en el techo y el piso los cuales afecta e incómoda el desarrollo diario de sus hijos. Es por esta razón que solicita crédito para refacción de vivienda, ya que así podrá brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en: Señora Reyna is 44 years old. She is a hard-working and responsible person. She has been living with her partner for a number of years, and they have three children, two daughters and a son, whom they support and help in their education. This woman works in selling food. In spite of having savings, she needs money to repair her home, where she lives together with her family, since the house is leaking, and there are some flaws in the roof and in the floor that affect and inconvenience the daily development of her children. It is for this reason that she is applying for the loan, for the repair of her house, since this way she will be able to offer a better quality of life to her children.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Bernardino

texts.es: El Señor  Bernardino  tiene 59 años y es casado, él se dedica a la venta de comida en su restaurante que se  encuentra en la localidad de Batallas,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Señor  Bernardino  va a usar este préstamo para compra de una motocicleta su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la necesidad de poder movilizarse ya que será den gran ayuda cuando realice sus compras,  el Señor  Bernardino  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su negocio y calidad de vida  de su familia y va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar insumos para la elaboración de sus comidas, el  Señor  Bernardino  es una persona con ganas de seguir adelante se siente feliz por esta oportunidad que le brindan para mejorar su negocio y por ende sus ingresos económicos
texts.en:
Bernardino is 59 years old and is married. He earns a living selling food in a restaurant located in the municipality of Batallas. 

This is his first loan with this institution. Bernardino will use this loan to purchase a motorcycle. He is requesting this loan because he needs to be able to get around and it will be a great help when he makes his purchases. 

Bernardino faces several challenges in his business, including the need to improve his business and his family's quality of life. 

He will use the profits to buy supplies to prepare meals. 

Bernardino is a person who has a desire to succeed.  He is happy for this opportunity to improve his business and to increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Edwin Belisario

texts.es: El señor Edwin tiene 30 años, vive en un cuarto en alquiler en la ciudad de Monteagudo, es soltero y tiene un hijo menor que depende de él y cubre todos sus gastos, su principal actividad es funcionario en el Gobierno Municipal de Monteagudo, pero los ingresos provenientes del mismo no son suficientes, por ello requiere un crédito de Bs. 10200 para comprar muebles y otros artefactos para su hogar, para así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Edwin is 30 years old. He lives in a rented room in the city of Monteagudo. He is single and has a minor son who depends on him and he covers all of his expenses. His main activity is working as an official for the Municipal Government of Monteagudo, but his income from that job aren't enough. That is why he needs a loan of Bs. 10200 to buy furniture and other items for his home to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy furniture and other items for his home.

loans.name: Ramnath

texts.en: Ramnath is 50 years old and has a family with two children. The whole family is involved in the family business. Ramnath plants rice together with his son. His wife, Prenita, standing next to him in the photo, sells food in their small shop together with their daughter. Ramnath has bought, with the support of Seva MFI, some land and a tractor. This loan he repaid fully. He now wants to buy a gutter plough for SRD 4,950. He asks Seva MFI again to help him in financing this.

loans.use: to buy a gutter plough.

loans.name: Jorge Milton

texts.es:
Jorge un hombre trabajador de 28 años de edad, nació en la provincia de Cotopaxi, cantón Pangua, este sector es conocido como el corazón del Ecuador por su buena ubicación geográfica, pero cabe mencionar que la situación económica no es tan buena; por ello tuvo que migrar hasta la ciudad de Latacunga con el afán de encontrar mejores oportunidades de trabajo y  se quedo a radicar en esta ciudad, terminó sus estudios primarios con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio.
Jorge  está casado, junto a su esposa con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio pudo construir su casa en un terreo heredado, él se  dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos, junto con su esposa trabajan en esta actividad, además Jorge es chofer y por lo general pasa fuera de su casa y no puede compartir con su familia.
Acude a Fundación Alternativa para solicitar un crédito para la compra de cerdos y de una reproductora para de esta forma tener más cerdos y con la llegada de la época navideña venderlos y obtener mejores ganancias, debido a que la mayoría de las familias en estas festividades compran cerdos para prepararlos y compartir en familia.
 Jorge quiere hacer llegar un cordial y efusivo  agradecimiento a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
28-year-old Jorge is a hard-working man and was born in the province of Cotopaxi, Pangua canton. This area is known as the heart of Ecuador because of its geographic location, but it should be noted that the economic situation isn't so good. Because of this, Jorge had to move to the city of Latacunga with the aim of finding better work opportunities and ended up putting down roots in the city. He finished his primary education with a lot of hard work and self-sacrifice. Jorge is married and with a lot of effort and self-sacrifice he and his wife were able to build their own house on a plot of inherited land. He rears and sells pigs and he and his wife do this work together. Jorge also works as a driver and generally is away from home and cannot spend time with his family. 

Jorge approached Fundación Alternativa to ask for a loan to buy pigs and a breeding sow so that he can have more pigs. With the approaching Christmas season he will sell them and get better profits, since most families buy pigs at this time of year to prepare and share with the family.

Jorge wishes to send sincere and heartfelt thanks to Fundación Alternativa in Ecuador and to Kiva for making this improvement in his work and personal life possible.

loans.use: to buy pigs and a breeding female, and so improve his quality of life.

loans.name: Martha Lucía

texts.es: Martha, con 56 años de edad, comenzó su propio negocio como una alternativa para generar ingresos que le permitieran aportar a la economía del hogar; montó una pequeña miscelánea con poco surtido y, a medida que pasaban los días, los habitantes del sector fueron reconociendo el negocio y las ventas fueron incrementando, por lo que su portafolio de productos creció notablemente y, hoy, luego de 21 años de estar en funcionamiento ya ofrece productos de papelería, accesorios para el cabello, productos de aseo personal, artículos de belleza, ropa, entre otros, lo que le ha permitido tener el sustento diario para solventar las necesidades básicas de su hogar, especialmente ahora que quedó viuda tras el fallecimiento de su esposo, por lo que tiene toda la responsabilidad económica en sus manos. Actualmente, las ventas han disminuido por lo que ella ha tenido que salir a vender los productos de forma ambulante a sus amigos, familiares y vecinos del sector, pero espera que para la temporada de fin decembrina las ventas mejoren, por lo que solicita el crédito para comprar surtido al por mayor (artículos de papelería, bolsas de regalo, adornos navideños, accesorios, entre otros) de esta manera podrá satisfacer la demanda de productos y mejorará su nivel de ingresos. Martha sueña con tener un establecimiento más amplio, con mejor y más variado inventario para que sea más rentable y le permita disfrutar una vejez tranquila, con mejor bienestar y calidad de vida.
texts.en: Martha is 56 years old. She started her own business as a way to generate income that would allow her to contribute to the household budget. She opened a little convenience store with a little bit of merchandise. As the days went by, residents of the area got to know the business and her sales increased. Her range of products grew notably and now after 24 years in business she offers paper goods, hair products, personal hygiene products, beauty items, and more. This has allowed her to have daily income to pay for household necessities, especially now that she is a widow after her husband's death, and all of the financial responsibility is in her hands. Right now, her sales have gone down and she has had to go out and sell products as a street vendor to her friends, relatives and area residents. She hopes that for the end of the December season her sales will increase. That is why she is asking for a loan to buy merchandise wholesale (paper goods, gift bags, Christmas decorations, accessories and more). This way she can fill the demand for products and improve her income level. Martha dreams of having a bigger establishment with better and more varied inventory to be more profitable and able to enjoy a peaceful old age with more wellbeing and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise wholesale (paper goods, gift bags, Christmas decorations, accessories, and more).

loans.name: Mostana

texts.en:
Mostana, 26 years old, is a married housewife. She is illiterate and can only sign her name. Her husband, Jahiruddin, who is 28 years old, has a cycle van. He earns money for the livelihood of his family by driving the cycle van. He is also uneducated and just knows how to sign his name.


They have two children. One of them goes to school and reads in class III (grade 3). They live in their own kachha (straw and mud-made) house in a small village, Boragari, in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.


The earnings from Mostana's husband’s work was too low to run a family. So, they thought to shift to another business. Then she came to know about BJS and has taken a loan to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers. As there is a great demand for potatoes in the local market, she hopes that this business will be a profitable one. She hopes it will give her additional financial support to run her family well and give a good education to her children.


In the future, they want to buy more cycle vans to extend her business with the profit.

loans.use: to purchase good quality potato seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Nilufa

texts.en:
Nilufa is a 30-year-old married woman from a small village, Barosoria, in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. Her family consists of her husband, Sahidul, and three children (two sons and one daughter). They live in their own kaccha house (mud and straw-made). 


Both Nilufa and her husband are illiterate and can only sign their names. Their children are receiving education. Their two sons are in class X (grade 10) and class VIII (grade 8) respectively, and their daughter is in class VI (grade 6).


The main source of income for the family is their agricultural activities. They have a plot of land where potatoes are usually grown. She and her husband work hard and always have high-quality products, which are sold to local retailers. 


As the income is only seasonal, the earning is not sufficient to maintain their lifestyle and the expenses of their children's education. Nilufa needs to expand her existing business to give additional financial support to her family. So, she has applied for the loan from BJS to buy potato seeds and fertilizers.


She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her children, have a better education and a better future. Both the husband and wife desire to buy a cycle van in the future for their own use and rent it for another means of income.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for growing potatoes.

loans.name: Ruthiana

texts.en:
Ruthiana is a widow with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a juice selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase variety of fruits for the sale of juice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase variety of fruits for the sale of juice.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es: Zenaida es una mujer de 46 años, está casada con Mario y tiene 3 hijos pero solo vive con uno de ellos en su casa construida a base de adobe. Estuvo siempre ligada a las actividades agropecuarias y la producción de cacao orgánico porque  desde niña creció junto a sus padres brindando apoyo en actividades menores. Con el paso de los años y al alcanzar la mayoría de edad heredo un terreno al comprometerse con Mario e iniciar a  trabajar con la motivación que la caracterizaba para a futuro forjar un mejor bienestar para su familia. Su labor principalmente consiste en mantener sus plantaciones de cacao orgánico a base de una serie de tareas para optimizar su producción final. Parte desde reemplazar plantaciones antiguas a través de una técnica denominada injerto hasta aplicar abono orgánico que ayuda a brindar mejores nutrientes reflejados en las mazorcas que finalmente son expendidos a los acopiadores del lugar. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está oportunidad desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en: Zenaida is a 46 year old woman. She is married to Mario and has 3 children, but she only lives with one of them in a house built from adobe. She has always been associated with agricultural and livestock and growing organic cacao because as a child she grew up at her parents' side helping in the smaller tasks. As the years passed by and when she became an adult she inherited some land when she got engaged to Mario and she started to work that would characterize her in the future as she forges more wellbeing for her family. Her main work is mostly maintaining her organic cacao plants with a series of tasks to optimize her final production. This ranges from replacing old plants with a technique called grafting to applying organic fertilizer that helps give better nutrients reflected in the pods that are finally sent to the area collectors. This is her fourth Kiva loan and she feels grateful for the financial support  she is receiving to get ahead. She is also committed to make her payments on time. At this time,she wants to have 1,000 nuevos soles to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Mamata

texts.en:
Mamata is a 43-year-old housewife of Tekatuli village, Dhupguri, Jalpaiguri District. She is married to Gurudas, and they have four children (one son and three daughters). They (Mamata and Gurudas) have received secondary education. They send their children to school. 


Mamata’s husband works in a garage. Unfortunately, his income is not enough to raise four children. Financially, she wants to give support to her husband and family. Mamata desires to start their own business, so she wants to cultivate potatoes on her own land and sell those potatoes in the local market. She has given preference to this business, as potato cultivation is a very profitable job in her area. She wishes to take the loan to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer. 


She has a semi-pakka house (house made of brick walls and a straw roof). In the future, Mamata wants to make her house concrete with the profits from her business, so she can live happily with her family. 


She dreams her children will lead a very successful life with a good education. She sincerely thanks Kiva and BJS for the support.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer for cultivation of potatoes.

loans.name: Aram

texts.en:
Aram is 44 years old and he lives in Stepanavan city which is in Lori region. He is married and he has a son and a daughter. His son is a contract serviceman and his daughter studies at the Yerevan State University, the paid division of International Relations’ faculty. Aram greatly values education and all his life he dreamed that his children will have higher education and become good specialists. So having a small salary makes him to worry since now he is not able to pay for his daughter’s education.

He asks a loan of 480,000 Armenian drams in order to pay for his daughter's tuition fee for the whole year.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's tuition fee for the whole year

loans.name: Mbinya

texts.en:
Mbinya does farming in Kangundo where she plants cash crops and keeps livestock. She is 43-years-old, married and together with her spouse, who also provides additional income, they have been blessed with seven children.

She plans to use this loan amount to buy fertilizer, manure, seedling and feed for her cattle. She will use the generated profits to educate her children as well as repay her loan. 

In the future she hopes to improve her farming business by having more dairy cattle and also to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, seedling and feed for her cattle.

loans.name: Eunices

texts.en:
Eunices lives in Mombasa Kenya. She is 22 years old and she deals in second hand clothes. She has been in the business for the last year and the business has been growing. She started the business from the savings that she had made. She has ambitions that in the next five years she will be running a wholesale business dealing with second hand clothes. She also hopes that in time she will grow the business to other places and sell to more people. 

She knew Milango through friends who asked her to join so that she can save and be able to access funding for her business and she joined. She now asks for a loan to buy bales of second hand clothes for sale in the business. She will use the extra income that she will raise to improve her business and improve her standards of living as well.

loans.use: to buy bales of second hand clothes for resale

loans.name: Wilber

texts.es: El Señor  Wilber  tiene 20, él se dedica a la venta de a la reparación de autos el es chapista, tiene su taller en la localidad de El Torno,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Señor  Wilber  va a usar este préstamo para compra de una motocicleta su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la necesidad de poder movilizarse ya que será de gran ayuda cuando quiera transportarsea lugares leganos, por que también realiza el trabajo aq domicilios según pida el cliente,  el Señor  Wilber    enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su negocio y calidad de vida  de su familia y va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar pinturas para la realización de su trabajo, el  Señor  Wilber  es una persona con ganas de seguir adelante se siente feliz por esta oportunidad que le brindan para mejorar su negocio y por ende sus ingresos económicos
texts.en: Wilber is 20 years old. He works in auto repair. He does bodywork. His workshop is located in El Torno. This loan is his first cycle in the institution. Wilber is going to use this loan to buy a motorcycle. The reason for asking for the loan is he needs transportation. This will be a big help when he wants to get to places that are far away, because he also does house calls when the customers ask him to. Wilber faces challenges in his business, such as improving his business and his family's quality of life. He is going to use the profits to buy paint to do his job. Wilber is someone who want to get ahead and he is happy with the opportunity to improve his business and therefore his income.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Minati

texts.en:
Minati, age 37, is a courageous lady from the village of Maynaguri with one son. She lost her husband in an accident. Minati studied up to class VIII (grade 8). She sends her son to school. She wants her son to lead a very successful life with a good education.

It was difficult for Minati to manage the minimum expenses of the day-to-day livelihood of her family and son. Then she decided to start her own grocery shop, but due to lack of funds, it was very difficult for her to continue this business. She does not have sufficient stock in her grocery shop.  Then she heard about BJS and decided to take a loan to purchase various groceries for her grocery shop. In her locality, the demand for her groceries is very high as her shop is the only one there.

In the future, she dreams of extending her business and giving a good education to her son.

The small loan has brought a significant positive change in her life and lifted her family out of extreme poverty. She has proved that it is not that difficult to see the light by overcoming the hurdles if financial assistance is added to one’s industry.

loans.use: To buy grocery items to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en: Zahra is a 52-year-old Lebanese widowed woman living with her four children. After her husband’s death, the tragedy, Zahra took the responsibility of taking care of her children and providing them with good living standards. So she started to work as a tailor since 2008 and has her own shop where she performs her task efficiently to always satisfy her customers. And today, Zahra is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase tailoring tools such as needles, bottoms, and textiles. In that way, she will improve her operation by serving more customers and therefore will earn higher income, thus will enhance her family’s way of living.

loans.use: to purchase tailoring tools such as needles, bottoms and textiles

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man with three children. He is aged 42 years and deals in coffee selling and trade. He applied for a loan of 1,200,000 UGX to buy manure and fertilizers for his coffee plantation. He hopes to harvest 50 bags of coffee every season after applying the fertilizers. His major challenge is lack of good prices for his coffee and harsh climatic conditions which affect his coffee plantation.

David is a very honest and hard working man.

loans.use: to buy organic manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Felecia

texts.en: Felecia is 33-years-old and is a wife and mother of two. Both of her children attend school. She lives in Kongowea together with her family.  She owns a retail shop in Kongowea that she has been running for the last four years. She sells commodities like detergents, food stuff and cooking oil. This business is the only thing that she does for an income.  She has ambitions that in the next five years the business will grow into a wholesale one and she will move from retail to supplying.  She knew Milango through friends who asked her to join them so that they could save and be able to access funding to expand their businesses. She now seeks a loan to buy food stuff, detergents and cooking oil for her business.  She will use the extra income that she will raise to improve her family income and also expand her business.

loans.use: to buy food stuff, detergents and cooking oil for her retail shop.

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en: Zahra is a 34-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three children who are attending school. Her husband works as a carpenter and she cooperates financially with him thanks to her income that she earns by working at producing homemade food. Her products are sold to customers from her community and she is well known for her tasty and delicious food. At present, Zahra is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase bottles and jars with the aim of well preserving food and keep them in good conditions. In the future, Zahra plans to open a proper store where she will continue to work with high enthusiasm.

loans.use: to purchase bottles and jars

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet lives in the Kongowea area north of Mombasa, Kenya. She is 29 years old, married and blessed with one child. Her child in still young and has not joined school yet

She runs a business in Kongowea market and her business has been there for the last two months. She sells second hand clothes at the market. She has great ambitions for her business in the coming years and she hopes that it will grow to the point of opening a boutique despite the usual challenges of price changes and inflation

She learned about Milango through friends and now she seeks a loan to buy bales of second hand clothes to sell. The income that she will raise will improve her standard of living and give her children in the future a better life.

loans.use: to buy bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Oscar De Jesus

texts.es: Oscar es un hombre de 31 años de edad quien se dedica a la venta de pan francés y pan dulce de manera ambulante. Él es muy emprendedor y siempre está pendiente de brindar el mejor producto a los mejores precios para poder ser uno de los preferidos dentro de su comunidad. Oscar habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su compañera de vida y su pequeño hijo de dos años de edad. Con el fin de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en su negocio en la compra de pan dulce y francés y además desea comprar otra bicicleta de carga para facilitar el trabajo. Espera poder contar con el apoyo lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Oscar is a 31-year-old man who makes a living by selling French bread and sweet bread on foot. He is very entrepreneurial and always focused on bringing the best possible product at the best prices so that he can be the preferred vendor is his community. 

Oscar lives in his own home with his life partner and their 2-year-old son. He has requested this loan from FUSAI with the goal of improving his and his family's quality of life. He will invest it by purchasing sweet bread and French bread. He would also like to purchase another cargo bicycle to make his job easier. 

He hopes to have this support as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase sweet bread, French bread, and a cargo bicycle.

loans.name: Kholmurzo

texts.ru: Холмурзо родился в 1963 года. Он женат и имеет 4 детей. Двое из его детей совершеннолетние, а двое еще несовершеннолетние. Холмурзо занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур как морковь, лук, помидор и т.п. Холмирзо имеет проблему с поливанием земли. Он старается решить эту проблему. Холмурзо трудится упорно с раннего утра до позднего вечера. Его жена помогает ему введению бизнеса. Он имеет автомашину марки Опель, которую использует для развития своего бизнеса. Холмурзо должен сделать осенний посев, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 долларов США для покупки семена и минерального удобрения. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Kholmurzo was born in 1963.  He is married and has four children, two of whom are fully grown.  Kholmurzo cultivates various vegetables such as carrots, onions and tomatoes.  Kholmurzo has trouble with irrigation, which he is attempting to solve.  Kholmurzo works very hard from sunrise to late evening.  His wife is helping him with running the business.  He has a car, which he uses in his business activities.  

Kholmurzo needs to sow his fall crops, but he does not have the money to do so.  He is asking for a loan for 3,000 dollars (USD) to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.  He is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: After graduating from junior high school, Gladys decided to set up her own onion business at Abaka Nkwanta in Twifo Praso. With over six years worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her business further. Unfortunately, Gladys is limited due to a lack of funds. As a result, this loan will be used to help her to purchase more onions for resale. Gladys aims at using the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a farmer) with the upkeep of their house while ensuring that their two children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more onions for resale

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en: After graduating from middle school, Augustina decided to set up her own food business.  She prepares and sells waakye (waakye is a traditional Ghanaian dish made primarily from beans, rice and colored leaves).  She prepares her ‘waakye’ on her own and proceeds to sell it at Abaka Nkwanta in Twifo Praso.  With over eight years worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further.  Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding.  As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more rice, beans, cooking oil and other ingredients, thus enabling her to prepare and sell more of her tasty ‘waakye’. She aims at using the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a farmer) with the upkeep of their house while ensuring that their five children remain in school.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, beans, cooking oil and other ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Even though Adwoa grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for herself and her family.

Currently, she sells cooking items and provisions at Baka Nkwanta in Twifo Praso, which is located in the central region. Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began 15 years ago.

Adwoa is married and has seven children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Adwoa wants to use her loan to buy more vegetables, foodstuffs, and other items, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of cooking items and provisions (canned fish, tinned tomatoes, powdered pepper, salt, etc).

In the long term, she plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demand.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables, foodstuffs, and other items

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Doña Dominga de 40 años de edad es una señora muy emprendedora tanto en su familia como en los diferentes trabajos de campo que junto a su compañero de hogar realiza. Ella es madre de 4 hijos los dos mayores colaboran con sus padres en las actividades de campo y los dos menores estudian en la primaria en una escuela de la comunidad. Ella tiene un grado educativo primaria incompleta la cual pudo cursar hasta el 4 grado y por la falta de apoyo económico por parte de sus padres ella no pudo culminar sus estudios ya que son de escasos recursos económicos. Diariamente en compañía de sus conyugue trabajan duro para poder salir adelante y se trasladan hasta sus cultivos de café los cuales están ubicados a un kilómetro desde su casa de habitación al cual se van caminando. 
Ella solicita financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de insumos agrícolas ya que con este producto ella podrá asistir sus cultivos de café, protegiéndolos de plagas e insectos los cuales deterioran el grano como la broca.
Sus metas son poder mejorar sus cultivos mediante esta compra de fertilizantes y poder dar asistencia necesaria para poder obtener una excelente cosecha al final de la temporada ya que esto vendrá a mejorar sus ingresos y poder seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Dominga is 40 years old. She is described as a very energetic person, who is as dedicated to her family as she is to the work she does in the fields with her husband. Dominga is the mother of four children. The two oldest help her and her husband with the work in the fields, and her two youngest attend an elementary school in the community. Dominga has a fourth grade education. She was not able to finish school because her parents did not have enough money. Dominga works hard every day with her husband to get ahead. Their coffee crops, which are reached on foot, are one kilometer from their home.

Dominga is requesting this loan from the field partner to buy agricultural supplies to maintain her coffee crop and protect it from infestations and insects that can damage the berry, such as the coffee borer beetle. Dominga says that her goal is to improve her crop by buying fertilizer and performing necessary maintenance to obtain an excellent harvest at the end of the season. She says that this will improve her income, which will allow her to keep paying for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to maintain her coffee crop.

loans.name: Asel

texts.ru: Асел 31 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Асел - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Асел занимается животноводством, стартовав 10 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Асел, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 теленок, 1 ослик, 5 коз, 5 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). Асел входит в группу "Тахмина", в эту группу входят еще 2 человека. Асел является вторым членом группы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Асел обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 10,000 сом (KGS) на покупку теленка для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Асел планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Asel is 31 years old, married and, together with her husband, is raising two children.  Asel has a high school education.  Her main source of income is raising of livestock, a business that she started 10 years ago by purchasing cattle for 5,000 som KGS.  Thanks to her hard work, Asel now has one miking cow, one calf, five goats and five sheep.  Her monthly income is 5,000 som (KGS).  Asel is part of a group called "Tahmina", which has two additional people in it.  In order to grow her business, Asel turned to the microfinance bank of Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 10,000 som (KGS) to purchase a calf.  Profits from her business, Asel is planning to use for the expansion of her herd.

loans.use: to buy a calf

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is 44 years old and she is the divorced mother of two children. Both of her children attend school. She is in business and it's her business that has been supporting her family.

She sells potatoes at the local market and she has done this business for three years now. She has the ambition to grow the business to a level where she will be operating with a capital of more than KES 50,000.00. The challenges that she faces in the business include price changes in the market and seasonal markets that are not stable. 

She knew Milango through friends and now she seeks a loan to buy three bags of potatoes for her business. The income that she will raise will improve her income level and also pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy three bags of potatoes

loans.name: Koo

texts.en:
Koo lives in Sanniquelle, the capital City of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources. Living conditions there are much better than in the capital city of Liberia, and it is the county with the second largest population in Liberia. 

Koo is 40 years old. She did not go to school, and she is married, with five children between 6 and 19 years old. With a little money from her older husband who is a farmer, she was able to start this business by selling G.B.  (dough made of cassava) and soup from a cook shop. She spends nine hours each day on her business, from Monday to Saturday, 

One problem she faces is the small income from the business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cassava, salt, meat, fish, pepper, onion, etc., for her business. Her plan is one day to build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava, salt, meat, fish, pepper, onion, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Toatniso

texts.ru: Тоатнисо трудолюбивая женщина. Она вдова и воспитывает 2 детей. Ее дети рано стали сиротами и поэтому Тоатнисо всегда старалась, чтобы ее дети не почувствовали, что они растут без отца. Тоатнисо работает в заводе по производству кирпича. Она работает более 5 лет. Хотя у нее тяжелая работа, но она держится сильно и старается заработать больше денег. Ее сын учится в университете. Тоатнисо должна оплатить за учебный договор своего сына. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 сомони для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Toatniso is a hardworking woman.  She is a widow who is raising two children.  Her kids became fatherless early on, and Toatniso had always tried to make sure that they do not feel alone growing up.  Toatniso works at a factory that makes bricks.  She has been working there for more than 5 years.  Even though the work is very hard, she continues to work long hours and to make as much money as possible.  

Her son is attending a university, and Toatniso needs to pay for his tuition.  She is asking for a loan of 2500 somoni to pay for her son's university education.  She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for the education of her son

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam appreciates the previous loan that improved her living standards and enabled her save money for her business.  She is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES to purchase utensils and a greater stock of food ingredients to boost her business.  She joined Yehu to obtain financial support.

loans.use: to purchase utensils and add a greater stock of food ingredients to boost her business.

loans.name: Mariana Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Mariana es originaria de la ciudad de Rivas, madre de cinco hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulperia, el cual le ha generado ingresos para su hogar. Esta agradecida con Kiva y Micrédito ya que logro crecer su negocio y ofrecer una variedad de productos. Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar granos básicos como: arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar entre otros, con el fin de brindar un alto nivel de productos variado y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que incrementara sus ventas y obtendrá mejores ganancias permitiéndole una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Mariana is a native of the city of Rivas. She's the mother of five children. A merchant by trade, she runs a small grocery store, which has generated an income for her household. She is grateful for Kiva and MiCredito because she managed to grow her business and carry a variety of products. She is applying for this new loan to buy rice, beans, oil, and sugar, among other things, in order to offer a high level of product variety and meet customer demand. She estimates that the loan will be a great help since it will increase her sales and income, affording her a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, and sugar, among other things.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia lives in Likoni area, which is south of Mombasa, Kenya. She is 42 years old and married with two teenage children under her care.

She has been operating a grocery store for the last four years and the business has been doing fine. She hopes that in the next five years, she will grow the business and become a supplier in her town. She deals with green vegetables and fruits in her store. The challenges that she has been facing include price changes and the lack of capital for the business.

She learned about Milango through friends who asked her to join so that she would be able to save and access credit to fund her business. She now seeks a loan to buy kale, spinach and tomatoes to sell in her grocery. She will use the income that she will raise to improve her standard of living and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy kale, spinach and tomatoes

loans.name: Tonker

texts.en:
Here is Tonker from Liberia.  Precisely she lives in Sanniquelle, the capital of Nimba County, which is rich in nature resources. Living conditions are much better than in Monrovia, the capital of Liberia.  It is the second largest populated county in Liberia. 

Tonke is 44 years of age, She did not attend school.  She is a widow with four children. Only the youngest, who is 19, lives at home.  

Tonker started her business with money from her oldest son, who is a farmer. She sells for nine hours each day, from Monday to Saturday.  One problem she faces is little capital. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more soap and oil for her business. Her plan is to one day move from table to shop.

loans.use: to purchase more soap and oil for her business.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jeniffer is a poultry farmer in Nyakahandagazi cell in Mitooma district. She started poultry farming with the motive of getting a steady source of income which would help her to provide for her family. She started the business in 2006 and she works six days per week on the poultry farm . Her clients are mainly hotel and supermarket owners plus the local people. 

She has applied for a loan of 2,500,000 UGX to buy feed for the chickens. Her main challenge is competition which leads to price cuts which cause her losses sometimes. With her hard work, if the loan is given she hopes to become financially stable in the future and her family will have the best of the best.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed

loans.name: Kou

texts.en:
46-year-old Kou lives in Sanniquelle, the capitol city of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources. Living conditions there are much better than in the capital city of Liberia, and it is the county with the second largest population  in Liberia. 

Kou did not go to school. She is married to a farmer, and they have nine children. With a little money from her husband, she was able to start this business. She sells from Monday to Saturday, five hours per day. 

One problem she faces is small income; she is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, salt, meat, fish, onion, etc., for her business. Her plan is one day to build a decent restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, salt, meat, fish, onions, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Munyazi

texts.en:
Munyazi is married and has four children, all of whom are adults.  She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Munyazi has operated a fish selling business for the last ten years, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersbys. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the 40,000 KES loan she wants to purchase fish, cooking oil, and firewood for her business.  She decided to join Yehu to acquire financial services for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish, cooking oil, and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Please to meet 23-year-old Victoria, who lives in Sanniquille, the capital of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources, and living conditions are much better than in Monrovia, the capital city.  It is the second largest populated county in Liberia. 

Victoria completed the 12th grade before establishing her business.  She has lived all her life in rural areas.  She is unmarried, and her boyfriend is a policeman.  They  have three children between 2 and 6 years old; the older two are in school, and they all live at home. 

From 1997 she has been running a table where she sells oil, pepper, and salt in the local market. She spends nine hours each day on her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, pepper, and salt for her business. 

Her plan is to build a modern house.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, pepper, and salt for her business.

loans.name: Yourh

texts.en:
Yourh is a 43 year old business woman who lives in Sanniquellie, the capital city of Nimba county, which is rich in natural resources. The living conditions in Sanniquellie are much better than the capital city (Monrovia), and is the second largest populate county in Liberia.  She has only completed her education through the 3rd grade, but has none the less established her business.  Yourh is a widow with ten children aged 8 to 22, with only three in school and living at home.  

For two years she has been running a local restaurant in the local market.  She spends ten hours each day on her business.  One problem she faces includes small income.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, palm oil, onion, fish, meat, pepper, etc. for her business.  Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, palm oil, onion, fish, meat, pepper, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is 28 years old and lives in Sanniquille, capital of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources, and living conditions are much better than in Monrovia, the capital of Liberia. It is the second largest populated county in Liberia. 

Cynthia is a college graduate. She and her fiancé are living together with two children, ages 2 and 13, who are in school and live at home. 

She got a little money from her fiancé to establish her table business six years ago, where she sells sardines, mayonnaise, toothpaste, etc. She spends 10 hours each day on her business, from Monday to Saturday. She faces no major problem except small income. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more sardines, mayonnaise, toothpaste, etc., for her business. Her plan is to one day build a modern house. 

She appreciates the lenders of Kiva for supporting BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more sardine, mayonnaise, toothpaste, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Karina Beatriz

texts.es: Karina de 26 años de edad es madre soltera de tres niñas de 8 años, 4 años y 1 año de edad. Habita en casa alquilada ya que no ha podido hacerse de su casa por falta de ingresos suficientes. Su deseo es mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia por lo que trabaja duramente para llevar el sustento diario. Karina se dedica a la venta de ropa y antojitos típicos como yuca frita pastelitos de carne, etc. Este negocio lo tiene desde hace mucho tiempo y es así como se gana la vida. Desea hacer crecer su negocio para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de variedad de prendas de vestir (faldas, blusas, pantalones, ropa interior, etc.), yuca, carne, verduras, etc. de esta forma espera poder mejorar sus ingresos y sucesivamente su calidad de vida y la de sus hijas.
texts.en: Karina, who's twenty-six years old, is a single mother of three young girls, aged one, four, and eight years old. She rents a house since she has not been able to buy her own home due to a lack of income. Her wish is to improve her and her family's living conditions; therefore, she works hard to earn a livelihood. Karina sells clothing and typical snacks, such as fried cassava, meat pies, and so on. She has had this business for a long time and it's how she makes a living. She wants to grow her business, and for this reason, she is applying for a loan from FUSAI to buy a variety of clothing articles (skirts, blouses, pants, underwear) as well as cassava, meat, and vegetables. In this manner, she hopes to improve her income, and in turn, her and her daughters' quality of life.

loans.use: to buy skirts, blouses, pants, underwear, cassava, meat, vegetables, and so on.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a married woman with three children, all of whom are adults.  She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food.

For the past four years she has operated a clothes selling business selling second hand clothes and 'Khangas' (female clothing wraps). She cites stiff competition as her major challenge in the business. 

Kwekwe is requesting for 40,000 KES to purchase bales of clothes and 20 pieces of female clothing wraps for resale.  She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes and 20 pieces of female clothing wraps for resale.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is very grateful for her previous Kiva loan, which enabled her to boost her fish selling business. She was able to improve her living standards.

She is requesting for a loan of 40,000 KES to purchase more fish, cooking oil and firewood for her business. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish, cooking oil and firewood for her business

loans.name: Serena

texts.en:
Serena is 23 years old, and she lives in Sanniquellie, the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in nature resources and is the second most populated county in Liberia. Living conditions are much better than in the capital city of Liberia. Serena stopped her education in the 5th grade, and has three children between 1 and 6, who are in school and live at home. 

With a little money from her mother Serena was able to establish her business. Since 2010 she has been running a small local shop where she sells batteries, matches, salt, etc. She spends 9 hours each day on her business, from Monday to Saturday. One problem she faces is a small income. She is requesting a loan to purchase more stock for her business. Her plan is one day to build a modern house.

loans.use: to purchase more batteries, matches, salt, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Blanca Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Blanca, se Desempeña como subdirectora de un centro de educación primaria, en un pequeño colegio del municipio, dedicándose a esa labor desde hace 30 años, es Casada con 4 hijos solo 1 a su cargo y una nieta,  a los que tiene que proporcionarle las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo.
Una de las necesidades que la  señora  Blanca  atraviesa, es la necesidad de Comprar  repuestos para automóvil Kia  tales como: llantas, batería, amortiguadores, disco de freno de la patente, punta de flecha delantera, aspírales delanteros y traseros, patentes delanteras, disco de cloche, plato de presión, balinera de collarín, tapizado de asientos, y balineras delanteras para apoyar a su marido en una unidad de taxi, por lo que ha tomado la decisión de acudir a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de lo antes mencionado, y de esa manera mejorar sus condiciones y nivel  de vida.
texts.en:
Señora Blanca works as the deputy director at a primary education center in a little city school. She has been doing this job for 30 years. She is married and has four children, but now she is responsible for only one child and a granddaughter, to whom she has to provide the necessary conditions for their development.

One of the necessities that Señora Blanca is experiencing is the need to buy repair parts for her Kia automobile, such as tires, a battery, shock absorbers, patent brake discs, front CV joints, front and rear springs, clutch pad, clutch pressure plate, collar bearings, upholstery for seats, and rear ball bearings to help her husband with his taxi. For this reason, she made the decision to turn to Ceprodel to apply for a loan to purchase the items mentioned, and in this way improve her conditions and level of living.

loans.use: to buy repair parts for her Kia automobile, such as tires, a battery, shock absorbers, patent brake discs, front CV joints, front and rear springs, clutch pad, clutch pressure plate, collar bearings, upholstery for seats, and rear ball bearings

loans.name: Guillermo De Jesus

texts.es: Guillermo de 47 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su querida esposa. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado poner una panadería en su lugar de residencia, dicho negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos y es el que le permite llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. Con el fin de mejorar su negocio solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de insumos tales como harina de pan, azúcar, levadura, sal, etc. para preparar el pan y tener mayor disponibilidad de venta y así poder mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Guillermo, age 47, lives in his own house together with his beloved wife. With a lot of effort he has managed to put a bakery in his home. This business is his main source of income, and it is what allows him to bring bread home every day. In order to improve his business Guillermo requests this loan from FUSAI to invest in purchasing supplies like bread flour, sugar, yeast, salt, etc. to make the bread and have more available for sale, and to be able to increase his profits.

loans.use: to buy bread flour, sugar, yeast, salt, etc.

loans.name: Baloon Group

texts.en:
Ashura, who is in her late thirties, is single, with a boy and a girl who are in school. 

For five years now, Ashura has been running three small businesses: a retail shop selling different items like match boxes, juices, and airtime and a "genge," a food cart, selling fruits and vegetables. She also runs a motorbike business for transportation. Ashura works from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. per working day and is able to make a good profit. 

This will be her fifth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to buy retail stocks and fruits and vegetables to resell. 

With the previous loans, all paid back in full, she opened her retail shop business and bought fruits and vegetables for her cart. 

Ashura used her profit to cover her kids' school fees, pay food expenses, and reinvest back in her business. She dreams of owning a three-wheel motorbike for business.
 
Ashura will share this loan with her loan group "BALOON," which totals six members. The members of the group hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy stock for her retail shop and food cart.

loans.name: Sombo

texts.en:
Sombo is a married man with four children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past five years, he has operated a retail shop, selling to his neighbours and passersby. He mentioned seasonality and theft as his major challenges. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. He also operates a motorcycle business.

With the 20,000 KES he wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es: Agustina tiene 60 años, es viuda y tiene dos hijos que viven con ella en su casa hecha a base de material noble. Desde muy joven vivió ligada a las actividades agrícolas de cacao orgánico y otros  ya que sus padres también se dedicaron toda una vida a este honrado oficio.Se inicio de manera independiente gracias a unos terrenos que sus padres le cedieron y en donde empezó a labrarlo con el firme apoyo de su difunto esposo hasta convertirlo en el principal sustento económico de sus hijos. Lo agradable de su trabajo es saber que siempre el resultado de su producción es fructífero  puesto que cuenta con terrenos muy fértiles. No obstante en ocasiones tiene que enfrentarse a plagas y enfermedades que perjudican considerablemente su producción. Suele contratar a trabajadores del lugar para realizar tareas complicadas como el retiro de maleza y agilizar la cosecha de sus productos. Con el objetivo de mejorar sus ingresos acude al uso de abono orgánico y otros derivados naturales ya que mejoran la calidad de sus frutos como es volumen y aroma. Este es su tercer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
