En esta oportunidad desea contar con 500 nuevos soles para contratar a trabajadores del lugar.
texts.en:
Agustina is 60 years old. She is a widow and has two children who live with her in her house made from excellent materials. Since she was very young, her life was tied to agricultural activities of organic cacao and others, since her parents also dedicated their lives to this honorable work.

She began working independently thanks to some land that her parents gave to her and which she began to cultivate with the steady support of her late husband, until it became the main economic support for her children. The nice thing about her work is always knowing that the result of her production is fruitful, as she has very fertile land.

Nevertheless, she occasionally has to confront pests and diseases that threaten her production considerably. She usually hires workers from the area to do complicated tasks like removing weeds to improve the harvest of her products. With the goal of bettering her earnings, she is turning to the use of organic fertilizer and other natural derivatives, because they improve the quality of her fruit in volume and aroma.

This is her third loan with Kiva, and she feels grateful for the financial support that she receives in order to get ahead. In addition, she is committed to paying off her quotas punctually. With this opportunity, she hopes to have 500 nuevos soles to hire workers from the area.

loans.use: to hire workers from the area.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime tiene 42 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Cayalti , su población se dedica al cultivo de arroz, caña, y frutales, comercio y ganadería, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposa se dedican a la venta de animales menores patos, cuyes, pavos, su negocio está ubicado en el mercado de la zona.

El ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para comprar alimentos balanceados y así tener una mejor producción y una segunda parte para compra de cerdos y de esta manera tener mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Jaime is 42 years old and lives with his wife in the District of Cayalti. His town is known for cultivating rice, sugar, and fruit, as well as for trade and livestock breeding. This community is two hours away from the city of Chiclayo, which is on the northern coast of Peru.

Jaime and his wife sell small animals such as ducks, guinea pigs, and turkeys. His business is located at the district market. He is requesting a loan of 1,500 PEN so that he can buy balanced feed in order to have better production. Part of the money will also be used to buy pigs so that he can generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy balanced animal feed and pigs to sell.

loans.name: Bouramanding's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe  est créé le 25 Août 2011 jour de son inauguration. Il est composé de  femmes qui toutes issues du même village, elles sont très solidaires entre elles et s’entre aident dans leurs activités. Actuellement à son cinquième cycle la majorité des membres ont vu leurs activités prospérées et ont  senti une amélioration de leur condition d’existence.

Madame Bouramanding (debout à l’extrême droite), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 43 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants (03 garçons et 04 filles), elle s’active dans la vente de fruits (banane, mangue, pastèque) et de produits de la cueillette (citron pour en faire des jus après pressage qu’elle vend par bouteille d’un litre).

Ce nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter des sacs de citron auprès des villageois et de payer les frais d’acheminement de sa récolte de pastèque au marché régional.

Les bénéfices lui permettront  d’appuyer son mari dans la prise charges de la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
This group was created on their inauguration day of August 25, 2011. It is composed of women who all come from the same village. They are very supportive of each other and help one another in their small businesses. Currently on its fifth loan cycle, the majority of group members have seen their businesses prosper and have felt an improvement in their daily living conditions.

Bouramanding (shown standing on the far right) is the featured borrower for the group. She is 43 years old, married, and the mother of seven children (three boys and four girls). She runs a small business selling fruits (bananas, mangoes, watermelons) and wild plant foods (lemons, which she presses to  make juice and then sells in one liter bottles).

This new loan will enable her to buy bags of lemons from other villagers and to pay for the delivery costs of her watermelon crop to the regional market. The income she earns will allow her to support her husband in paying for the education fees of their children.

loans.use: to buy bags of lemons from other villagers and to pay for the delivery costs of her watermelon crop to the regional market.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana María es una joven estudiante de medicina, ella solicita un préstamo para poder pagar sus estudios, esta es su historia: Soy Ana María, tengo 20 años de edad, soletera  sin hijos, vivo en la ciudad de la Vega  donde nací y me crie en Constanza, soy la menor de tres hermanos. Mi madre es ama de casa y mi padre es vendedor de huevos en mi ciudad natal. 

Empecé a estudiar la carrera  de Medicina en la Universidad Católica Tecnológica del Cibao (UCATECI). Ya que me gusta y me identifico mucho con ella, el tratar seres humanos, poder ayudarlos es lo que me apasiona. La necesidad de este préstamo es para poder terminar mi carrera. Si no recibiera el préstamo tendría que parar los estudios hasta que haya otra posibilidad de pagarlos con las probabilidades de suspenderlo. Si recibo el préstamo tengo la oportunidad de terminar la carrera y en menos tiempo. Así poder contar con un futuro mejor para mi  familia y la Sociedad. 

Deseo graduarme con buenas calificaciones y conocimiento, proveer a  mi familia una mejor calidad de vida, tener un buen empleo en el área de la salud.  Luego especializarme en el área de Cirugía General.
texts.en:
Ana María is a young student of medicine. She is asking for a loan to be able to pay for her studies. This is her story: I am Ana María. I am 20 years old, single and have no children. I live in the city of la Vega where I was born I was raised in Constanza. I am the youngest of three children. My mother is a housewife and my father sells eggs in my native city.

I started to study medicine at the Universidad Católica Tecnológica del Cibao (UCATECI). I enjoy it and can identify with it a lot. Treating human beings, to be able to help them inspires me.

I need the loan in order to be able to finish my studies. If I don't get the loan I will have to discontinue my studies until I find some other way to pay my fees with the possibility of not ever finishing. If I get the loan then I'll have the opportunity to quickly finish my studies.

Then I would be assured of a better future for my family and for society. I want to graduate with good grades and recognition, provide my family with a better quality of living and find good employment in the health field. Later I will specialize in General Surgery.

loans.use: to pay tuition for her medical studies.

loans.name: Patrica

texts.en: Patrica is 45 years old, and she lives in Sanniquelle. It is the capital city of Nimba County which is rich in natural resources. Living conditions in Nimba are much better than the capital city of Liberia, and it is the second most populous county in Liberia. She is a widow with three children and her children are between the ages of 19 and 28. She said that they are in school, and they all live at home. Patrica received a small amount of money from her mother to establish her business 15 years ago. She spends 10 hours each day at her business, from Monday to Saturday. A problem she faces is small income. She will use this loan to purchase more rice, oil, peppers, onions, etc. for her business. Her plan is to one day build a modern house. She thanks the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, peppers, onions, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es:
Isidora junto a un grupo de personas de la misma comunidad decidieron cuidar la tierra y los animales, para obtener quesos ecológicos, con un alto contenido nutritivo en calcio, proteinas y fósforo. A la vez se contrarestará los problemas nutricionales de la leche que tienen un alto contenido en grasas saturadas, en triglicéridos y ácido graso saturado. El primer paso que dió fue no atar a las vacas, ni mantenerlas encerradas lejos de los pastisales en los que les gusta pastar, tampoco cortarles los cuernos, para que, éstas den terneras de forma natural y el alimento que proporcionen sea fresco y de gran calidad. 

Ella vive en casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Achica Baja, del Sector Viacha de la provincia Ingavi, del Departamento de La Paz, aproximadamente a dos horas de viaje desde la ciudad de La Paz.

Isidora solicita el préstamo para comprar un par de vacas lecheras de raza mejorada para obtener leche de mejor calidad y producir queso ecológico en mayor cantidad.

El sueño de Isidora es crecer y a mediano plazo, contar con su propia granja ecológica, la cual sea autosostenible y principalmente con BIODIGESTORES y BIOGAS, para lo cual se requiere de ganado que proporcione al menos 12 kilos de estiercol diario, que mezclados con 60 litros de agua, proporcionarán Metano por 4 horas diarias, evitando así la emanación de dióxido de carbono (CO2), para el cuidado del medio ambiente.

Es la tercera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Isidora is part of a group in her community that decided to take care of the land and the animals. She produces organic cheeses, which have a high nutrition content that includes calcium, protein, and phosphorus. At the same time, they lack the nutritional problems usually associated with cheese such as high levels of saturated fats, triglycerides, and saturated fatty acids. The first step that she took was not to keep the cows locked up or enclosed far away from the pastures where they like to graze. In addition, she does not cut off the horns since the calves were born that way. The food she gives them is fresh and of high quality.

Isidora lives in her home in the community of Achica Baja, which is in the Viacha sector of Ingavi Province in the Department of La Paz. It is approximately a two-hour trip from the city of La Paz. Her loan will be used to buy a pair of dairy cows of improved breed so that she can obtain milk of the best quality for producing large quantities of organic cheese.

Isodora’s dream is to grow and eventually have an organic farm of her own that is self-sustaining and operates with the use of bio-digesters and biogas. This equipment requires that her cows produce at least 12 kilos of manure per day, which is mixed with 60 liters of water. The mixture provides enough methane to last for four hours each day, which prevents the emission of carbon dioxide into the environment.

This is the third time Isidora has requested a loan from IMPRO, but the second time through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a pair of dairy cows.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité KUÑA GUAPA está en el 1er. ciclo 16 integrantes, al adquirir el crédito se les facilita herramientas fundamentales para el progreso de sus emprendimientos, ya que cada una tiene esperanzas de poder mejorar sus vidas y ayudar a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes la señora Maria, se dedica a la venta de comidas, el crédito que pide lo quiere invertir en la compra de los ingredientes para preparar las comidas que vende en un local que tiene para poder seguir mejorando y ganar prestigio y brindar satisfacción a sus clientes.
Las integrantes formaron un grupo bastante unido, con  la  plena convicción de trabajar todas juntas, apoyándose mutuamente.
texts.en:
The committee named “Kuña Guapa” is in its first loan cycle with 16 members. In order to acquire this loan, they were given the fundamental tools that they need to make progress in their businesses. All of them are hopeful that they will be able to improve their lives and help their families.

One of the members is Sra. Maria. She sells food and the loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of ingredients for preparing the dishes she sells at her shop. This will enable her to continue improving, gaining prestige, and satisfying her customers.

The members form a close-knit group and have the full conviction that they can all work together and provide mutual support for one another.

loans.use: to buy various ingredients for preparing the dishes that she sells.

loans.name: Ramlet Group

texts.en:
Alma is the featured borrower of the Ramlet Group. She joined with other group members who are neighbors and friends to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua. Alma is a 46-year-old married mother of three children for whom she sacrifices her whole life to provide them with the best living and education. Today Alma works serving coffee at a specific business. She works hard to send what she earns to her family back in the Philippines. Her loan will pay for her daughter's university tuition fees. She hopes that one day she can reunite with her family and establish her own business back home.

From left to right in the photo: Alma, Mila, and Yolanda

loans.use: to pay university tuition fees for her daughter in the Philippines.

loans.name: Savel

texts.en:
Savel is 22 years old and single. He lives with his parents and four other siblings in a rural village of Kampong Cham province. He recently graduated from a local high school of the province and aims to further his education at a college in Phnom Penh. He is interested in the accounting major because he realizes that it’s suitable for his personality. His education is subsidized by his parents who are farmers managing a 3-hectare farmland for rice cultivation.

Because of the economic limits of his family, Savel can’t afford to pay for his education fees and have enough funds to support his courses. He is seeking a loan of $2000 to cover the costs of the four-year academic program. 

Thanks to the all lenders around the world who contribute their funds to programs like Kiva via its partner, Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), to help a poor student like him further his education. 

This loan will be disbursed over a period of several years and paid directly to the educational institution at the time that enrollment fees are due for each academic year. Accordingly, there is the possibility of a small variation in loan amount and repayment terms, based on shifting class availability and prices. Kiva lenders will be notified with a journal update in the event of any future changes to the loan terms.

loans.use: to cover the costs of a four-year academic program.

loans.name: Mbogo Group

texts.en:
Fatuma, who is in her late 40s, is widow with a son and a daughter. Her son is in vocational school doing mechanics. For about fourteen years now, Fatuma has been managing her family by running a fish business where she buys fish from the ocean market and fries them at home to sell. She works from 5 a.m. to 9 p.m. each working day and is able to make a fair profit. 

This will be her eleventh loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans, all of which were paid back fully, she bought more fish and cooking oil to fry the fish. Fatuma's business profits are used to cover school fees and family food expenses. She will use this loan to buy 20 liters of cooking oil and more fish. She dreams to build a house and expand much on her business. 

Fatuma will share this loan with her loan group " MBOGO," which has a total of 5 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy 20 liters of cooking oil and more fish.

loans.name: Biri Ila

texts.fr: Biri une homme de 29 ans célibataire et père d'un enfant de 3 ans. Il a ouvert un restaurant qu'il gère depuis huit mois. c'est grâce à lui qu'il s'occupe de sa famille et de son enfant. Le fait que  son emplacement ne soit pas très confortable et pas assez grand ne lui facilite pas la tâche avec ses clients qui sont de plus en plus nombreux et exigents. D'où l'importance de ce crédit pour son activité parce que ça lui permettra d'augmenter le stock de ses denrées alimentaires (alvéoles d'oeufs,huile, 1 sac de riz, palette de poisson, viandes, les crudités et le petit nécessaire pour cuisiner ses plats. Il réinvestira une partie de ses bénéfices dans son activité et le reste l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Biri is a single 29-year-old man and the father of a three-year-old child. He opened a restaurant that he has been running for eight months. It is thanks to this restaurant that he is able to take care of his family and his child. However, the restaurant's location is not very comfortable, and it is not big enough, which makes his business difficult, as his customers are increasingly numerous and ever-more demanding.

Hence the importance of this loan for his work, as it allows him to increase his stock of food (trays of eggs, oil, a sack of rice, a pallet of fish, meats, vegetables) and to purchase the small necessities needed to cook his dishes. Biri plans to reinvest a part of his income into his business and he will use the rest to help provide for his family.

loans.use: to increase his stock of food for his restaurant, and to purchase the small necessities needed to cook his dishes.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Gracias por apoyara a Miriam, quien con su credikiva logró comprar sabanas, toallas, pantalones y mercancia en generar. Con su anterior credikiva logró incrmentar sus ganancias fortaleció su capital de trabajo y su cartera. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará vestuario, calzado, articulos de lencería y accesorios fememinos, su inversión planea será exitosa, porque abordará a la clientela que trabaja como empleados y con la que ella usualmente,  ha hecho negociaciones productivaas. Ella agradece a sus finaciadores y  pide a sus finaciadores de Kiva, que sigan apoyando al sector microempresarial y a las personas como ella quieren crecer.
texts.en:
Thanks to the support Miriam received with a Kiva loan, she was able to buy bed sheets, towels, trousers, and general merchandise. Her previous Kiva loan enabled her to increase her earnings, as well as strengthen her operating capital and her clientele.

She is currently applying for another Kiva loan so that she can buy clothes, shoes, lingerie, and women's accessories. Her investment plan will be successful because she will approach customers who work as employees since she usually has productive negotiations with them.

Miriam appreciates her Kiva lenders and asks that they continue to support the micro-enterprise sector and people like her who want to grow.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, lingerie, and women's accessories to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Here is 30-year-old Grace from Liberia. To be precise, she lives in Sanniquille, the capital City of Nimba County. It is rich in natural resources, and living conditions there are much better than the capital city of Liberia. Nimba is the second most populous county in Liberia. Grace completed 6th grade. She and her fiancee are living together, and they have three children between ages one and thirteen. Only two are attending school. She started her business with a little money from her boyfriend. For four years now she has been running a table where she sells slippers. She spends nine hours at her business. A problem she faces is small income and she is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers for her business. Her dream is to one day open a shop and see her children out of high school.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers for her business.

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en:
Herbert is a 26-year-old hardworking man living in Kasese, Uganda. Two years ago he decided to start a stationary shop in order to earn a living. He also earns extra income from teaching in a local school. The high cost of rent and an inefficient electricity supply affect his business growth, while his desire is to set up another outlet in the nearby trading center. 

Herbert is requesting a loan to buy stationary such as books and files to sell.

loans.use: to buy stationary such as books and files to sell.

loans.name: Fátima Aracely

texts.es:
Fátima de 25 años de edad, es una mujer muy dedicada a su trabajo; que es vender productos varios, dentro de ellos platillos típicos y hoy en día quiere vender ropa, para todo público. Vive con su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos de edades entre 4 meses a 4 años de edad. Además, vive junto con ellos la mamá de su pareja, quien trabaja de ama de casa. 

Fátima tiene 5 años de experiencia, en la venta de productos alimenticios y ella los sale a vender en un recipiente (guacal), todos los días a las familias cercanas que habitan en dicha comunidad. Así, es como se gana la vida y su pareja se dedica a la albañilería.

El préstamo que está solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar un vehículo, ya que viene la época navideña y la clienta piensa salir a vender a muchos más lugares de la zona urbana y además ofrecer otro tipos de productos como, verduras y ropa.
Fátima quiere tener un negocio más grande, para así poder  muchos más clientes y mejorar sus ingresos, para construir una casa más grande.
texts.en:
Fatima, age 25, is a woman who is very dedicated to her work, which is selling various products that include traditional foods. Now she wants to sell clothing for all ages. She lives with her life partner and their two children whose ages are between 4 months and 4 years. Her partner's mother, who works as a home-maker, also lives with them.

Fatima has 5 years of experience in selling food products, which she takes around to the nearby families in her community every day in a large bowl made from a gourd. That is how she earns her living, and her partner works in construction. 

The loan that she is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy a vehicle since the Christmas season is coming and she is thinking of going to sell in many other parts of the urban area. Then she can also offer other types of products like produce and clothing. Fatima wants to have a bigger business to be able to have more customers and improve her income in order to build a bigger house.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle since the Christmas season is coming and she is thinking of going to sell in many other parts of the urban area. Then she can also offer other types of products like produce and clothing.

loans.name: Tonker

texts.en: Here is 41-year-old Tonker from Liberia. To be precise, she lives in Sanniquille, the capital city of Nimba County which is rich in natural resources. Living conditions there are much better than the capital city of Liberia, and Nimba is the second most populous county in Liberia. Tonker did not go to school. She and her fiancee live together. They have six children, between the ages of six and fifteen, who attend school and live at home. She started her business with a little money from her older sister. For four years now she has been running a table where she sells onions, rice, palm oil, vita, pepper, salt, etc. She spends five hours each day at her business. A problem she faces is having a small income. She is requesting a loan to purchase more onions, rice, palm oil, vita, pepper, salt, etc. for her business. Her dream is to one day open a shop and see her children out of high school.

loans.use: to purchase more onions, rice, palm oil, vita, pepper, salt, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Joanna

texts.en:
Joanna is 43 years old and lives in Sanniquille, the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources and has living conditions that are much better than the capital city of Liberia. It is the second most populated county in Liberia. Joanna did not go to school, and she has lived all her life in Sanniqulle. She is married and has three children between 16 and 28 years old, she said. Only two of her children are in school, and they all live at home. 

With a  little money from their club (monthly savings), she was able to establish this cook shop business two years ago. She sells for eight hours each day in her business, from Monday to Saturday. Some problem she faces is a small income, since she wants to buy more fish, meat, pepper, onion, rice, etc., for her business. Her plan is to one day to build a modern house. She appreciates the lenders of Kiva for supporting BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to buy more fish, meat, pepper, onion, rice, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Johana Mariely

texts.es: Johana, tiene 26 años de edad,  vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene un hijo y reside en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Siempre le ha gustado cocinar y hace 7 años decidió por tener su propio negocio de comida, esta actividad la realiza en casa de su madre. Vende desayunos, almuerzos y cenas. El prestamo que solicita es por  5,500 lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de comidas como arroz, frijoles, lácteos, condimentos,refrescos, carnes y también unos utensilios de cocina que le hacen falta para elaborar la comida. Este crédito le ha ayudado a tener su inventario y tener su negocio siempre surtido. Su plan es sacar adelante a su familia solo con el negocio ya que es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Johana is 26 years old and in a common-law relationship with her husband. They have one child and reside in the town of Choloma, Cortes.

Johana has always enjoyed cooking, so seven years ago she decided to have her own food business. She operates her business out of her mother's house. Johana sells breakfasts, lunches, and dinners. The loan of 5,500 HNL that she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of supplies for preparing meals such as rice, beans, dairy products, condiments, soft drinks, and meat. She will also buy a few cooking utensils that she lacks for preparing the food.

This loan will help build her inventory and ensure that her business is always stocked. Her plan is to support her family solely on this business since it is her only source of income.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as rice, beans, dairy products, condiments, soft drinks, and meat.

loans.name: Mahoromeza Group

texts.fr:
Jean fait partie du groupe Mahoromeza et habite à Cibitoke. Il a 46 ans et est marié à Mélanie. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants  âgés de 7 à 22 ans, 3 étudient.

Il fait le commerce de manioc sec  depuis  12 ans. 

Il est à son onzième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  de 2 tonnes de manioc sec à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il  voudrait acheter une vache pour avoir du fumier et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
John is part of the Mahoromeza Group and lives in Cibitoke. He is 46 years old and is married to Melanie. Together they have four children aged 7 to 22 years, 3 are in school.

He has been in the business of selling dry cassava for 12 years.

This is his eleventh credit from Turame. With credit KIVA it gets, it will increase its capital and buy 2 tons of dry cassava to sell to earn more.

In the coming years, he will use the profits to buy cow manure and to pay for his children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy dry cassava for resale

loans.name: Honoré Franky

texts.fr: Honoré est un homme de 27 ans célibataire, sans enfants. Après sa formation, il ouvert un salon de coiffure qu'il gère depuis 2 ans déjà. il a souvent un problème du a l'absence de produits cosmétiques,tondeuses et petit matériel dans son institut parce qu'il achète ses produits en détail. Son but étant de satisfaire sa clientèle et de réaliser un grand bénéfice. il sollicite un crédit pour pouvoir acheter son matériel en grande quantité celui qui permettra d'atteindre ses objectifs. Le bénéfice tiré de ce crédit l'aidera a satisfaire ses besoins, aussi d'épargner pour accroitre son activité dans le future.
texts.en:
Honoré is a 27 year old man with no children.  After completing his training, Honoré opened a hairdressing salon two years ago.  He often struggles with a shortage of cosmetic products, hair clippers and other hairdressing supplies.  This is because he buys his supplies from retail outlets.  He would like to better meet the requirements of his customers and increase his earnings.  

Honoré will use his loan to buy his supplies in bulk and help him to achieve his aims.  His earnings will help him to meet his personal financial needs.  He will also save some of his earnings to expand his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy hair clippers and other hairdressing supplies.

loans.name: Wavousse Group

texts.fr:
Mr SALFO est responsable du groupe WAVOUSSE. Marié, il est père de 05enfants. Le plus âgé a 15ans et le moins âgé a 01an. 01 va à l’école. Il a 08personnes en charge.
Mr est cultivateur et fait le jardinage depuis 10ans. Il s’approvisionne dans son quartier. Ses clients viennent de Mogtedo.
Il veut s’acheter  04boites de pépinière et 10sacs d’engrais.
Mr veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Il ambitionne bien construire sa cour.
texts.en:
Mister Salfo is the leader of the Wavousse group. Married, he is father to 5 children. The oldest is 15 years old and the youngest is 1 year old. One goes to school. He has 8 dependants.

Mister is a farmer and has been gardening for 10 years. He gets his supplies in his neighborhood. His customers come from Mogtedo.

He wants to buy himself 8 tree nursery boxes and 10 bags of fertilizer.

Mister wants to reinvest his profits in his business. His ambition is to build his courtyard well.

loans.use: to buy himself 8 tree nursery boxes and 10 bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Mavlyuda

texts.ru: Мавлюда является повторной клиенткой. Она уже кредитуется 9 цикл. Мавлюда честная и порядочная женщина. Она вдова и имеет 2 детей. Ее сыну 20 лет, а дочери 23 года. Она работает более 9 лет в местной больнице в отделе скорой помощи. Она работает диспетчером. Мавлюда 10 лет назад потеряла своего мужа. Ей пришлось работать одной и обеспечить своих детей. Она днем работала на поле, а ночью работала санитаркой в больнице. Таким способом она вырастила своих детей. Ее сын стал единственной опорой для нее. После окончания средней школы он поступил в университет, но тяжелое состояние семьи заставила его уехать в Российскую Федерацию. Мавлюда должна купить продукты питания, а также печку и уголь для проведения зимы. Однако она не имеет денег, так как у нее маленькая зарплата. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки печки, угля и продуктов питания. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mavlyuda is a repeat client. She has already borrowed 9 times. Mavlyuda is an honest and decent woman. She is a widow and has 2 children. Her son is 20 years old, and her daughter is 23. For more than 9 years, she has worked in the emergency room of a local hospital. She works as a dispatcher.  Ten years ago, Mavlyuda lost her husband. Since then, she has had to work alone to provide for her children. She worked in the field during the day, and at night worked as a nurse at the hospital. This way, she raised her children. Her son became her only support. After high school, he enrolled in the University, but the family's difficult condition has forced him to leave for Russia. Mavlyuda needs to buy food, as well as a stove and coal for the winter. However, she has no money, because she has a low salary. She has requested a loan of 3000 Somons to buy a stove, coal and food. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a stove, coal and food items for the winter season

loans.name: Awa Faye

texts.fr:
Madame Awa Faye, une dame de 27ans, fait du commerce depuis peu. Elle gère un salon de couture et aimerai acheter des tissus qu’elle va confectionner en ensembles et qu’elle va exposer pour vendre. Elle travaille de 7 heures du matin à 18 heures.  Awa Faye avait déjà démarré cette activité avec un revenu très minime, une activité qui lui as rapporté un bénéfice non négligeable. Elle a juste besoin d’une somme de 75000f CFA  et ce sera pour la première fois qu’elle sollicite l’appui de l’IMCEC. 
Awa Faye est célibataire et n’a de charges que son activité de couture et ses petits besoins au quotidien.
Elle souhaite ouvrir un grand magasin de confection et disposer de plusieurs tailleurs à sa disposition c’est là son rêve.
texts.en:
Madame Awa Faye is 27 years old and recently started her business. 

She runs a sewing workshop and would like to buy fabric that she will turn into outfits and display for sale. She works from 7 am until 6 pm. Awa Faye had already started to do this with minimal revenue, and this has brought her significant profits. 

She only needs 75,000 FCFA. This is the first time she is asking for support from IMCEC.
 
Awa Faye is single and has no expenses besides those of her business and her small daily needs. She would like to open a large shop, and her dream is to have a number of tailors at her disposal.

loans.use: buy fabric that she sews and resells.

loans.name: Shangilieni Group

texts.fr: La cliente Katherine est une présidente de l’association d’affaire « Shangilieni », senior entrepreneur expérimentée, dynamique, âgée de 48 ans, veuve et mère de 7 enfants qui étudient tous. La cliente est une vendeuse de matériels et matériaux de construction. Elle est sociétaire d’une quincaillerie. Elle installe son entreprise dans un quartier nouvellement loti, surtout au long de la rue. Elle commença ses affaires avec le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 8 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 1 sac de clous, un carton des ampoules électriques, câbles électriques, etc. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser ses enfants, étendre son projet de commerce et acheter une seconde parcelle pour ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout ; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Katherine, age 48, is president of the business group Shangilieni. She is an experienced and dynamic entrepreneur, and the widowed mother of 7 children who all attend school. She sells construction materials and supplies, and she is part owner of a hardware store. She is set up street side in a newer district. 

Katherine has been conducting this activity for eight years, and originally started her business with a loan from the Hekima MFI. She will use this new loan to buy one bag of nails, one carton of light bulbs, some electric cables, etc. 

Her goals are to support her children’s education, expand her business and buy a plot of land for her children.

Katherine is very thankful to the Hekima MFI for helping businesswomen excluded from the banking system to become self-sufficient, especially in these critical times of war in the Eastern region.

loans.use: to buy one bag of nails, one carton of light bulbs, some electric cables, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Iwacu Group

texts.fr:
Jean fait partie du groupe  Iwacu  et  habite à Bubanza. Il a 23 ans et est marié à Pétrone. 
Il a sous sa charge 2 personnes.

Il  fait le commerce des pagnes et le métier de tailleur depuis  10 ans. 

C’est son premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  2 machines à coudre pour servir beaucoup de clients afin de gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait acheter une machine à broder.
texts.en:
Jean is a member of the Iwacu group and lives in Bubanza. He is 23 years old and married to Pétrone. He supports 2 people.

He sells pagnes [traditional cloth wraps] and has worked as a tailor for 10 years.

This is his first loan through Turame. With his Kiva loan, he will increase his capital and buy two sewing machines to serve more customers in order to make more money.

In the coming years, he would like to buy an embroidery machine.

loans.use: to buy two sewing machines to serve many customers to earn more

loans.name: Veronika

texts.en:
Veronica is a forty year old married woman with four children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She sells fish, rice and palm oil, and with the proceeds she has been able to pay school fees for her children. 

She hopes to expand her business despite seasonal changes that affect her projected profits.

Veronica is requesting for a loan to buy more fish, rice and palm oil to sell.

loans.use: to buy more fish, rice and palm oil to sell.

loans.name: Suiumkan

texts.ru: Суйумкан 58 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Суйумкан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Суйумкан занимается животноводством, стартовав 37 лет назад, с покупки скота на 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Суйумкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, а также имеет земельный надел размером 1,71 ГА, на которой выращивает клевер и пшеницу. Ежемесячный доход составляет 17,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Суйумкан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Суйумкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и намерена собрать средства на ремонт помещения для скота.
texts.en:
Suiumkan is 58 years old and, with her husband, is raising two children. She has a high school education. Her main income comes from raising cattle which she started doing 37 years ago by buying cattle for 1,000 KGS. 

Through hard work she now has two dairy cows and a 1.71-hectare plot of land where she grows clover and wheat. Her monthly income is 17,000 KGS. To further support her household, Suiumkan is taking a loan of 30,000 KGS from Bai-Tushum and Partners, a micro-finance bank. She will use the loan to buy calves to fatten and sell on the market for a high price. With the profits, Suiumkan plans to buy more animals and improve the areas where she keeps the cattle.

loans.use: to buy steers for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Badnoogo Group

texts.fr:
Mr MAHAMOUDOU représente le groupe BADNOOGO. Marié, il est père de 06enfants. Le plus âgé a 14ans et le moins âgé a 02ans. 02 vont à l’école et il a 11personnes en charge.
Il est cultivateur et fait l’élevage  depuis 20ans. Il s’approvisionne au marché de bétail de Linoghin. Ses clients les hommes et femmes.
Mr veut s’acheter 03 moutons.
Il veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Mr ambitionne étendre les limites de son activité et acheter une parcelle puis construire.
texts.en:
Mr. MAHAMOUDOU represents the group BADNOOGO. He is a married father of six children. The oldest is 14 years old, and the youngest is 2. Two go to school, and he has eleven persons to support. 

Mr. MAHAMOUDOU is a farmer and has been raising animals for twenty years. He gets his supplies at the Linoghin livestock market. His customers include both men and women.

Mr. MAHAMOUDOU wants to purchase three head of sheep. He wants to reinvest his profits in his business. His ambition is to expand his business, purchase a parcel of land, and then build.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Nebojsa

texts.en:
Nebojsa is 46 years old, married, has two girls, living in a community in Kosovo. Based on tradition, he works in the agricultural business to take care of his family's needs. For the last 5 years, he has been planting vegetables for his family's consumption, and for selling to others in the community. He also works with his tractor on the land of others for a fee.

His wife sometimes helps him when she has free time. At this time, Nebosja needs a loan to pay for a new tractor. The loan will help him grow his business and generate more income. He hopes that in this way, he will be able to improve the living conditions of his family. He thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for a new tractor.

loans.name: Susuana's Group

texts.en:
Susuana, who is in her late 40s, is married and has two children. They are still going to school. 

She has been running two businesses, selling smoked fish. She has been in these businesses for six years now. She works from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. daily, and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Susuana's fourth loan from ID-Ghana, Ghana. She wants to use it for buying two cartons of fresh fish to smoke and sell to customers.  

She will take this loan with her loan group member, Sabiatu who also sell smoked fish and they will hold each other accountable for repaying back the loan amount of GHS 1,400.

loans.use: To buy two cartons of fish to smoke and sell.

loans.name: La Couronne Group

texts.fr:
Mme HABIBATA est responsable du groupe LA COURONNE. Sur la photo, elle est arrêter au coin à gauche en foulard rouge et une tenue rouge bordeaux blanc salle. Mariée, elle est mère de 06enfants. Le plus âgé a 27ans et le moins âgé a 13ans. 03 vont à l’école. Elle a 06personnes en charge.
Mme fait la restauration (gâteaux et aloco) depuis 03ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les grandes boutiques. Ses clients sont partout surtout  les enfants.
Elle veut s’acheter 02sacs de farine de blé et  01bidon d’huile de 20l.
Mme veut ouvrir un compte d’épargne avec ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne renforcer son activité et aider ses enfants avec le payement de leurs études.
texts.en:
Habibata is the leader of the group "La Couronne." In the photo, she is on the left in a red scarf and a burgundy red white outfit. Married, she is a mother of six children. The eldest is 27 years old and the youngest is 13 years old. Three of the children go to school. She has six [additional] people under her care.

Habibata has been selling prepared food (cakes and aloco [fried plantains]) for the three years. She sells to everyone, especially children.

She procures her ingredients in the larger shops. She wants to buy two sacs of flour and one 20-liter drum of oil.

Habibata wants to open a savings account with her earnings. She hopes to strengthen her business and help her children with their school fees.

loans.use: to buy two sacs of flour and a 20-liter drum of oil

loans.name: Teyyub

texts.en: Teyyub has a lovely family. He has two daughters and his wife is a housewife who helps in his business. Teyyub’s elder daughter is 20 years old. His little daughter is 18 years old and she is in tenth class. His family is IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from Fuzuli city and now live in the Bala Bahmanli village of the Fuzuli region. Previously he took a loan from the Kiva organization for his cafe. The monthly income from that business was not enough and Teyub cannot support his family. Now Teyyub has been in the animal breeding business. He buys little calves, raises them, and sells them in bazaars to earn money. In this business, his monthly income is better than before. Today Teyyub wants to increase his business and is again requesting for a loan amount of 1,350 AZN to buy chaff, hay, and straw for his cows. Teyyub is thankful to the Komak and Kiva organizations for their aid. In the future, he wants to start producing dairy products and sell them.

loans.use: to buy chaff, hay, and straw for his cows.

loans.name: Aynura

texts.en:
Aynur is 38 years old, over 16 years married, and has two children. Now she lives with her husband, daughter and son in Masazir village of Abseron region. One of her children goes to ninth class and the other goes to fifth class. Her husband is a butcher.

 Aynur rents a shop where she sells women's clothing like pants, blouses, dresses, etc. She has been at this business for eight years. Today Aynur is planning to expand her business. She needs 700 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to buy a clothing stand and new seasonal clothes. She is thankful for the aid from Komak and Kiva. In the future she wants to buy a store for increased monthly income.

loans.use: to buy a clothing stand and new seasonal clothes

loans.name: Khayriniso

texts.ru:
Хайринисо 36 лет. Она состоит в браке и живет с детьми на районе Шахритус. Муж Хайринисо работает в Российской Федерации. Он не нашел работу в родном краю и ему пришлось уехать заграницу, чтобы обеспечить свою семью.
   Хайринисо просит кредит, чтобы начать новый бизнес. Она будет заниматься торговлей детской одежды. Хайринисо арендовала торговую точку на рынке "Имон" и хочет скорее приступить к работе. К сожалению, она еще не приступила к работе, потому что у Хайринисо не хватает средств, чтобы закупить достаточное количество товара. По этой причине она обратилась за кредитом. На сумму кредита она сможет приобрести детские вещи для продажи и тем самым улучшить жизненные условия себе и своим детям. Хайринисо ждет Вашей поддержки!
texts.en:
Khairiniso is 36 years old. She is married and lives with her children in Shahrituz. Khairiniso's husband works in the Russian Federation. He could not find a job in his native land, so he had to go abroad to provide for his family. 

Khairiniso is requesting a loan to start a new business. She will sell children's clothing. Khairiniso rented a stall in the Imon market and wants to start working soon. Unfortunately, she has not yet started to work because Khairiniso does not have enough money to purchase a sufficient quantity of goods. Therefore, she applied for a loan. With the loan amount, she will be able to buy children's clothes for sale, and thereby improve living conditions for herself and her children. Khairiniso is waiting for your support!

loans.use: start a business selling children's clothes.

loans.name: Saranga Group

texts.en:
Zuhura, who is in her late 30s, is married and has a son and a daughter who are in school. For three years now, she has had a retail shop selling items like dry foods, cooking oil, airtime etc. Zuhura has also been running a tailoring business since 1997. She starts working from 6 am to 9 pm each working day and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be her 13th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans, all of which were paid back successfully, she opened a retail shop and bought more missed shop inventories. Her family is happy. Zuhura used her profit to cover school fees, food expenses and saved a portion of her profit for future. She will use this loan to buy a tailoring machine and the out-of-stock items in her retail shop. She dreams to be a good entrepreneur. 

She will share this loan with her loan group Saranga, which totals 12 members. The member of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a tailoring machine and the out-of-stock items in her retail shop.

loans.name: Inobat

texts.en:
As a divorced parent of one child, Inobat works hard to support her family. 

She has a retail business in Tajikistan. She sells industrious items such as buckets, toilet paper, household tools and etc. She has had this business for three years and earns in this way income for living. 

Inobat has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from Imon International organization. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money. In the future, she hopes to improve her business in order to provide for the education of her child.
 
Inobat is deeply grateful to Kiva lenders in advance and also she thanks IMON because thanks to their help, she will be able to make some improvements to her business. In this way her house will be safer and her standard of living will improve, so that she will continue working and fighting to make her biggest dream come true: To be successful in life.

She is asking for a loan of 5000 TJS to buy industrious items for increasing working capital. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy industrious items such as buckets, toilet paper, household tools, etc. for resale

loans.name: Goharik

texts.en:
Goharik is a nice lady who is 51-years-old and lives in the city of Stepanavan, which is in the Lori region. She is married and has a son (he is a lawyer) and a daughter (she is a doctor), who are already married and they live separately with their families. Goharik has an advanced education with a specialty of biology and biochemistry. She worked at a school as a biology teacher for many years, but now she works as a doctor- a laboratory assistant at the one of the medical centers in Stepanavan city. She is a very respected and loved person among her colleagues. Her husband works as an architect. This family is a very exemplary and cute one, and they greatly elevate education and self-development of a man. 

Goharik asks for a loan of 700,000 Armenian drams, since she and her husband have decided to repair their house and make it cleaner and more comfortable for their beloved grandchildren, who visit their grandma and grandpa very often.

loans.use: to repair her house and make it cleaner and more comfortable for her beloved grandchildren.

loans.name: Bozorgul

texts.ru: Бозоргул жизнерадостная женщина. Она вдова и одна воспитывает 4 детей. Бозоргул не имеет высшее образование и поэтому она работает более 14 лет в местной больнице своего района. Она основная кормилица семьи и поэтому они живут бедно на ее зарплату. Она вместе со своими детьми живет в старом доме, который имеет плохое состояние. Она уже несколько лет планирует отремонтировать свой дом, но не имеет возможности. Она запрашивает займ для покупки строительных материалов, как цемент, краски, песок и т.п. для ремонта дома. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Bozorgul is a cheerful lady.  She lacks a university education, and has been working for more than 14 years at a local hospital.  As a widow raising 4 children, she is the breadwinner for her family, and, at times, has trouble making ends meet.  She and her children live in an old house in dire need of repairs; repairs that have been put off time after time again over the years due to a lack of money.  Bozorgul is seeking a loan of 1.000 somoni to help buy some materials for repairing her home (cement, paint, sand, and the like), and is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: buy building materials such as cement, paint, and sand for home repairs

loans.name: Mukambal

texts.en: Mukambal is widowed. She is the only feed keeper of her three children. Her family and neighbors know her as a kind and hardworking woman because she has worked hard for more than 10 years in a field. She grows potatoes and has her own land. Her children help her with growing potatoes. She sells the harvest in the local market. Mukambal has great experience in this field. She wants to develop her business further and use the profits to repair her house. She does not have enough money to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers and is asking for a loan to do so. This is Mukambal's first loan from IMON and Kiva. She awaits your support and thanks Kiva’s lenders in advance.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Qnarik

texts.en:
Qnarik is an agronomist from Haykadzor village in the Shirak region. She lives with her mother-in-law, and three school-age children (daughter – 15 years old, two sons – 14 and 7 years old). 

Qnarik works at the village local school as a teacher. With the help of her mother-in-law, she is also engaged in cattle breeding, in aviculture (poultry breeding), in breeding of livestock (pigs, piglets, and sheep), and in the cultivation of wheat. The family also owns a little store where they sell different types of products.
They sell the agricultural products in the local market; this is the most important source of the family's income. 

As autumn is progressing and winter is very close, Qnarik needs to prepare her agribusiness for winter. For that reason she needs a loan of USD 3,000 to purchase forage (sawdust) for the livestock, fertilizer, and fuel for agricultural machinery. The loan will help her sustain her agribusiness. 

Qnarik and her family highly rely on the goodwill of the lenders, and will appreciate their support in collecting the needed loan.

loans.use: to purchase forage (sawdust) for the livestock, fertilizer, and fuel for agricultural machinery

loans.name: Jirayr

texts.en:
Jirayr is an agronomist from Bagravan village of the Shirak region. He lives with his wife, four-year-old daughter, two-year-old son, and his mother. 

To take care of his family's daily needs, Jirayr is extensively engaged in cattle breeding, in aviculture (poultry breeding), in breeding livestock (pigs and piglets), and in cultivation of wheat. He sells the agricultural products in the local market; this is the main source of the family's income. His family members assist him in his everyday farming activities. 

To continue running his agribusiness and to prepare it for the upcoming winter, Jirayr needs a loan of USD 3,000 to purchase forage (grass and barley), barley seeds, and to make previous credit repayments. 

Jirayr and his family rely on the goodwill of lenders, and will highly appreciate their support in collecting the needed amount of loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase forage (grass and barley),  barley seeds, and make previous credit repayments

loans.name: Jannet

texts.en: Jannet is a thirty-year-old farmer living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She is married with four children and only two go to school. She sells rice, beans and cocoa all from her garden, works for eight hours a day and has been in the business for five years. She hopes to expand her business because it's very profitable, though seasonal changes affect her. Jannet intends to use the loan to buy rice, beans and cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans and cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Agnès Liliane Marcelle

texts.fr: Agnès est une jeune camerounaise âgée de 33 ans, fiancée et mère d'un enfant de 11 ans qui va déjà à l'école. elle vit avec son fiancé et encadre en plus de son enfant, deux autres personnes . elle gère un centre d'appel téléphonique dans un quartier de la ville où elle y vend également des crédits de communication, biscuits, bonbons et autres petits consommables.Elle voudrait avec ce crédit renforcer son stock de marchandises afin de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle qui va grandissant.Elle a pour ambition de faire grandir son activité afin d'augmenter de façon considérable sa marge bénéficiaire, bénéfice qui lui permettra de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Agnès is a young, 33-year-old woman from Cameroon. She is engaged to be married and the mother of an eleven-year-old child who attends school. She lives with her fiancé and, in addition to her child, has two additional dependents. Agnès runs a call center in a district of her town, where she also sells call credit, cookies, candies and other snacks.

With this loan she would like to increase her stock of merchandise, so that she can better meet the needs of her ever-growing customer base. Her goal is to expand her business so that she can considerably increase her profit margin, the income from which will allow her to better meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and expand her business.

loans.name: Dilshoda

texts.ru: Дилшода жительница города Истаравшан. Она последние 10 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Дилшода продает сезонные фрукты и ее бизнес продвигается хорошо. Дилшоде 36 лет. Она замужем и является матерью одного сына. Сын тоже помогает матери в торговле. Чтобы увеличить продажу и расширить торговлю, Дилшода запрашивает кредит. Она хочет закупить широкий ассортимент сезонных фруктов, в частности бананы, яблоко, мандарин, хурма, гранат и т.д. Так как приближается большой праздник, Дилшода хочет успеть привезти новый товар и таким образом увеличить товарооборот.
texts.en: Dilshoda is a resident of the city of Istaravshan. For the past 10 years, she has been a seller at the market. Dilshoda sells seasonal fruits and her business is progressing quite well. Dilshoda is 36 years old. She is married and is the mother to a son. Her son also helps her with her retail business. In order to increase her sales and expand her business, Dilshoda is requesting a loan. She wants to buy a wide assortment of seasonal fruits, in particular bananas, apples, mandarin oranges, persimmons, pomegranates, etc. As a big holiday is coming up, Dilshoda wants to hurry to bring in her new products and as a result, increase her sales.

loans.use: to purchase a wide assortment of seasonal fruits to increase her sales.

loans.name: Thérèse Mirabelle

texts.fr: Thérèse est une  femme mariée mère de trois enfants qui vit dans un quartier de la capiltale. Elle détient un hangard depuis neuf ans où elle vend plusieurs produits. Grâce à son dynamisme elle s'est vite faite une clientèle qu'elle aimerait continuer de satisfaire. Pour cela elle sollicite un prêt qui lui permettra d'acheter un sac d'arachides, un sac de mais et un sac de macabos. Les bénéfices tirés de ce prêt lui permettront d'augmenter son capital et de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Thérèse is a married mother of three children who lives in a district of the capital. She has been running a stall for the past nine years where she sells several products. Her dynamic personality has helped her to quickly build a customer base whose needs she hopes to continue to meet. With that in mind, she is seeking a loan which she will use to buy one sack of groundnuts, one sack of maize, and one sack of macabo tubers. The income she earns through this new loan will allow her to increase her working capital and to provide for her family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy one sack of groundnuts, one sack of maize, and one sack of macabo tubers

loans.name: Libertad Norte Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LIBERTAD NORTE” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Betty es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de accesorios de celulares, tejido de chompas, tejido de Camas, tienda de barrio, material de construcción, venta de gelatina, tejido de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Betty es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de gelatinas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por decisión propia al observar que el producto se vendía con amplitud en el mercado.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de gelatinas) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las reuniones de pago.
texts.en:
The  “LIBERTAD NORTE” communal bank is starting its first loan with Pro Mujer, as part of the German Busch centre. The group is made up of 8 members and is run by a board of directors of which Betty is the President. The businesses which the members of the communal association run are varied and among them are: sale of mobile phone accessories, knitting jumpers, weaving blankets, corner shop, building materials and selling gelatine.

The loan they will take out will benefit small micro businesswomen of which Betty is an example. She says she joined Pro Mujer three years ago after being invited by a promoter from the institution who went to visit her in her home. Currently she has a business selling gelatine and says she decided to start this business when she saw that gelatine was widely sold in the market. 

The loan Betty is taking out now is to increase her capital to buy gelatine, which she will buy from wholesalers in the city of El Alto and later sell in her sales outlet. This type of work will allow her to generate an income to support her family, as she is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Betty replies that she likes the payment meetings.

loans.use: to buy gelatine.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est constitué de 4 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier TORAKABOUGOU de la ville de Bougouni. 

Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 3éme prêt. Les 2 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers habits, céréales et produits alimentaires à l’image de NAGNOUMA qui est la 1ére femme dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche. Elle  compte acheter avec son  prêt de divers produits alimentaires(fruits et des tubercules),  avec les grossistes de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 

Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is made up of 4 married women who have an average age of 30 and, on average, 3 children. They live in traditional, extended families in the district of Torakabougou, in Bougouni town. They got to know each other thanks to neighbourly and business relationships and friendships. They decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to strengthen their financial capacity and better do business, and are on their 3rd loan. The 2 previous loans have been correctly repaid. This group of women is in the business of making various clothing items, cereals and food products. Nagnouma is the 1st woman in the photo from right to left. She intends to buy various food products (fruits and tubers) with the loan from wholesalers Bougouni. She performs her sales and market at home, retail cash and credit to a clientele composed primarily of women.

 She expects to make an average monthly profit of 25 000 francs which will be reinvested in her business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy fruits and tubers for resale

loans.name: Bibiniso

texts.ru: Бибинисо мать 5 детей. Она замужем. Ее муж Бахтиёр работает в средней школе учителем. Бибинисо тоже имеет педагогическое образование и более 13 лет работает в средней школе учителем. Она умная женщина. Бибинисо и ее муж получают маленькую зарплату. Они ели-ели справляются с семейными расходами. Бибинисо хочет купить корову, для своего домохозяйства, так как ее детям необходимо пить молоко каждый день. С годами ее здоровье ухудшается и поэтому она решила пить каждое утро парное молоко. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки коровы. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Bibiniso is a mother to five children. She is married. Her husband, Bakhtiyor, works in a secondary school as a teacher. Bibiniso also has a pedagogical education and, for more than 13 years, has worked as a teacher in a secondary school. She is an intelligent woman. Bibiniso and her husband receive a very small salary. They just barely manage their family's expenses. Bibiniso wants to buy a cow for household, as her children need to drink milk every day. Over the years, her health has gotten worse, which is which she has decided to drink fresh milk every morning. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 3000 somoni to buy a cow. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Hafiza

texts.ru: Хафиза разведена. Она одна воспитывает и обеспечивает свою единственную дочь. Хафиза пережила много трудности после развода с мужем. В 2002 году она начала свой бизнес купле продажей продуктов питания. Она торгует на местном рынке. Хафиза одолжила немного денег у своих родителей и начала свой бизнес. Вначале у нее был маленький бизнес. Постепенно она развевала свою лавочку по продажи продуктов питания. Хафиза на сегодняшний день введет своё дело успешно. Данное время она нуждается финансовой поддержки, так как ее дочь скоро выходит замуж, и Хафиза должна провести свадебное торжество своей дочери. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для проведения свадебного торжества своей дочери. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Hafiza is divorced. She is raising and supporting her only daughter. Hafiza was faced with a lot of difficulties after the divorce with her husband. She started her business in 2002 buying and selling food. She sells on the local market. Hafiza has borrowed some money from her parents and started her business. In the beginning it was small, but gradually she has grown her grocery store. Hafiza is running her business successfully to this day. At this time she needs financial support because her daughter is getting married and Hafiza has to hold a wedding ceremony for her daughter. She is asking for a loan in the amount of 5,000 somoni to organize the wedding. She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: to hold a wedding celebration for her daughter.

loans.name: Carmen Isabel

texts.es: Carmen es una mujer luchadora de 46 años de edad, soltera, con un hijo bajo su cargo, su negocio es una pulpería, venta de ropa, electrodomésticos, los comercializa en la zona franca y en su domicilio desde hace 7 años. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución  3 años, el crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de inventario de granos básicos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, jabón, ace, cloro, papel higiénico, cuadernos, golosinas, productos lácteos, gaseosas, productos perecederos, blusas, camisas, pantalones, shores, faldas, camisolas, etc.
texts.en:
Carmen is a determined woman. She is 46 years old, single, with one dependent child. She has a small general store, and also sells clothing and electrical goods. For the last seven years she has sold both in the free trade zone and from her home. 

She has been a client of the institution for three years, and is seeking this loan in order to buy stock of basic grains like rice, sugar, oil, soap, detergent, bleach, toilet paper, notebooks, candy, dairy products, sodas, perishable goods, blouses, shirts, trousers, shorts, skirts, sports shirts, etc.

loans.use: to buy stock of basic grains like rice, sugar, oil, soap, detergent, bleach, toilet paper, notebooks, candy, dairy products, sodas, perishable goods, blouses, shirts, trousers, shorts, skirts, sports shirts, etc.

loans.name: Bendiya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BENDIYA ont en moyenne  34 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à  SANTORO II dans la ville de San (dans la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente graines de céréales, de condiments, etc.
Les femmes du groupe BENDIYA sont à leur 1er  prêt solidaire. KADIA 1ere femme à  la gauche  sur la photo  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter deux paniers de tomates, trois sacs de 100kg d’oignons et des poissons fumées. Elle s’approvisionne à SAN et effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elles envisagent réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, et l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women who belong to the Bendiya group average 34 years of age with three children each and all live in extended traditional families in Santoro II in the town of San (which lies in the Republic of Mali's fourth administrative region).

These women got to know each other through family connections and have businesses buying and selling cereals, condiments, etc. They are on their first group loan.

Kadia, who is the woman standing on the left of the photo, is planning to use her loan to buy two baskets of tomatoes, three 100kg sacks of onions and smoked fish. She gets her supplies in San and sells her products to a customer base made up of men and women for cash and often on credit.

The women expect to make an average monthly profit of 15,000FCFA, which will be used for health, food, clothing, and schooling expenses, with the remainder being used to reinvest in their businesses.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Rugiatu       K

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Rugiatu from Waterloo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with 3 children. Her children are currently attending school. For the past 7 years, Rugiatu has established her clothing material business. She began her business because she needs to create income to support her home. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to run her business.

Rugiatu requires a loan in order to buy more clothing material to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future, Rugiatu plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more clothing material to expand her business.

loans.name: Kou

texts.en:
Kou is 38 years old, and she lives in Sanniquelle, the capital city of Nimba County which is rich in natural resources. The living conditions are much better than in the capital city of Liberia. It is the second largest populated county in Liberia. 

Kou did not go to school, and she grew up in the rural area of Sanniquelle. She is married, and her husband is a carpenter. They have seven children, aged between 17 to 22 years. She says two of her children are in school and live at home. She received small money from her husband to establish her business. For seven years now she has been running a small local shop where she sells rubber dishes (plate, pan, bucket, tub, etc). She spends 10 hours each day on her business from Monday to Saturday. A problem she faces is less income. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rubber dishes for her business. Her plan is to one day build a modern house.

loans.use: to purchase more rubber dishes for her business.

loans.name: Komlan

texts.fr: Célibataire de 25ans, mr Komlan pour subvenir à ses besoins revend depuis 2010 des tenues de sport dans une boutique. Ayant des clients de parts et d'autres dans la ville, il sollicite un premier crédit pour acheter des marchandises afin de les satisfaire. Le profit lui permettra d'agrandir son stock et d'améliorer ses conditions de vies.
texts.en: Komlan is a 25-year old bachelor. In order to provide for his needs he has been selling sports kits in a shop. Since he has customers from all over the town, he is requesting a first loan to buy goods to satisfy customer demand. The profits will enable him to expand his stock and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sports kits.

loans.name: Olatoutou

texts.fr: Olatoutou est revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale à Lomé et se fait aider par un employé. Elle est mariée à un employé de société et ont des enfants tous scolarisés. Face à un problème d’insuffisance de capital, elle sollicite son quatrième crédit qui sera consacré à son commerce auprès de notre institution. Elle souhaite avoir sa propre boutique et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en: Olatoutou is a retail grocer in Lomé and is helped by an employee. She is married to a man employed by a company and they have children who are all in school. Facing the problem of insufficient capital, Olatoutou is requesting her fourth loan from our institution and this will be dedicated to her business. She would like to have her own store and provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to sell

loans.name: Jose Ylden

texts.es:
José Ylden tiene 51 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Oyotun, su población se dedica al cultivo de arroz, caña, comercio en general y ganadería, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Tiene un pequeño negocio ubicado en su domicilio donde su esposa vende aves de corral, El se dedica a labores agrícolas en los caseríos aledaños a su comunidad.

José ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para comprar animales menores, cerdos y pavos para posteriormente engordarlos y ofrecerlo a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
José Ylden is 51 years old. He lives with his wife in the district of Oyotun, where most local people work in rice and sugarcane farming, general trade, and livestock farming. It is two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on the northern coast of Peru. 

José has a small business located in his home, where his wife sells poultry. He works as an agricultural laborer in the villages surrounding his community. 

He has requested a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles to buy minor species, pigs and turkeys, in order to fatten them up and later offer them for sale at a higher price.

loans.use: to buy small farm animals, pigs and turkeys.

loans.name: Kora Group

texts.fr:
Sur la photo du groupe Kora,Innocent est représenté par sa femme Emelence.
Suzanne fait est le représentant du groupe   et  habite à Bujumbura. C’est une veuve de 33 ans .Elle a 2 enfants l’un a 12 et l’autre 18 ans.
Elle a sous charge un enfant membre de sa famille élargie et qui étudie.

Elle  fait le commerce des habits depuis  9 ans. 

Elle est à son  neuvième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d’habits   à revendre    pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines  années, elle   voudrait acheter une voiture pour ses  déplacements  et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
In the photo of the Kora group, Innocent is represented by his wife, Emelence. Suzanne is the representative of the group and lives in Bujumbura. She is a 33-year old widow and has two children, aged 12 and 18 years old respectively. She also has another dependant: a child belonging to her extended family who is studying.

Suzanne has been selling clothing for the past nine years. She is on her ninth loan from Turame. With this Kiva loan she is going to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of clothing to resell and make more money.

In the coming years she would like to buy a car to get around and also see her children study.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of clothing to resell and make more money.

loans.name: Kinama Group

texts.fr:
Levis fait partie du groupe  Kinama  et  habite à Cibitoke. Il a 23 ans et est marié à Julienne. 

Il  fait le commerce de boutique (haricot, riz, savon,…) depuis  2 ans. 

C’est son premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  30 kg de riz, 20 kg de haricot, 25 kg de sel et 25 kg de farine de maїs à revendre dans sa boutique pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines  années, il  voudrait planter les arbres et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Levis belongs to the Kinama group and lives in Cibitoke. He is 23 years old and married to Julienne.

He has been running a shop business (selling beans, rice, soap,..) for the past two years.

This is his first loan from Turame. With the Kiva loan he is going to increase his capital and buy 30kg of rice, 20kg of beans, 25kg of salt and 25kg of cornflour to resell in his shop and make more money.

In the coming years he would like to plant trees and see his children study.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy 30kg of rice, 20kg of beans, 25kg of salt and 25kg of cornflour to resell in his shop and make more money.

loans.name: Yah

texts.en:
Yah is 41 years of age, and she has lived all her days in Sanniquille, the capital city of Nimba County which is rich in natural resources. The living conditions here are much better than in the capital city of Liberia. It is the second largest populated county in Liberia. 

Yah has not gone to school. She and her boyfriend are living together along with six children aged between 6 and 29; only three are presently attending school. She was able to establish her business with small money from her boyfriend. She has been selling rice, G.B (dough made out of cassava) and soup in a local restaurant in the local market for three years now. She sells from Monday to Saturday spending ten hours on her business. A problem she faces is small income. She is requesting a loan to purchase more meat, fish, onion, oil, pepper, salt, etc for her business. Her plan is to one day build a modern house.

loans.use: to purchase more meat, fish, onion, oil, pepper, salt, etc for her business.

loans.name: Jeneba

texts.en:
Meet Jeneba. She is a 35-year-old from Jui Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 4 children. For the past 15 years, Jeneba has been running her retail business. She began her business because she wants to generate a permanent source of income. She works at the business from 8am until 7pm, 7 days a week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital with which to expand her business.

Jeneba requires a loan in order to purchase more chicken to resell. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her welfare and increase her business. In the future, Jeneba plans to open a food stuff table. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more chicken to resell.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: Mamie is 35 years old and lives in Sanniquillie the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources and where living conditions are better than in the capital. Nimba County is also the second most populous county in Liberia. Mamie did not go to school, and she has lived all her life in a rural area. She is married, and her husband is a security man. They both have 5 children. Her children are aged between 3 and 14 and are in school. Her susu (local daily savings) enabled her to establish her business. For two years now she has been running a table where she sells fish. She spends 9 hours daily on her business. A problem she faces is low income. Mamie is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for her business. Her plans are to educate her children and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Ozodamo

texts.ru: Озодамо родилась на юге Таджикистана. Она трудолюбивая и жизнерадостная женщина. Озодамо мать 3 детей. Она замужем. Ее муж Зокир является трудовым мигрантом в Российской Федерации. Она более 12 лет работает в детском садике воспитательницей. Она основная кормилица семьи. Озодамо всегда мечтает, чтобы ее дети росли в доме, который имеет хорошее состояние. Однако, так как она не имеет достаточно денег, она уже несколько лет не может отремонтировать свой дом. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина и т.п. для ремонта дома. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
