Margret is requesting a loan to buy clothes to sell ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.name: Jariatu

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Jariatu from Waterloo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with three children. Her children are currently attending school. For the past 10 years, Jariatu has established her clothing material business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support the home. She works at the business 12 hours per day and seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to run her business.

Jariatu requires a loan in order to buy more clothing material and shoes to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future, Jariatu plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more clothing material and shoes to expand her business.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.en: Maritza moved to the United States from Lima, Peru to give her family a better quality of life. Her life changed when her son’s kindergarten teacher gave her the opportunity to volunteer in the classroom and in the after-school program. This experience made her realize her passion for working with children.  After working in child care related services for many years, Maritza is now ready to open her own. Currently, she is seeking a loan of $7,500 to cover start up costs.

loans.use: To pay for start up costs

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar is a Peruvian artisan who specializes in leather and wood home accents. He would like to purchase leather and hardwoods such as mohena, cedar, and tornillo, as well as in paints, sealers, and lacquer.

Oscar has been selling through NOVICA since 2004. This is his story: "When I was 10 years old my father died, leaving me no choice but to work at different jobs. One day, when I was 12, I came upon a carpentry shop where I discovered my vocation for working with wood and leather. I resolved to master the craft, and I did so on my own, learning each step and improving every detail. Now I have my own workshop. I see my work as an art form, not just something to be sold, and my work fills my life in a way I cannot explain." "I would like to thank you for appreciating Peruvian arts and crafts, and for supporting my work through this microcredit. Rest assured I am a hard working person and my products are always of the highest quality because I put my heart, time, and best effort into every piece I make." Use the link below to view Oscar's leather home accents on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/4344">http://www.novica.com/kiva/4344

loans.use: to purchase of leather and hardwoods such as mohena, cedar, and tornillo, as well as in paints, sealers, and lacquer

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en: Fernando is a Peruvian artisan who creates modern apparel with Andean alpaca wool. He hopes to purchase materials for his designs. Fernando has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is his story: "My artistic origins come from my family. My uncles worked in textiles, and little by little they introduced me to this world. I love being able to translate materials into beautiful designs. My work means everything to me: it's what I love and cherish, and I love the fact that I can provide for my family thanks to it." "I'm proud to have been born in Peru, with its rich culture and traditions, where alpaca wool has been used since the times of our ancestors. I'm grateful for the opportunity to carry on this tradition, creating trendy designs that offer warmth as well as beauty. Thanks to Novica, we've been able to bring this tradition to the entire world... how could I not feel proud? Thanks to all of you who appreciate our work and assist us artisans with your purchases and microcredits, we've been able to grow. I think the best path I could have taken in life is the one that led me to you!" Use the link below to view Fernando's alpaca apparel on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/7883

loans.use: to purchase materials for his designs

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.en: Ana María is a Mexican artisan who specializes in decoupage home decor. She would like to purchase wood, paints, and solvents to increase production. Ana Maria has been selling through NOVICA since 2004. This is her story: "For as long as I can remember, I've been around arts and crafts. My whole family produced something, and when we'd visit our relatives, my cousins and I would make something for fun. After I married, my husband and I created various kinds of handicrafts, but I felt a need to make something. I began making decorative boxes, painted by hand with different finishes. Today I create boxes with antique motifs." "I am grateful for the opportunity to receive this microcredit. Thanks to your support, I'll be able to look after my team of artisans and also increase production." Use the link below to view Ana Maria's decoupage home decor on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/4592">http://www.novica.com/kiva/4592

loans.use: to purchase wood, paints, and solvents to increase production

loans.name: Claudia Maria

texts.es: Claudia de 31 años de edad habita en condiciones muy sencillas a lado de su compañero de vida y sus dos hijas de 5 y 3 años de edad. Para ella su familia lo es todo y se esfuerza por darles lo mejor cada día. Claudia se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pizza desde hace mucho tiempo. Este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos y junto a su compañero de vida mantienen la economía del hogar. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un cerco perimetral para lo cual necesita materiales como: tela metálica, postes de cemento, arena, graba, hierro, y ladrillo. Espera poder contar con el apoyo del préstamo.
texts.en: Claudia is 31 years old and lives a simple life with her life’s partner and two daughters, ages 5 and 3.  Family is everything for her and she works daily to provide them with the best.  Claudia has been making and selling pizza for a long time.  This business is her main source of income and is how she and her partner maintain their household finances.  She is asking for a loan through FUSAI so she can build a perimeter fence and buy materials such as chain link fencing, cement posts, sand, gravel, and bricks.  She hopes to get this loan.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy is 26 years old and is married with one child. She lives in Carmen, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Ivy works fattening hogs and she earns approximately 7,000 PHP each month. She has been a member of PMPC for one year.

Ivy is requesting a loan to purchase sacks of feed for her hog-fattening business. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of feed

loans.name: Nasandelger

texts.en:
Nasandelger is 45 years old and has two children. She lives in a ger, a traditional nomadic tent, in Arhangai province, Mongolia. For many years, Nasandelger has worked providing painted and decorated ger parts to order from her home. Her children are studying at universities in Ulaanbaatar city and help their mother during their vacations. Nasandelger is a very talented and hardworking woman who is trying to support her children to obtain a higher education and live better lives in future. 

Nasandelger is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to pay her children's university tuition fees and living expenses in Ulaanbaatar city.

loans.use: to pay her children's university tuition fees and living expenses

loans.name: Katharina

texts.en:
After moving to the U.S. from Germany in April 2010, Katharina saw the change in location as a signal for a long-desired change in profession. She was hoping to finally pursue her passion for dogs and establish herself as a businesswoman in her new homeland. When she met Jason, who shared her passion and had over 15 years of experience in dog training, the pair decided to embark on a joint dog-training venture in Jacksonville, Florida.

In March 2012, Katharina and Jason founded Karma K9 and, since then, have been dedicated to helping their busy Jacksonville clients keep their four-legged friends happy and healthy. 

Katharina and Jason are hoping to add more members to their two-person team, strengthen their marketing strategy, and expand their support of non-profit causes and organizations. They hope to work with Veterans and provide service dogs for wounded service men and others in need. 

Fulfilling these goals would be a deeply satisfying accomplishment, both personally and professionally, for Katharina and Jason.

Check out Katharina’s business: www.karma-k9.com.

loans.use: To strengthen marketing strategy and pay for additional employees.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 54 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. For the past 15 years, she has been vending food in the Philippines. Jocelyn is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Jocelyn is requesting a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business

loans.name: Nohn

texts.en:
Nohn is 40 years old, and she has been living in Sanniquille, the capital city of Nimba County. It is rich in natural resources, and the living conditions are much better than the capital city of Liberia. It is the second largest populated county in Liberia. 

She did not go to school, and traditionally, she is married to a local businessman. They have four children whose ages are between 8 months old and 26 years old. Three of her children are in school, and four live at home. Her husband gave her money to start this business. For three years now, she has been running this business, selling salt, onion, rice, oil, and other food items. She spends 10 hours on her business, from Monday to Saturday. A problem she faces is that she does not have a shop. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more salt, onion, rice, oil and other food items for her business. Her plan is to one day to build a modern house.

loans.use: to purchase more salt, onion, rice, oil and other food items for her business.

loans.name: Iracema

texts.es: La Señora Iracema sigue con la misma actividad de la venta de comida en su puesto de venta ya que con el anterior crédito lo pudo comprar, cuenta que le fue muy bien con el anterior crédito, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como abarrotes por mayor como arroz y fideos  y así seguir mejorando su negocio y por ende sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Iracema continues to sell food from the stall she was able to buy with her previous loan and she says that things went very well with it.  She is asking for a new loan so she can buy ingredients such rice and noodles so she can continue improving her business and income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Marilia

texts.es:
Marilia vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, para poder salir adelante logro iniciar hace 2 años su pequeño negocio de venta de productos de belleza, con lo cual tiene un ingreso para poder salir adelante,

Marilia esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar más mercadería a su negocio como perfumes, maquillaje, cremas y también podrá realizar un mantenimiento a su pequeña movilidad con la cual reparte sus productos a sus clientes; de esta manera ella podrá atender mejor a sus clientes, mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener un loca propio y poder estudiar una carrera universitaria”.
texts.en:
Marilia lives in the city of Pucallpa. In order to get ahead she started a small business selling beauty products two years ago. This has given her the income to get ahead.

Marilia is pleased with the lenders from Kiva as thanks to their help she can buy more merchandise for her business like perfume, make-up and creams. As well she can do some maintenance on a small vehicle she uses to distribute her products to her clients. In this way she can server her clients better, increase her revenues and continue to struggle to fulfill her big dream, which is to have her own store and to be able to study at university.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and repair a vehicle.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy more products for her variety store, which she has had for ten years now. Her loan also was helpful for the education of her children. Cristita’s business income is supporting her family’s everyday household expenditures. She and her husband work hard to provide for their family’s everyday expenses.
 
Cristita is requesting another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at her store the better as more items to sell will result in better profit. Cristita’s business profits will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and provide for her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

In the future, Cristita hopes to expand her business and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from fellowship and studying the the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages for her business

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
In the past, Christina and her husband's source of income was working for someone who had a farm or working as a laborer. When they had enough earnings, Christina and her husband decided to sell eggs in the market. 

While running the business earns a profit, they use their earnings as revolving capital to expand their business and meet all their customers' demands on time. Now, she is an egg dealer in the market and sells some grocery items. She wishes to own a delivery truck that will they will use for their business. She's asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more eggs and grocery items to sell. She hopes to attain her business and become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy more eggs and grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma is requesting a new 23,000 PHP loan to buy seafood to sell to customers. Her fish vending business was previously funded through the Kiva partner NWTF. Alma hopes that her business will continue to provide her and her family with an increasing income to uplift their living standards.

loans.use: to buy seafood to sell to customers

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is married and works hard to support her family. She is a rice farmer in the Philippines. Rubina has been sustaining her business with her past 21 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva.

Rubina is requesting a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is 52 years old and the married mother of four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Felisa has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Dúo Dina Group

texts.es:
DUO DINA

integrado por doña María Alberta quien es casada, tiene 5 hijos, y tiene 35 años de edad, nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de canastas desde hace 15 años y los va a vender a la terminal en la capital, y por eso solicita este crédito porque quiere comprar diferentes estilos de canastas ya que por la temporada navideña y el día de los santos, las canastas se comienzan a vender para hacer arreglos florales, y para diferentes actividades piden canastas grandes, esperando que ustedes le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en:
The group "DUO DINA" is composed of two people. One of them is María Alberta who is 35 years old, married and has five children. She tells us that she has been selling baskets for the past 15 years. She will sell them at the terminal in Guatemala City.

María Alberta is requesting a loan as she wants to buy different styles of baskets. As the Christmas season and the Saint's days are approaching, people are starting to buy baskets to make floral arrangements. And they are asking for large baskets for various activities. María Alberta hopes you can help her with the requested loan.

loans.use: to buy baskets to re-sell.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
22 years ago, Omar came to the United States from Colombia with the hopes of forging a better future for his family. As a Colombian, he understands the bond that immigrants still have with their own countries—especially when family members are left behind in their native countries. Families in the US often send packages of products and presents to relatives who remain in their former homelands.  

Discovering that ever-present need, Omar founded Envio Express a package/parcel shipping services where the quality of services and the rapidness of delivery have been the key to his current success. Omar previously worked in the shipping and packing industry and has been able to apply all of the skills he learned at his previous place of work. Omar has no employees and manages the business entirely on his own. His biggest difficulty so far has been a lack of cash-flow. 

Omar hopes to obtain a loan to purchase a new computer and build a website in order to reach potential clients.

loans.use: To purchase a new computer and build a website in order to reach potential clients.

loans.name: Chhoeurm

texts.en:
Chhoeurm is 59 years old. He is married and resides with three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. He has been cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $2 per day. His wife helps him run the business. One of his children is a gardener who makes an income of $3 each day. 

Choeurm asks for a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help him reduce his transportation expenses. In the future, he would like to expand his farming business and help his children gain a higher education.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 43 years old and has one child attending school . She and her husband aim to improve their status of living in order to educate their child and give him a bright future. In this regard, she plans to improve her small variety store in order to increase her income. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000.00  to buy additional stocks of snack foods, noodles, beverages, soaps, seasonings, and beverages to sell. She believes that this loan will enable her to further improve the business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of snack foods, noodles, beverages, soaps, seasonings, and beverages to sell

loans.name: Benedictor

texts.en:
Benedictor, 51 years of age, is married and blessed with three children. He has managed an agricultural business for almost thirty years and earned a net income of 30,000 PHP last harvest season. His profits were spent on the electric bills, payments of a motorcycle, and food expenses for the family. 

Due to financial constraints he has decided to avail a loan to those generous lenders, amounting to 25,000 PHP, to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers, seedlings, and insecticides. He's hoping that his requested loan will be granted so that he can be able to acquire more farm inputs for his rice farm.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers, seedlings, and insecticides.

loans.name: Gigi

texts.en:
Gigi's dream is to become a distributor of grocery items in different villages that have a store. Her goal is to gain bigger earnings in order to build their own house. 

Gigi started her business with a small retail store. Gradually, her business became a wholesaler of breads and other grocery items in the market. Borrowing a loan of PHP 25,000 will be her stepping stone towards achieving her dreams and attaining her goal. She will use the loan to buy a volume of grocery items to sell to her customers. Buying groceries in bulk, she will get big discounts and she considers this as her income. She hopes to fulfill her dreams and to attain her goal in life.

loans.use: to buy a volume of grocery items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes first moved to the United States from Cuba 13 years ago. It was five years ago that Mercedes founded Supreme Power Janitorial Service, Inc.—a corporate cleaning company. Four years ago, she obtained a contract to work for UPS Air Cargo.

She is in charge of all the cleaning maintenance for UPS at the Miami airport, including their warehouse and storage facilities. Since she is contracted by UPS and works at the airport, she runs a very formal business and must comply with strict regulation with the Federal Aviation Agency and Homeland Security, proving proper documentation and background checks on all of her employees. She currently manages 12 employees.

Mercedes uses her earnings to support her parents and her two younger children. She had always dreamed of being a business owner and is now working towards expanding her business. Mercedes hopes to obtain a loan in order to increase her cash flow and be able to purchase the necessary equipment to expand into other cleaning services.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary equipment to expand into other cleaning services.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
Jorge came to the United States just four years ago. Although he is Cuban, he had been living in Spain for the last twelve years. In that time, he opened AFORCEGROUP Inc., a company that does electrical consulting and installation. Jorge goes to his clients’ sites, inspects them, and suggests what electrical model they should have and what light bulbs to use. He then sells the products and installs them for his clients. His clients include: homes, offices, shopping centers, and shops, among others. 

Jorge is passionate about the environment and provides his clients with opportunities to be more “green.” He says, “I think it's a good idea for any company to try and be as sustainable as possible—to contaminate the environment as little as possible. I want to be able to demonstrate to my clients the need to make the change from traditional energies to clean energy.” 

Jorge’s biggest difficult so far has been cash-flow—he wants to build a website in order to better promote his business and buy more inventory in order to work on larger projects. Jorge supports his wife and their two children. He hopes to grow his business so that he may be able to send his daughters to college someday.

loans.use: To pay for the inventory to start greater projects that will expand his business.

loans.name: Girlyn

texts.en:
Girlyn studies towards a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration at Stella Maris College, Oroquieta City. Her parents are making a living from their farm earnings. She has two siblings who live with the family. 

Girlyn want to prove that poverty can never be a hindrance to success and she always finds ways to continue studying. She joined GDMPC and has requested a loan to pay the school tuition fees for the second semester. In the future, Girlyn wants to have a better career and be able to help the entire family.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fees for the second semester.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of four children, Marjorie works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling frozen foods  in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling clothing. Marjorie is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of frozen foods to sell.

Marjorie has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth appreciates her previous loan, from Kiva, that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She is requesting for a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Tara

texts.en:
Tara always dreamed of instilling in children a love of education through fun and games.  So, while pursuing her MBA at Rutgers Newark, she worked with her professors on creating an “edu-tainment” business—Brick City Bricks for Kidz. 

Her program builds on children’s STEM (science, technology, engineering and math) skills through games meant to excite and involve. In one example, kids use lego bricks to construct buildings and machines, all the while exercising their creativity. 

Tara’s business will aim towards Newark-area kids ages tots to early teens, whether they’re having birthday parties or are involved in after-school programs. With the help of her professors and this microloan, she will make a positive impact on the lives of Newark children.

Tara will use this loan to purchase supplies. She will purchase boxes; lego bricks; and binding machines, which she uses to make her own lego model plan books.

loans.use: To purchase educational supplies for an innovative education program

loans.name: Allah Rakhi's Group

texts.en:
Allah Rakhi lives in Lahore, Pakistan and she is a member of this two-person lending group. She has a large family and belongs to a deprived family. She has six daughters and four sons. Her husband is a very hardworking person. He is the only earning person in the family. He puts all his efforts towards fulfilling the needs of his family. 

Allah Rakhi's husband owns an artificial jewellery shop which is the only source of income for the family. Her husband wants to purchase a variety of jewellery for the shop, that includes bangles, necklace, rings, bracelets. Therefore, Allah Rakhi has requested for a loan, from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan, to purchase artificial jewellery for her husband's shop. She is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for the business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of jewellery items for the shop (bangles, necklace, rings, bracelets).

loans.name: Kal

texts.en: Kal is 22 years old. He is single and resides with his parents in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. He has been working in construction for more than a year, earning approximately $5 per day.  To improve his transportation, Kal is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase a motorbike to use to commute to work. This purchase will help him easily get to work on time. In the future, he would like to run an additional business after he gets married.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute to work
